original: 'dod chags la sogs pa de'i rtsa ba can yang goms pa de nyid las yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa de'i rtsa ba can yang goms pa de nyid las yin gyi /
translated: And the roots of desire, etc. are also due to that habituation,

original: gzhan du ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du ma yin no //
translated: not from anything else.

original: don dam pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no ultimate cause.

original: gal te goms pa yang rgyu ma yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te goms pa yang rgyu ma yin na ni /
translated: If habituation is not a cause,

original: rgyu med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: then they would be causeless.

original: rgyu med par skye ba ni tha dad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu med par skye ba ni tha dad pa ma yin no //
translated: And there is no arising without a cause.

original: 'on te yang 'dod chags la sogs pa goms pa las skyes pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on te yang 'dod chags la sogs pa goms pa las skyes pa ni ma yin te /
translated: But desire, etc. do not arise from habituation,

original: 'on kyang rlung la sogs pa las skyes pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang rlung la sogs pa las skyes pa yin no //
translated: but rather from wind, etc.

original: 'di ltar rlung gi rang bzhin las ni gti mug / mkhris pa'i rang bzhin las ni zhe sdang / bad kan gyi rang bzhin las ni 'dod chags yin no //🔽rtsa ba'i nyes pa bzhin du phrag dog la sogs pa'i nyes pa gzhan yang /
analyzed: 'di ltar rlung gi rang bzhin las ni gti mug / mkhris pa'i rang bzhin las ni zhe sdang / bad kan gyi rang bzhin las ni 'dod chags yin no // rtsa ba'i nyes pa bzhin du phrag dog la sogs pa'i nyes pa gzhan yang /
translated: Thus, delusion arises from the nature of wind, hatred from the nature of bile, and desire from the nature of phlegm.

original: rlung la sogs pa las skyes pa yin no //
analyzed: rlung la sogs pa las skyes pa yin no //
translated: Just as with the fundamental vices, so also the other vices such as envy arise from wind, etc.

original: rlung la sogs pa yang don dam pa nyid du yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rlung la sogs pa yang don dam pa nyid du yod pa ma yin te /
translated: And wind, etc. do not exist ultimately.

original: rgyu de las skyes pa'i phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa ni don dam pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu de las skyes pa'i phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa ni don dam pa yin no zhe na /
translated: Attachment, etc. are ultimate because they arise from that cause.

original: de yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang ma yin te /
translated: That is not so,

original: 'khrul phyir rlung sogs chos ma yin //
analyzed: 'khrul phyir rlung sogs chos ma yin //
translated: because of error. Wind, etc. are not its properties.

original: gal te @113a * //
analyzed: gal te @113a * //
translated: If you do not have this,🔽

original: rang bzhin 'dres pa'i phyir //
analyzed: rang bzhin 'dres pa'i phyir //
translated: attachment, etc. were the properties of wind, etc.,

original: skyon med ce na de yi chos //
analyzed: skyon med ce na de yi chos //
translated: then they would not be erroneous with respect to them,🔽like fire and smoke.🔽But that is not so.

original: de las gzhan yang cis mi mthong //🔽gang zhig gang gi rgyu can yin pa de ni /
analyzed: de las gzhan yang cis mi mthong // gang zhig gang gi rgyu can yin pa de ni /
translated: Therefore, they are the opposite.

original: de la mi 'khrul ba yin te /
analyzed: de la mi 'khrul ba yin te /
translated: That which is the cause of something is not erroneous with respect to it,

original: me la du ba bzhin no //
analyzed: me la du ba bzhin no //
translated: like fire and smoke.🔽If attachment, etc. were the properties of wind, etc., then they would not be erroneous with respect to them.

original: gal te gti mug la sogs pa rlung la sogs pa'i chos yin na de'i phyir de la 'khrul par mi 'gyur na de lta yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te gti mug la sogs pa rlung la sogs pa'i chos yin na de'i phyir de la 'khrul par mi 'gyur na de lta yang ma yin te /
translated: But that is not so.

original: des na bzlog pa yin no //🔽'on te rlung gi rang bzhin la 'dod chags skyed par byed pa dang zhe sdang skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin gzhan yang yod pa yin te /
analyzed: des na bzlog pa yin no // 'on te rlung gi rang bzhin la 'dod chags skyed par byed pa dang zhe sdang skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin gzhan yang yod pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, they are the opposite.

original: de las 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dag yin no //
analyzed: de las 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dag yin no //
translated: But if the nature of wind is to generate attachment and the nature of wind is to generate aversion, then why does one not see attachment and aversion in other things that are of the same nature as wind?

original: des na rang bzhin dang 'dres pa'i phyir 'khrul pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: des na rang bzhin dang 'dres pa'i phyir 'khrul pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, since it is mixed with the nature, it is not an error.

original: de yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang ma yin te /
translated: That is also not so.

original: rgyu yod na ni de yi chos //
analyzed: rgyu yod na ni de yi chos //
translated: If there is a cause, then it has that property.

original: de las gzhan yang ci phyir med //
analyzed: de las gzhan yang ci phyir med //
translated: Why is there not something else from that?

original: de yi 'bras bu med na ni //
analyzed: de yi 'bras bu med na ni //
translated: If there is no effect of that,

original: rgyu yod pa ni ga las rtogs //
analyzed: rgyu yod pa ni ga las rtogs //
translated: how is the existence of the cause understood?

original: gal te de nyid de yi ni //
analyzed: gal te de nyid de yi ni //
translated: If that itself is its effect,

original: 'bras yin 'bras gzhan ga las yin //
analyzed: 'bras yin 'bras gzhan ga las yin //
translated: how is there another effect?

original: gal te de nyid las na 'dir //
analyzed: gal te de nyid las na 'dir //
translated: If it is from that itself,

original: de yod phyir de ci phyir min //
analyzed: de yod phyir de ci phyir min //
translated: why is it not from that here, since it exists?

original: gal te 'bras de gzhan las ni //
analyzed: gal te 'bras de gzhan las ni //
translated: If that effect is from another,

original: 'khrul par 'gyur ba de nyid yin //
analyzed: 'khrul par 'gyur ba de nyid yin //
translated: that itself is an error.

original: de'i phyir gal te rlung la sogs pa'i chos yin na 'khrul par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir gal te rlung la sogs pa'i chos yin na 'khrul par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, if it is a property of wind, etc., it is not an error.

original: rang bzhin de la rang bzhin gzhan yang rtog na ni 'bras bu yang brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin de la rang bzhin gzhan yang rtog na ni 'bras bu yang brtag par bya'o //
translated: If one imagines another nature in that nature, then one should imagine an effect.

original: 'bras bu ma mthong bas brtag pa ma yin na /
analyzed: 'bras bu ma mthong bas brtag pa ma yin na /
translated: If it is not imagined because the effect is not seen,

original: rang bzhin gzhan yang mi brtag go //
analyzed: rang bzhin gzhan yang mi brtag go //
translated: then another nature should not be imagined.

original: ji ltar 'bras bu las rgyu rtog pa de bzhin du 'bras bu yang rgyu nus pa thogs pa med pa las yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar 'bras bu las rgyu rtog pa de bzhin du 'bras bu yang rgyu nus pa thogs pa med pa las yin no //
translated: Just as the cause is imagined from the effect, so too the effect is from the cause.

original: 'on te nus pa thogs pa med pa'i rgyu med na /
analyzed: 'on te nus pa thogs pa med pa'i rgyu med na /
translated: But if the effect is not from a cause that is unobstructed in its ability,

original: mthong ba'i 'bras bu yang rgyu med par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mthong ba'i 'bras bu yang rgyu med par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then the effect that is seen would not be without a cause.

original: yang na de'i rgyu nyid du mi 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: yang na de'i rgyu nyid du mi 'gyur ro ;
translated: Or else, it would not be the cause of that.

original: / gzhan yang /
analyzed: / gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover,

original: gal te mthong ba'i rgyu spangs nas //
analyzed: gal te mthong ba'i rgyu spangs nas //
translated: If, having abandoned the cause of seeing,

original: ma mthong ba ni rtog byed na //
analyzed: ma mthong ba ni rtog byed na //
translated: you imagine the cause of non-seeing,

original: bad kan 'dod chags rgyu nyid du //
analyzed: bad kan 'dod chags rgyu nyid du //
translated: then phlegm would not be the cause of desire,

original: mi 'gyur gzhan ni brtag par gyis //
analyzed: mi 'gyur gzhan ni brtag par gyis //
translated: so imagine something else.

original: 'on te yang gang dang gang mthong ba de dang de nyid 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rgyu yin na /
analyzed: 'on te yang gang dang gang mthong ba de dang de nyid 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rgyu yin na /
translated: But if whatever is seen is the cause of desire and so on,

original: 'o na 'dod chags la sogs pa thams cad las mthong bas /
analyzed: 'o na 'dod chags la sogs pa thams cad las mthong bas /
translated: then since everything is seen from desire and so on,

original: ci thams cad de'i rgyu yin nam /
analyzed: ci thams cad de'i rgyu yin nam /
translated: is everything its cause?

original: de ni de lta yin te /
analyzed: de ni de lta yin te /
translated: That is so,

original: de lta bu nyid du mthong ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de lta bu nyid du mthong ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because it is seen in just that way.

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so,

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: because

original: thams cad 'dod chags mtshungs pa ni //
analyzed: thams cad 'dod chags mtshungs pa ni //
translated: All are equal in desire,

original: thal phyir kun gyi chos ma yin //
analyzed: thal phyir kun gyi chos ma yin //
translated: so it is not a property of all.

original: gzugs sogs bzhin skyon med ce na //
analyzed: gzugs sogs bzhin skyon med ce na //
translated: If you say, “There is no fault, like form, etc.,”

original: gal te @113b de la khyad par can //
analyzed: gal te @113b de la khyad par can //
translated: then, if it is special,

original: las rnams bdag po ma yin na //
analyzed: las rnams bdag po ma yin na //
translated: actions are not the lord.

original: de yang rtsod pa mtshungs pa yin //
analyzed: de yang rtsod pa mtshungs pa yin //
translated: That is also the same as the dispute.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa thams cad kyi chos yin na ni /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa thams cad kyi chos yin na ni /
translated: If it is the property of all, such as desire,

original: srog chags thams cad 'ga' zhig tu 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: srog chags thams cad 'ga' zhig tu 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: then all living beings would be some.

original: des na bad kan la sogs pa gang yod pa de nyid 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: des na bad kan la sogs pa gang yod pa de nyid 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, since that which has phlegm, etc. is the basis of desire, etc.,

original: 'dod chags mtshungs pa thal bar 'gyur ro //🔽'di ltar / chags sogs rang bzhin thams cad kyi //
analyzed: 'dod chags mtshungs pa thal bar 'gyur ro // 'di ltar / chags sogs rang bzhin thams cad kyi //
translated: it follows that desire is equal.🔽Thus,

original: chos yin par ni 'dod na go //
analyzed: chos yin par ni 'dod na go //
translated: if you assert that desire, etc. are the property of all natures,

original: nus byed rang bzhin med pas na //
analyzed: nus byed rang bzhin med pas na //
translated: then, since the nature of the agent is nonexistent,

original: 'bras bu mi mtshungs ga las yin //
analyzed: 'bras bu mi mtshungs ga las yin //
translated: how could the result be unequal?

original: gang gi tshe 'dod chags la sogs pa rang bzhin thams cad las 'byung bar 'dod pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'dod chags la sogs pa rang bzhin thams cad las 'byung bar 'dod pa de'i tshe /
translated: When desire, etc. are asserted to arise from all natures,🔽then, since the nature of the agent is nonexistent, how could the result be unequal?

original: bad kan la sogs pa'i rang bzhin dang / de 'phel ba dang 'grib pa yang /
analyzed: bad kan la sogs pa'i rang bzhin dang / de 'phel ba dang 'grib pa yang /
translated: and the nature of phlegm, etc., and the increase and decrease of those,

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa mtshungs pa nyid bzlog par mi nus so //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa mtshungs pa nyid bzlog par mi nus so //
translated: are the cause of attachment, etc., therefore attachment, etc., cannot be reversed.

original: 'on te rang bzhin thams cad yin yang khyad par gzhan yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on te rang bzhin thams cad yin yang khyad par gzhan yod pa'i phyir /
translated: But if all natures are the cause of attachment, etc.,

original: 'dod chags mtshungs pa nyid ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'dod chags mtshungs pa nyid ma yin no zhe na /
translated: then attachment, etc., cannot be the same.

original: 'o na ni de'i tshe khyad par de thams cad kyi rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'o na ni de'i tshe khyad par de thams cad kyi rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: But at that time, since that distinction is not the cause of all,

original: thams cad kyi chos ma yin no //
analyzed: thams cad kyi chos ma yin no //
translated: it is not the nature of all.

original: ci ste yang bad kan la sogs pa rang bzhin thams cad rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ci ste yang bad kan la sogs pa rang bzhin thams cad rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
translated: But if phlegm, etc., are the cause of all natures,

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa thams cad kyi chos yin la /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa thams cad kyi chos yin la /
translated: then attachment, etc., are the nature of all.

original: de dag nyid nang gi yongs su gyur pa'i bye brag las ni /
analyzed: de dag nyid nang gi yongs su gyur pa'i bye brag las ni /
translated: But from the specific transformation of those,

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa mtshungs pa nyid ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa mtshungs pa nyid ma yin no zhe na /
translated: attachment, etc., are not the same.

original: de yang gyi na ste /
analyzed: de yang gyi na ste /
translated: That also is not correct.

original: rnam par 'gyur ba'i khyad par gang //
analyzed: rnam par 'gyur ba'i khyad par gang //
translated: What is the distinction of transformation?

original: ji ltar nye bar dmigs gyur pa //
analyzed: ji ltar nye bar dmigs gyur pa //
translated: Whatever is observed as a specific transformation

original: de la yang ni 'khrul nyid ces //
analyzed: de la yang ni 'khrul nyid ces //
translated: is itself delusion.

original: yang dag par ni bsten pa yin //🔽rnam par 'gyur ba'i khyad par gang zhig rgyu gang las 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rgyur nye bar dmigs pa de nyid gang gi tshe /
analyzed: yang dag par ni bsten pa yin // rnam par 'gyur ba'i khyad par gang zhig rgyu gang las 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rgyur nye bar dmigs pa de nyid gang gi tshe /
translated: This is the correct position.🔽Whatever specific transformation is observed as the cause of attachment and so on, when that is also the cause of aversion and so on, then at that time, when it is established as the reality of all, it is also established as the cause of all specific transformations of attachment and so on.

original: zhe sdang la sogs pa'i yang yin pas 'khrug pa de'i tshe thams cad kyi chos nyid du bsgrub pa na 'dod chags la sogs pa'i khyad par thams cad kyi rgyu can du yang bsgrub par 'gyur ba'i phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa mtshungs pa nyid du gsal ba
analyzed: zhe sdang la sogs pa'i yang yin pas 'khrug pa de'i tshe thams cad kyi chos nyid du bsgrub pa na 'dod chags la sogs pa'i khyad par thams cad kyi rgyu can du yang bsgrub par 'gyur ba'i phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa mtshungs pa nyid du gsal ba
translated: Therefore attachment and so on are clearly equivalent.

original: yin no // des na yongs su gyur pa'i khyad par las so zhes bya ba 'di rgyur mi 'thad de /
analyzed: yin no // des na yongs su gyur pa'i khyad par las so zhes bya ba 'di rgyur mi 'thad de /
translated: Thus it is untenable to state that a specific transformation is the cause,

original: de yang 'dod chags la sogs pa khyad par thams cad kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽'on te 'bras bu'i @114a * //
analyzed: de yang 'dod chags la sogs pa khyad par thams cad kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽'on te 'bras bu'i @114a * //
translated: because that is the cause of all specific transformations of attachment and so on.🔽If you say that a specific transformation is the result of attachment and so on,🔽then it is untenable that it is the cause of attachment and so on,🔽because it is the result of attachment and so on.

original: khyad par gyi dpag par bya ba la yongs su gyur pa'i khyad par mi mthong ba nyid 'dod chags la sogs pa mi tshol ba'i rgyu yin no zhe na /
analyzed: khyad par gyi dpag par bya ba la yongs su gyur pa'i khyad par mi mthong ba nyid 'dod chags la sogs pa mi tshol ba'i rgyu yin no zhe na /
translated: In particular, the cause of not seeking out attachment, etc. is the non-perception of the transformation of the particular thing to be inferred.

original: de yang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: de yang mi 'thad de /
translated: But that is not tenable.🔽For example:

original: 'di ltar / me ma mthong ba'i du ba gang //
analyzed: 'di ltar / me ma mthong ba'i du ba gang //
translated: That smoke which is not seen as fire

original: de ni me rgyu can mi 'gyur //
analyzed: de ni me rgyu can mi 'gyur //
translated: is not a cause of fire.

original: sa phyogs nyid kyi khyad par ni ;🔽/'ga' de du ba'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: sa phyogs nyid kyi khyad par ni ; /'ga' de du ba'i rgyu yin no //
translated: The particular of the place itself🔽is the cause of the smoke.

original: du ba me yul na zhe na //
analyzed: du ba me yul na zhe na //
translated: If it is said that the smoke is in the place of fire,

original: gzhan la khyad par de med pa //
analyzed: gzhan la khyad par de med pa //
translated: that particular is not in another.

original: des na khyad par dang bral bas //
analyzed: des na khyad par dang bral bas //
translated: Therefore, being devoid of the particular,

original: du ba gzhan na med pa yin //
analyzed: du ba gzhan na med pa yin //
translated: the smoke is not in another.

original: gal te thams cad kyi tshe ma mthong ba'i khyad par yang 'bras bu mthong ba tsam las brtags pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te thams cad kyi tshe ma mthong ba'i khyad par yang 'bras bu mthong ba tsam las brtags pa yin na /
translated: If the particular of the non-perception at all times is imagined from the mere perception of the effect,

original: 'o na thams cad du rgyu dang 'bras bu'i so sor nges par nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na thams cad du rgyu dang 'bras bu'i so sor nges par nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: then the individual determination of cause and effect is lost in all cases.

original: 'on te der ni khyad par rtogs par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on te der ni khyad par rtogs par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: But if it is said that the particular is not realized there,

original: mthong ba'i me rtogs pas gnod pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: mthong ba'i me rtogs pas gnod pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because it is contradicted by the realization of the seen fire,

original: 'o na der yang mthong ba'i goms pas brtag par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: 'o na der yang mthong ba'i goms pas brtag par bya ba yin te /
translated: But even so, it is still to be investigated whether the elements are the cause of form, etc.

original: yongs su 'gyur ba'i khyad par brtags par ni mi 'thad do //🔽gal te gzugs la sogs pa 'byung ba'i rgyu can 'dod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: yongs su 'gyur ba'i khyad par brtags par ni mi 'thad do // gal te gzugs la sogs pa 'byung ba'i rgyu can 'dod pa ma yin nam /
translated: It is not tenable that the elements are investigated as having a special transformation.🔽Don’t you accept that form, etc., have the elements as their cause?

original: de lta na yang 'byung bar khyad par med par khyad par du 'gyur ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na yang 'byung bar khyad par med par khyad par du 'gyur ba yin no zhe na /
translated: Even if that is so, the elements would be the cause of form, etc., without any distinction.

original: rtsod pa 'di yang khyed nyid la yod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: rtsod pa 'di yang khyed nyid la yod pa yin gyi /
translated: This objection is yours alone,

original: bdag la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag la ni ma yin te /
translated: not mine.

original: las bdag por 'gyur ba khyad par gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las bdag por 'gyur ba khyad par gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The karma that is the dominant condition is the special cause.

original: de lta ma yin na ni de dag kyang phyogs su byed pa yin pas des ma nges pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ni de dag kyang phyogs su byed pa yin pas des ma nges pa ma yin no //
translated: Otherwise, since they would be the cause of everything, they would not be indeterminate.

original: skyon rnams khyad par yod na yang //
analyzed: skyon rnams khyad par yod na yang //
translated: Even if there were a special cause of the faults,

original: khyad par med phyir ma grub nyid //🔽ma yin thams cad 'gyur ba yis //
analyzed: khyad par med phyir ma grub nyid // ma yin thams cad 'gyur ba yis //
translated: it would not be established because there is no distinction.🔽It is not so, because all would be produced from everything,

original: 'gyur phyir kun las skyes pa'ang min //
analyzed: 'gyur phyir kun las skyes pa'ang min //
translated: because of the fault of over-extension.

original: rgyu ni 'phel bar 'gyur ba na //
analyzed: rgyu ni 'phel bar 'gyur ba na //
translated: When the cause increases,

original: 'bras bu 'grib pa mi rung ste //
analyzed: 'bras bu 'grib pa mi rung ste //
translated: it is not tenable that the effect decreases.

original: tsha ba sogs bzhin chags sogs kyi //
analyzed: tsha ba sogs bzhin chags sogs kyi //
translated: Like heat, etc., the changes of attachment, etc.

original: 'gyur ba bde sogs las skyes yin //
analyzed: 'gyur ba bde sogs las skyes yin //
translated: Arise from pleasure, etc.

original: ji skad du rgyu gzhan yod na yang 'bras bu gzhan mthong ba gang yin pa de ni khyad par yod pa yin pa'i phyir mthong ba'i khyad par rtogs pa yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur mod /
analyzed: ji skad du rgyu gzhan yod na yang 'bras bu gzhan mthong ba gang yin pa de ni khyad par yod pa yin pa'i phyir mthong ba'i khyad par rtogs pa yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur mod /
translated: If you say that when another cause exists, another effect is seen, then it is because there is a difference that the difference in the seen is understood.

original: gang gi tshe bad kan 'phel ba de'i tshe rgyu 'phel ba yin pa'i phyir 'bras bu'i 'phel ba ji ltar bzlog / der yang de las gzhan ba'i khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe bad kan 'phel ba de'i tshe rgyu 'phel ba yin pa'i phyir 'bras bu'i 'phel ba ji ltar bzlog / der yang de las gzhan ba'i khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: But when phlegm increases, then because the cause increases, how can the increase of the effect be averted?

original: de lta na ni 'on te khyad par rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por 'dzin par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: de lta na ni 'on te khyad par rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por 'dzin par ga la 'gyur /
translated: And in that case, because there is no difference from that, how can the effect be apprehended as a real entity?

original: mthong ba'i khyad par ni mi mthong @114b bar rigs pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba'i khyad par ni mi mthong @114b bar rigs pa yang ma yin no //
translated: And it is not reasonable that the difference in the seen is not seen.🔽Therefore:

original: de'i phyir / de yi khyad las khyad par du //
analyzed: de'i phyir / de yi khyad las khyad par du //
translated: If the difference is apprehended from that,

original: 'dzin na 'bras nyid 'dzin par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'dzin na 'bras nyid 'dzin par 'gyur //
translated: the effect itself is apprehended.

original: de las khyad par yod min na //
analyzed: de las khyad par yod min na //
translated: If there is no difference from that,

original: 'bras sogs nyid du ga la 'dzin //
analyzed: 'bras sogs nyid du ga la 'dzin //

original: gal te khyad par med pa'i phyir bya ba'i gtan tshigs ma grub ste /
analyzed: gal te khyad par med pa'i phyir bya ba'i gtan tshigs ma grub ste /
translated: If you say that the reason “because of the absence of difference” is not established,

original: mkhris pa 'phel na de ni sdug bsngal gyis gdungs pa de'i zhe sdang 'phel ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: mkhris pa 'phel na de ni sdug bsngal gyis gdungs pa de'i zhe sdang 'phel ba'i phyir ro zhe na /

original: ma grub pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: ma grub pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: It is not the case that it is not established,

original: bad kan la sogs pa thams cad kyi 'phel pas gnod pas zhe sdang skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bad kan la sogs pa thams cad kyi 'phel pas gnod pas zhe sdang skye ba'i phyir ro //

original: rang bzhin gyis zhe sdang chung ba la mi 'byung ba yang yin no zhe na /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis zhe sdang chung ba la mi 'byung ba yang yin no zhe na /

original: 'di ni rang mkhris pa 'phel pa la mtshungs pa'i phyir brjed par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni rang mkhris pa 'phel pa la mtshungs pa'i phyir brjed par bya ba ma yin no //

original: 'on te thams cad las skye ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te thams cad las skye ba yin no zhe na /

original: de yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: de yang mi rigs te /

original: thams cad las skyes pa nyid kyang ma yin no zhes bshad zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad las skyes pa nyid kyang ma yin no zhes bshad zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has already been explained that it does not arise from everything.

original: gzhan yang gal te khyad par gzhan yod du chug pa de lta na yang khyad par des byas pa'i khyad par med mod /
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te khyad par gzhan yod du chug pa de lta na yang khyad par des byas pa'i khyad par med mod /

original: 'bras bu 'grib pa go ga las yin /
analyzed: 'bras bu 'grib pa go ga las yin /
translated: How can the effect be diminished?

original: gang gi phyir rgyu 'phel na 'bras bu 'phel ba nyid du rigs kyi 'grib par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rgyu 'phel na 'bras bu 'phel ba nyid du rigs kyi 'grib par ni ma yin no //
translated: Because if the cause increases, the effect should increase, not diminish.

original: de lta ma yin na ni de de'i rgyur mi 'gyur ro zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ni de de'i rgyur mi 'gyur ro zhes bshad zin to //

original: dper na tsha ba la sogs pa mkhris pa 'phel na 'phel ba yin no //
analyzed: dper na tsha ba la sogs pa mkhris pa 'phel na 'phel ba yin no //

original: gal te zas bzhun po zos na bad kan dang 'brel pa las 'dod chags 'phel ba mthong ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te zas bzhun po zos na bad kan dang 'brel pa las 'dod chags 'phel ba mthong ba ma yin nam zhe na /

original: 'di ni med de /
analyzed: 'di ni med de /

analyzed: nad kyis gdungs pas zhe sdang nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa ni bde ba la sogs pa las skyes pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa ni bde ba la sogs pa las skyes pa yin gyi /

original: bad kan la sogs pa las byung ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bad kan la sogs pa las byung ba ni ma yin no //

original: bde ba la yang nang gi bag chags sad pa las 'ga' la rnam pa ji zhig ltar dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: bde ba la yang nang gi bag chags sad pa las 'ga' la rnam pa ji zhig ltar dmigs pa yin no //
translated: In the case of pleasure, it is sometimes the case that the object is perceived in a certain way due to the activation of internal habitual tendencies.

original: des na 'dod chags la sogs pa nyes pa dag las yin no zhes mi rigs so //
analyzed: des na 'dod chags la sogs pa nyes pa dag las yin no zhes mi rigs so //
translated: Therefore, it is not reasonable to say that desire and so on arise from faults.

original: gal te bad kan 'phel na 'dod chags ma yin pa de lta na yang de rgyu ma yin pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te bad kan 'phel na 'dod chags ma yin pa de lta na yang de rgyu ma yin pa ni ma yin te /

analyzed: cha ma snyoms pa las skyes pa'i sdug bsngal gyi nus pa gegs byas pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: gang gzhan gyis gegs byas na skyed par mi byed pa de rgyu ma yin pa ni ma yin te /

analyzed: thams cad rgyu ma yin par thal ba'i phyir ro zhe na /

original: 'di la yang brjod pa /🔽cha mi snyoms @115a * //
analyzed: 'di la yang brjod pa / cha mi snyoms @115a * //

original: skyes sdug bsngal gyis //
analyzed: skyes sdug bsngal gyis //

analyzed: gal te 'dod chags mi skyed na // cis skyes smros shig cha mnyam la //

analyzed: cha mi mnyam la chags can mthong //

analyzed: gzhan ni cha mnyam na yang min //

original: gzhan ni zad nas khrag 'dzag kyang //
analyzed: gzhan ni zad nas khrag 'dzag kyang //

analyzed: bud med gcig la khu nges med //

analyzed: des gcig la chags drag mi 'gyur //

analyzed: gal te bad kan la sogs pa cha mnyam pas 'gal ba'i nad med pa na khu ba 'phel ba la /

analyzed: de las 'dod chags skye ba yin na /

analyzed: ma nges pa ni de las 'byung ngo zhes bya bar yang mi 'thad do //

analyzed: 'dod chags gcig la nges pa yin na yang /

analyzed: gzhan yang khu ba 'dod chags kyi rgyu yin na yon tan ma bzung ba yang chags par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: gzhan yang gnas skabs gang la gnas pa na 'dod chags pa'i gnas skabs der zhe sdang bar mi 'gyur te /

analyzed: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dag ni mi mtshungs pa nyid kyis rang bzhin 'gal ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: de dang 'gal ba'i rang bzhin la gnas pa la ni /

analyzed: de bzhin nyid do zhe na /

analyzed: de ni ma yin te /

analyzed: nges pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: rgyu las de bzhin yod ma yin //

analyzed: 'dod chags kyi phan 'dogs pa yang goms pa yod pa las yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And the benefit of attachment is also due to the existence of habituation.

original: 'on te yang gang zhig 'dod chags la sogs pa'i bag chags kyi khyad par las skye ba de la yang ji ltar nyes pa 'dir mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te yang gang zhig 'dod chags la sogs pa'i bag chags kyi khyad par las skye ba de la yang ji ltar nyes pa 'dir mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: But if something arises from the specific latent afflictions of attachment and so on, how could this fault not arise?🔽We respond:

original: bshad pa ; gang gi 'dod chags la sogs pa //🔽rigs mthun bag chags khyad par la //
analyzed: bshad pa ; gang gi 'dod chags la sogs pa // rigs mthun bag chags khyad par la //
translated: Attachment and so on🔽arise in dependence on

original: rag las nas ni 'jug 'gyur la //
analyzed: rag las nas ni 'jug 'gyur la //
translated: the specific latent afflictions of similar type.

original: de la skyon 'dir thal ba med //🔽gang tshe 'dod chags la sogs pa bag chags kyi nyes pa nyid las 'jug pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: de la skyon 'dir thal ba med // gang tshe 'dod chags la sogs pa bag chags kyi nyes pa nyid las 'jug pa de'i phyir /
translated: This fault does not arise for that.🔽Since attachment and so on arise from the fault of latent afflictions,🔽when attachment and so on arise in dependence on the specific latent afflictions of similar type, then at that time, in dependence on the specific latent afflictions of similar type, attachment and so on arise.

original: gang la gang gis skye ba gzhan dang 'brel pa'i bag chags yod pa de nyid las 'ga' zhig gi tshe rnam pa 'ga' zhig ltar rgyu 'ga' zhig gis de sad pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang la gang gis skye ba gzhan dang 'brel pa'i bag chags yod pa de nyid las 'ga' zhig gi tshe rnam pa 'ga' zhig ltar rgyu 'ga' zhig gis de sad pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Since the specific latent afflictions of similar type are the cause of attachment and so on, attachment and so on arise from the specific latent afflictions of similar type.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams kyi bag chags ma nges pa na /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams kyi bag chags ma nges pa na /
translated: Since the latent potentialities of attachment and so on are not determined,

original: gzugs la sogs pa la ltos pa med pa'i phyir sngar gyi nyes pa'i go skabs med do//
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa la ltos pa med pa'i phyir sngar gyi nyes pa'i go skabs med do//
translated: there is no opportunity for the previously mentioned faults, because they are not dependent on form and so on.

original: gal te chags pa la sogs pa nyes pa'i chos ma yin mod /
analyzed: gal te chags pa la sogs pa nyes pa'i chos ma yin mod /
translated: If you say that attachment and so on are not faults,

original: 'byung ba'i chos su ni 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'byung ba'i chos su ni 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: they are still the qualities of the primary elements.🔽We reply: This refutes the qualities of the primary elements,

original: bshad pa / 'dis ni 'byung ba'i chos nyid bkag / rten la bkag pa nyid phyir ro //🔽dkar po la sogs sa sogs la //
analyzed: bshad pa / 'dis ni 'byung ba'i chos nyid bkag / rten la bkag pa nyid phyir ro // dkar po la sogs sa sogs la //
translated: because the refutation applies to their basis.🔽They are not the qualities of earth and so on,

original: brten pa nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: brten pa nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: because they are not dependent on earth and so on.

original: 'di dag ni sa la sogs pa 'byung ba rnams kyi chos yin te /
analyzed: 'di dag ni sa la sogs pa 'byung ba rnams kyi chos yin te /
translated: These are the qualities of the primary elements such as earth.

original: 'di ltar sa dang chu shas che na ni 'dod chags so //🔽me dang rlung dag la ni zhe sdang ngo //
analyzed: 'di ltar sa dang chu shas che na ni 'dod chags so // me dang rlung dag la ni zhe sdang ngo //
translated: In this way, attachment is when the element of earth and the element of water predominate.🔽Aversion is when the element of fire and the element of wind predominate.

original: chu dang rlung dag la ni gti mug go zhes gang smras pa de yang bkag pa yin te /
analyzed: chu dang rlung dag la ni gti mug go zhes gang smras pa de yang bkag pa yin te /
translated: Confusion is when the element of water and the element of wind predominate.

original: thams cad du ma nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad du ma nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is also refuted because they are not determined in all cases.

original: de ltar yang /
analyzed: de ltar yang /
translated: In this way,

original: gnas skabs gang la @116b chags can 'dod //
analyzed: gnas skabs gang la @116b chags can 'dod //
translated: in whatever situation an attached person desires,

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: as has been explained.

original: yod med dag rten med phyir ro //
analyzed: yod med dag rten med phyir ro //
translated: “ Existence and nonexistence are groundless”

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas rten yang bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas rten yang bkag pa yin no //
translated: and so on, the ground is also refuted.

original: gal te ji ltar dkar po la sogs pa 'byung ba chen po la brten pa de bzhin du 'dod chags la sogs pa yang yin no zhe na de la bshad pa ni /
analyzed: gal te ji ltar dkar po la sogs pa 'byung ba chen po la brten pa de bzhin du 'dod chags la sogs pa yang yin no zhe na de la bshad pa ni /
translated: If one says that just as the primary elements such as form are grounded, so too are desire and so on, then the response to that is:

original: dkar po la sogs sa sogs la //
analyzed: dkar po la sogs sa sogs la //
translated: “The primary elements such as earth

original: brten pa nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: brten pa nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: are not grounded.

original: gal te sa la sogs pa la brten pa yin na ni de'i tshe gzugs la sogs pa 'byung ba dag las tha dad par khas blangs pas 'byung ba tsam du khas len pa la gnod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te sa la sogs pa la brten pa yin na ni de'i tshe gzugs la sogs pa 'byung ba dag las tha dad par khas blangs pas 'byung ba tsam du khas len pa la gnod par 'gyur ro //
translated: If they were grounded in the primary elements such as earth, then since they would be accepted as distinct from form and so on, the acceptance that they are mere elements would be undermined.

original: 'byung ba tsam du khas len na ni /
analyzed: 'byung ba tsam du khas len na ni /
translated: If they are accepted as mere elements,

original: rten dang brten pa'i dngos por 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: rten dang brten pa'i dngos por 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: they would not be grounded and ground.

original: gal te shes pa 'byung ba la brten pa yin na de'i tshe kho na mang por thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te shes pa 'byung ba la brten pa yin na de'i tshe kho na mang por thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If consciousness were grounded in the elements, then it would follow, absurdly, that there would be many consciousnesses.

original: tha dad pa ma yin na ni 'byung ba rnams gcig nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: tha dad pa ma yin na ni 'byung ba rnams gcig nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: If they are not different, the elements would be one,

original: shes pa gcig dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa gcig dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are not different from a single cognition.

original: gal te gzugs la sogs pa 'byung ba dag la brten nas zhes khas len pa na rten dang brten pa'i dngos po 'gog pa 'gal lo zhe na /
analyzed: gal te gzugs la sogs pa 'byung ba dag la brten nas zhes khas len pa na rten dang brten pa'i dngos po 'gog pa 'gal lo zhe na /
translated: If you accept that form and so on are dependent on the elements, then you contradict the refutation of the relationship of support and supported.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, we do not commit that error.

original: brten pa'i don ni rten gyi don ma yin gyi //
analyzed: brten pa'i don ni rten gyi don ma yin gyi //
translated: The meaning of support is not the meaning of support and supported.

original: 'on kyang rgyu'i don yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang rgyu'i don yin no //
translated: Rather, it is the meaning of cause.

original: de bshad pa ni /
analyzed: de bshad pa ni /
translated: This is explained in the following:

original: de brten sgra'am rgyu don nam //
analyzed: de brten sgra'am rgyu don nam //
translated: Because it is supported, it is sound, it has the meaning of cause,🔽Or it is supported because it exists

original: yang na rang gi rten dag dang // dbyer med par ni gnas pa'i phyir //
analyzed: yang na rang gi rten dag dang // dbyer med par ni gnas pa'i phyir //
translated: Inseparably with its own supports.

original: brten yin gzhan du 'thad ma yin //🔽rten pa'i don ni rten gyi don ma yin te /
analyzed: brten yin gzhan du 'thad ma yin // rten pa'i don ni rten gyi don ma yin te /
translated: It is supported, not in another way.

original: 'on kyang rgyu'i don ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang rgyu'i don ma yin no //
translated: The meaning of support is not the meaning of support and supported.🔽Rather, it is the meaning of cause.

original: 'di ltar / rgyu ni 'bras dang lhan cig tu //
analyzed: 'di ltar / rgyu ni 'bras dang lhan cig tu //
translated: Thus:

original: dus mtshungs par ni rtogs ma yin //
analyzed: dus mtshungs par ni rtogs ma yin //
translated: A cause is not known to exist🔽Simultaneously with its effect.

original: dus mtshungs dag la 'bras bu nyid //
analyzed: dus mtshungs dag la 'bras bu nyid //
translated: It is certain that an effect

original: la sogs med par rnam par nges //
analyzed: la sogs med par rnam par nges //
translated: Does not exist without a cause and so on.

original: des na rten dang brten pa'i dngos po ma yin no //
analyzed: des na rten dang brten pa'i dngos po ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, they are not the entities of the support and the supported.

original: dus mtshungs pa dag dang brten dang brten pa'am rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yin du chug pa de lta na yang rang gi rten dang dbyer med par 'jug pa'i phyir ro //🔽'di ltar / gal te gzugs sogs rten dang ni //
analyzed: dus mtshungs pa dag dang brten dang brten pa'am rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yin du chug pa de lta na yang rang gi rten dang dbyer med par 'jug pa'i phyir ro // 'di ltar / gal te gzugs sogs rten dang ni //
translated: Even if one allows that they are simultaneous and the entities of the support and the supported or cause and effect, still, because they function without being separate from their own support,🔽as it is said:🔽If form, etc., were ascertained as the entities of the support

original: brten pa'i ngo bor nges na ni //🔽de dag rnam dbyer med par ni //
analyzed: brten pa'i ngo bor nges na ni // de dag rnam dbyer med par ni //
translated: and the supported,🔽then they would be apprehended as

original: 'jug ces bya bar gzung bar gyis //
analyzed: 'jug ces bya bar gzung bar gyis //
translated: functioning without being separate.

original: gal te de dag rten dang brten pa'i ngo bo yin na /
analyzed: gal te de dag rten dang brten pa'i ngo bo yin na /
translated: If they were the entities of the support and the supported,

original: de'i tshe brten pa med na de'i rten kyang 'jig par 'gyur ro //🔽mi 'jig na ni phyis bzhin du sngar yang rten nyid @117a * //
analyzed: de'i tshe brten pa med na de'i rten kyang 'jig par 'gyur ro // mi 'jig na ni phyis bzhin du sngar yang rten nyid @117a * //
translated: then when the supported does not exist, the support would be destroyed.

original: ma yin no //
analyzed: ma yin no //
translated: If it were not destroyed, then, as it is later, it would not be a support earlier.

original: des na 'dod chags la sogs pa yang dbyer med par gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na 'dod chags la sogs pa yang dbyer med par gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, desire, etc., would also remain without being separate.

original: gzugs la sogs pa la tha dad pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rang bzhin ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa la tha dad pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rang bzhin ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Form, etc., do not have the nature of separate great elements.

original: gzhan gyis khas blangs pas de skad brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyis khas blangs pas de skad brjod pa yin no //
translated: We say this because others accept this.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa ni dbyer med par gnas par yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa ni dbyer med par gnas par yang ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, attachment and so on do not exist as inseparable states,

original: 'ga' zhig res 'ga' 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig res 'ga' 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they sometimes occur and sometimes do not.

original: gal te myos sogs nus pa bzhin //
analyzed: gal te myos sogs nus pa bzhin //
translated: If you say that they are separable like the potency of alcohol,

original: dbyer yod ce na dngos po las //
analyzed: dbyer yod ce na dngos po las //
translated: then they are not real entities.

original: nus pa don gzhan nyid ma yin //
analyzed: nus pa don gzhan nyid ma yin //
translated: Potency is not a different object.

original: dngos po 'jig 'gyur rten tshang bar //
analyzed: dngos po 'jig 'gyur rten tshang bar //
translated: If the entity is destroyed, the support is complete.

original: gnas na brten pa 'jig ma yin //
analyzed: gnas na brten pa 'jig ma yin //
translated: If it remains, the supported is not destroyed.

original: gal te de mtshungs she na min //🔽snang ba tha dad rtogs pas na //
analyzed: gal te de mtshungs she na min // snang ba tha dad rtogs pas na //
translated: If you say that they are the same, that is not so.🔽Because the elements and mind are different,

original: 'byung sems tha dad nyid phyir ro //
analyzed: 'byung sems tha dad nyid phyir ro //
translated: they are realized as different appearances.

original: chang dang bu ram chang la sogs pa'i rdzas la myos pa'i nus pa brten pa yin yang rnam pa dbyer yod par gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: chang dang bu ram chang la sogs pa'i rdzas la myos pa'i nus pa brten pa yin yang rnam pa dbyer yod par gnas pa yin te /
translated: The potency of intoxication exists in substances such as alcohol and molasses, but it exists as separable aspects.

original: rdzas yod pa la ldog pa'i phyir dang / phyis 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdzas yod pa la ldog pa'i phyir dang / phyis 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the potency is absent in the existing substance and it arises later.

original: 'di ltar / bska dang mngar sogs rdzas yod na //
analyzed: 'di ltar / bska dang mngar sogs rdzas yod na //
translated: If sweet, sour, and so on are real entities,

original: snga na med pa'i nus pa ni //
analyzed: snga na med pa'i nus pa ni //
translated: then the potency that did not previously exist

original: mngon par 'byung 'gyur nyid yin zhing //🔽slar yang med par 'gyur ba yin //
analyzed: mngon par 'byung 'gyur nyid yin zhing // slar yang med par 'gyur ba yin //
translated: They will go forth and🔽will not return.🔽

original: 'di rten min pa'ang ma yin te //
analyzed: 'di rten min pa'ang ma yin te //
translated: And it is not the case that it is not dependent,

original: de bzhin nyid du rtogs phyir ro //🔽de bzhin lus nyid la brten pa'i //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid du rtogs phyir ro // de bzhin lus nyid la brten pa'i //
translated: Because it is realized as suchness.🔽Likewise, desire and so on

original: 'dod chags sogs kyang 'gyur ba yin //
analyzed: 'dod chags sogs kyang 'gyur ba yin //
translated: Are dependent on the body.

original: zhe na de yang mi 'thad de //🔽nus pa'i don gzhan yang ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhe na de yang mi 'thad de // nus pa'i don gzhan yang ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is not tenable,🔽Because the meaning of potentiality is not different.

original: nus pa ni 'byung ba las don gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nus pa ni 'byung ba las don gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Potentiality is not different from the elements.

original: rdzas kyi nus pa zhes tha dad pa'i tha snyad ni /
analyzed: rdzas kyi nus pa zhes tha dad pa'i tha snyad ni /
translated: The convention of a different substance, potentiality,

original: nye bar bstan pa can bzhin du 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: nye bar bstan pa can bzhin du 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: Is like the convention of a demonstrative,

original: mchi gu'i lus zhes bya ba la sogs bzhin no //
analyzed: mchi gu'i lus zhes bya ba la sogs bzhin no //
translated: Like the body of a lump of flesh.

original: 'di ji ltar yin pa de lta bu ni 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ji ltar yin pa de lta bu ni 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: How this is so will be explained.

original: gal te me la sogs pa rnams kyi nus pa gzhan med na /
analyzed: gal te me la sogs pa rnams kyi nus pa gzhan med na /
translated: If the potentiality of fire and so on is not different,

original: de'i tshe sngags dang rgyud la sogs pas gang gis gegs byed /
analyzed: de'i tshe sngags dang rgyud la sogs pas gang gis gegs byed /
translated: Then by what mantra and so on are they obstructed?

original: re zhig rang gi ngo bo ni ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig rang gi ngo bo ni ma yin te /
translated: First, it is not their own nature,

original: gzhan la sreg pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: gzhan la sreg pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: Because it burns the other.

original: / nus pa bkag pa na yang de ma bkag pa'i phyir gzhan sreg pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: / nus pa bkag pa na yang de ma bkag pa'i phyir gzhan sreg pa yin no zhe na /
translated: And even if the capacity is refuted, since it is not refuted, it burns the other.

original: de yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang ma yin te /
translated: That is also not so.

original: nus pa bkag pa la yang ni //
analyzed: nus pa bkag pa la yang ni //
translated: Even if the capacity is refuted,

original: rnam dbye 'di ni ji ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: rnam dbye 'di ni ji ltar 'gyur //
translated: how could this distinction be made?🔽And it is not possible to say

original: de yang 'gar ni yod pa dang // 'gar med ces byar nus ma yin //
analyzed: de yang 'gar ni yod pa dang // 'gar med ces byar nus ma yin //
translated: that it exists in some places and does not exist in others.

original: nus pa rnams ni mang bas na //
analyzed: nus pa rnams ni mang bas na //
translated: Since capacities are many,

original: rnam dbye @117b ji ltar srid ma yin //
analyzed: rnam dbye @117b ji ltar srid ma yin //
translated: how could the distinction be made?

original: de sreg byed pa'i nus med de //
analyzed: de sreg byed pa'i nus med de //
translated: It is not capable of burning that,

original: de las gzhan ni ldog ma yin //
analyzed: de las gzhan ni ldog ma yin //
translated: but it is not the case that it does not stop the other.

original: yang na sreg bya gzhan nyid du //
analyzed: yang na sreg bya gzhan nyid du //
translated: Or if it makes the other into what is to be burned,

original: byed pa des na tshig ma yin //🔽gzhan gyis tshig 'gyur gzhan du ni //
analyzed: byed pa des na tshig ma yin // gzhan gyis tshig 'gyur gzhan du ni //
translated: then it is not a word.🔽Since the capacity is not refuted in another word,

original: nus pa bkag pa med phyir ro //
analyzed: nus pa bkag pa med phyir ro //
translated: the word is changed into another.

original: de ni ma yin te /🔽dngos po de la de snyed kyis //
analyzed: de ni ma yin te / dngos po de la de snyed kyis //
translated: That is not so.🔽How could that thing

original: nus pa ga las 'byung ba min //🔽gang gis de dag la ltos pa //
analyzed: nus pa ga las 'byung ba min // gang gis de dag la ltos pa //
translated: have that much capacity?

original: de dag gis ni ci byar yod //
analyzed: de dag gis ni ci byar yod //
translated: What could those that depend on them do?

original: dngos po ltos pa yod min te //
analyzed: dngos po ltos pa yod min te //
translated: Things do not depend on others.

original: rgyu nyid las de de ltar 'byung //
analyzed: rgyu nyid las de de ltar 'byung //
translated: The effect arises from the cause itself.

original: nus pa de dag med na ni //
analyzed: nus pa de dag med na ni //
translated: If those potentialities do not exist,

original: 'bras bu rnam dbye 'gyur ma yin //
analyzed: 'bras bu rnam dbye 'gyur ma yin //
translated: The classification of effects would not exist.

original: nus pa mang por med na ni //
analyzed: nus pa mang por med na ni //
translated: If there are not many potentialities,

original: 'bras bu sna tshogs srid mi 'gyur //
analyzed: 'bras bu sna tshogs srid mi 'gyur //
translated: The existence of various effects would not be possible.

original: me la tshig pa la sogs pa //
analyzed: me la tshig pa la sogs pa //
translated: The various things, such as burning,

original: rnam par dbye ba mthong ba gang //
analyzed: rnam par dbye ba mthong ba gang //
translated: That are seen in fire

original: de ni med 'gyur med sogs la //
analyzed: de ni med 'gyur med sogs la //
translated: Would not exist if fire did not exist.

original: rang bzhin gcig po yod dam med //
analyzed: rang bzhin gcig po yod dam med //
translated: Does the single nature of fire exist or not?

original: yod na thams cad sreg pa nyid //
analyzed: yod na thams cad sreg pa nyid //
translated: If it exists, it would burn everything.

original: med pa yin na 'ga' yang min //
analyzed: med pa yin na 'ga' yang min //
translated: If it does not exist, it would not burn anything.

original: gcig ni cig car yod pa dang // med pa 'gar yang srid ma yin //
analyzed: gcig ni cig car yod pa dang // med pa 'gar yang srid ma yin //
translated: It is impossible for a single thing to exist and not exist simultaneously.

original: de yang spang bar bya ste /
analyzed: de yang spang bar bya ste /
translated: This should be refuted as follows:

original: 'di ltar / ji ltar nus pa sna tshogs 'di //
analyzed: 'di ltar / ji ltar nus pa sna tshogs 'di //
translated: Just as these various potentialities

original: rgyu gcig nyid las 'byung ba bzhin //
analyzed: rgyu gcig nyid las 'byung ba bzhin //
translated: Arise from a single cause,

original: sna tshogs 'bras bu cis mi 'dod //🔽ma mthong brtags pas ci zhig bya //🔽gal te 'bras bu sna tshogs ni //
analyzed: sna tshogs 'bras bu cis mi 'dod // ma mthong brtags pas ci zhig bya // gal te 'bras bu sna tshogs ni //
translated: Why not accept that various effects🔽Arise from a single cause?🔽If you infer the existence of various potentialities

original: mthong bas nus pa sna tshogs par//
analyzed: mthong bas nus pa sna tshogs par//
translated: From the observation of various effects,

original: rtogs na 'dir de nyid yin mod //
analyzed: rtogs na 'dir de nyid yin mod //
translated: Then that is precisely what we maintain.

original: gang gis sngags sogs dang ldan pas //
analyzed: gang gis sngags sogs dang ldan pas //
translated: But when it is endowed with mantras and so on,

original: 'bras bu rnam phyir byed nus 'dir //🔽rang bzhin nges pas de 'dra de //
analyzed: 'bras bu rnam phyir byed nus 'dir // rang bzhin nges pas de 'dra de //
translated: it is able to produce effects.🔽But that is not so,

original: rang rgyu las skyes nus don med //
analyzed: rang rgyu las skyes nus don med //
translated: because it arises from its own causes.

original: me ni sngags dang mi ldan na //
analyzed: me ni sngags dang mi ldan na //
translated: When fire is not endowed with mantras,

original: thams cad sreg pa'i rgyu yin la //
analyzed: thams cad sreg pa'i rgyu yin la //
translated: it is the cause of burning everything.

original: de nyid sngags dang ldan pa'i phyir ;
analyzed: de nyid sngags dang ldan pa'i phyir ;
translated: But when it is endowed with mantras,

original: /'ga' zhig bsreg par nus pa yin //
analyzed: /'ga' zhig bsreg par nus pa yin //
translated: it is able to burn some things.

original: bsreg rdzas rang bzhin de yin te //
analyzed: bsreg rdzas rang bzhin de yin te //
translated: The nature of the fuel is such

original: gang gis des ni me tshig cir //
analyzed: gang gis des ni me tshig cir //
translated: that it is ignited by fire.

original: de ni gzhan gyis tshig 'gyur bar //
analyzed: de ni gzhan gyis tshig 'gyur bar //
translated: But it is ignited by other things

original: rang gi rgyu las skyes phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi rgyu las skyes phyir ro //
translated: because it arises from its own causes.

original: de ltar nus pa bkag pas na //
analyzed: de ltar nus pa bkag pas na //
translated: Thus, since potency is refuted,

original: rten dang brten la srid ma yin //
analyzed: rten dang brten la srid ma yin //
translated: it is not possible for the dependent to exist.

original: des na mthong ba'i dpe de ni //
analyzed: des na mthong ba'i dpe de ni //
translated: Therefore, this example that is seen

original: rang bzhin sgrub par byed ma yin //
analyzed: rang bzhin sgrub par byed ma yin //
translated: does not prove the existence of intrinsic nature.

original: des na der ni dngos po nyid 'jig par 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: des na der ni dngos po nyid 'jig par 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: Thus, the existence of things is destroyed.

original: rten mtshang ba med par gnas na brten pa med par 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rten mtshang ba med par gnas na brten pa med par 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
translated: If the basis is intact, the dependent does not become nonexistent.

original: 'on te yang 'dir yang 'byung ba dang sems dag de bzhin du 'gyur ba nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te yang 'dir yang 'byung ba dang sems dag de bzhin du 'gyur ba nyid do zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the elements and mind are like that,

original: 'dir lan ni 'byung ba dang sems dag ni tha @118a * //🔽dad pa'i phyir ro //🔽sems pa dag ni nus pa ltar //
analyzed: 'dir lan ni 'byung ba dang sems dag ni tha @118a * // dad pa'i phyir ro // sems pa dag ni nus pa ltar //
translated: the reply is that the elements and mind are different.🔽The elements are not undifferentiated,

original: 'byung ba dang tha mi dad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'byung ba dang tha mi dad pa ma yin no //
translated: as is the case with the mind.

original: de nyid ga las she na snang ba tha dad par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //🔽snang ba tha dad thams cad du //
analyzed: de nyid ga las she na snang ba tha dad par rtogs pa'i phyir ro // snang ba tha dad thams cad du //
translated: Why is that? Because of the perception of difference.🔽All things that are perceived as different

original: dngos po tha dad sgrub byed yin //
analyzed: dngos po tha dad sgrub byed yin //
translated: are established as different.

original: tha dad bsgrub pa'i thabs gzhan ni ;
analyzed: tha dad bsgrub pa'i thabs gzhan ni ;
translated: No other means of establishing difference

original: /'ga' yang mthong ba yod ma yin //
analyzed: /'ga' yang mthong ba yod ma yin //
translated: is ever seen.

original: dbang po tha dad pa dang rtogs pa tha dad pas gzung bar bya ba yin yang /
analyzed: dbang po tha dad pa dang rtogs pa tha dad pas gzung bar bya ba yin yang /
translated: Even though they are apprehended by different sense faculties and different cognitions,

original: gal te tha dad pa med par snang na ni /
analyzed: gal te tha dad pa med par snang na ni /
translated: if they appear as undifferentiated,

original: de'i tshe gcig nyid de //
analyzed: de'i tshe gcig nyid de //
translated: then they are one.

original: tha dad par byed pa ni snang ba'i rang bzhin rtogs pa yin gyi rtogs pa'i rgyu tha dad pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: tha dad par byed pa ni snang ba'i rang bzhin rtogs pa yin gyi rtogs pa'i rgyu tha dad pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The cause of the perception of difference is the perception of the nature of appearance, not the difference of the cause of perception.

original: 'on te rtogs pa'i rgyu tha dad na /
analyzed: 'on te rtogs pa'i rgyu tha dad na /
translated: But if the causes of the cognition are different,

original: rtogs pa yang tha dad do zhe na /
analyzed: rtogs pa yang tha dad do zhe na /
translated: then the cognition is also different.

original: 'o na rtogs pa tha dad pa de nyid tha dad par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: 'o na rtogs pa tha dad pa de nyid tha dad par byed pa yin te /
translated: But then the difference of the cognition itself causes the difference,

original: gzhan ni don med do //
analyzed: gzhan ni don med do //
translated: and the other is useless.

original: der yang snang ba ni tha dad de /
analyzed: der yang snang ba ni tha dad de /
translated: And in that case, the appearance is different,

original: rnam par shes pa ni bde ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi nang du rig la don sra ba dang / dro ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyis gzung ba nyid du rig pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni bde ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi nang du rig la don sra ba dang / dro ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyis gzung ba nyid du rig pa ma yin no //
translated: but the consciousness, which is of the nature of pleasure, etc., is cognized internally, and the object, which is of the nature of solidity, heat, etc., is cognized externally.

original: 'on te bde ba la sogs pa ni nang gi rig bya'i khyad par gyi rang bzhin nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'on te bde ba la sogs pa ni nang gi rig bya'i khyad par gyi rang bzhin nyid yin te /
translated: But if pleasure, etc., are of the nature of internal objects to be cognized,

original: des na nang du rig pa'i rang bzhin yin no //
analyzed: des na nang du rig pa'i rang bzhin yin no //
translated: then they are cognized internally.

original: gang zhig gang na gnas pa'i dngos //
analyzed: gang zhig gang na gnas pa'i dngos //
translated: The thing that exists in a certain place

original: de ni de ltar myong 'gyur te //
analyzed: de ni de ltar myong 'gyur te //
translated: is experienced as such.

original: nye dang ring ba'i bye brag gis //
analyzed: nye dang ring ba'i bye brag gis //
translated: By the difference of near and far,

original: ji ltar shing sogs rig pa bzhin //
analyzed: ji ltar shing sogs rig pa bzhin //
translated: just as a tree, etc., is cognized.

original: nang gi reg bya'i khyad par ni ring ba ma yin te /
analyzed: nang gi reg bya'i khyad par ni ring ba ma yin te /
translated: The internal object to be touched is not far away.

original: des na 'di bdag dang yul gcig pa nyid kyis lus kyi nang na gnas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: des na 'di bdag dang yul gcig pa nyid kyis lus kyi nang na gnas pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, since it is the same entity as the self, it exists inside the body.

original: phyi rol gyi shing bzhin du rig pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi shing bzhin du rig pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: It is not like an external tree, which is not cognized.

original: 'di ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: 'di ni mi rigs te /
translated: This is illogical.

original: gal te 'di ni reg bya nyid //
analyzed: gal te 'di ni reg bya nyid //
translated: If it is a tangible object,

original: yin na de ni gang gis rig / gzhan gyis rig na rig pa nyid //
analyzed: yin na de ni gang gis rig / gzhan gyis rig na rig pa nyid //
translated: what cognizes it? If it is cognized by something else,

original: tha dad yin par thal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: tha dad yin par thal bar 'gyur //
translated: it follows that it is different from the self.

original: 'on te de ni rang rig na //
analyzed: 'on te de ni rang rig na //
translated: But if it is self-cognizing,

original: 'byung ba chen po'i rang bzhin min //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po'i rang bzhin min //
translated: it is not the nature of the great elements.

original: rang rig rang bzhin de bzhin nyid //
analyzed: rang rig rang bzhin de bzhin nyid //
translated: Self-cognition is the nature of reality.

original: gzhan gyis ji phyir shes ma yin //
analyzed: gzhan gyis ji phyir shes ma yin //
translated: Why is it not cognized by others?

original: gal te khong nang chug phyir na //
analyzed: gal te khong nang chug phyir na //
translated: If it is cognized because it is inside,

original: nang du reg ni rig par 'gyur /
analyzed: nang du reg ni rig par 'gyur /
translated: it is cognized by touching the inside.

original: gang zhig nang gi cha la reg pa des rig par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang zhig nang gi cha la reg pa des rig par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It follows that it is cognized by that which touches the inner parts.

original: phyi'i khyud pa'i reg pa yang bde ba'i rang bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: phyi'i khyud pa'i reg pa yang bde ba'i rang bzhin nyid do //
translated: The outer skin is also the nature of pleasure.

original: gnyis pa phan tshun reg pa na //
analyzed: gnyis pa phan tshun reg pa na //
translated: When the second touches the first,

original: gnyi gas kyang ni rig par 'gyur //
analyzed: gnyi gas kyang ni rig par 'gyur //
translated: both are cognized.

original: gzhan gyis gzhan gyi rang bzhin rig / gzhan dag rang bzhin ji ltar min //
analyzed: gzhan gyis gzhan gyi rang bzhin rig / gzhan dag rang bzhin ji ltar min //
translated: How can one thing be the nature of another?

original: 'on te @118b gzhan gyis reg pa na //
analyzed: 'on te @118b gzhan gyis reg pa na //
translated: If the nature of the self is the same as that of the other,

original: bdag gi rang bzhin de nyid bde bar 'gyur ba yin na /
analyzed: bdag gi rang bzhin de nyid bde bar 'gyur ba yin na /
translated: then the self would be happy when the other is happy.

original: de lta yin na gzhan gyis de bzhin du rig par thal lo //
analyzed: de lta yin na gzhan gyis de bzhin du rig par thal lo //
translated: But if that is so, then the self would perceive the other as it perceives itself.

original: gzhan gyis rnam pa thams cad ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan gyis rnam pa thams cad ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that the other does not perceive the other in all ways,

original: gal te don de gcig yin na ji ltar rnam pa thams cad ma rtogs /
analyzed: gal te don de gcig yin na ji ltar rnam pa thams cad ma rtogs /
translated: then if the object is one, how can it be that it is not perceived in all ways?

original: don rdul phra rab so sor tha dad pa du ma yin no //
analyzed: don rdul phra rab so sor tha dad pa du ma yin no //
translated: If the object is many, then the atoms are separate.

original: de lta yin na bde ba'i rdul phra rab tha dad par bde ba mang po las bde ba la sogs pa 'ga' zhig rtogs par 'gyur na /
analyzed: de lta yin na bde ba'i rdul phra rab tha dad par bde ba mang po las bde ba la sogs pa 'ga' zhig rtogs par 'gyur na /
translated: If that is so, then the atoms of pleasure are separate, and many pleasures are perceived.

original: gzhan gyis ni bde ba'i cha tsam yang rtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyis ni bde ba'i cha tsam yang rtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: But the other does not perceive even a part of the pleasure.

original: rang nyid rig pa zhes bya ba gcig nyid rtogs pa'i phyir bud med dang skyes pa gnyis mtshungs par myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang nyid rig pa zhes bya ba gcig nyid rtogs pa'i phyir bud med dang skyes pa gnyis mtshungs par myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the self is the same as the other, then the experience of both the woman and the man would be the same.

original: thams cad rig pa yin na ni /
analyzed: thams cad rig pa yin na ni /
translated: If all is cognition,

original: rdul phra rab tu ma rig par thal lo //
analyzed: rdul phra rab tu ma rig par thal lo //
translated: then it follows that the atom is not non-cognition.

original: 'on te phan tshun 'byar bas rnam par dbye ba med pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te phan tshun 'byar bas rnam par dbye ba med pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the atom is not divided because it is in mutual contact,

original: ma yin te de las tha dad pa'i 'byar ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin te de las tha dad pa'i 'byar ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: no, because there is no contact apart from it.

original: yod kyang tha dad par rtogs pa ldog par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yod kyang tha dad par rtogs pa ldog par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if there were contact, the notion of difference would not be eliminated.

original: 'byar bas rnam par dbye ba mi rtogs so zhe na /
analyzed: 'byar bas rnam par dbye ba mi rtogs so zhe na /
translated: If you say that the atom is not perceived as divided because of contact,

original: 'o na ni de dag gi rang gi ngo bo ma rtogs pa'i phyir 'byung ba dag las sems tha dad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na ni de dag gi rang gi ngo bo ma rtogs pa'i phyir 'byung ba dag las sems tha dad par 'gyur te /
translated: then the mind would be different from the elements, because its own nature is not perceived,

original: tha dad par snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad par snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it appears as different.

original: 'on te yan lag can cig kho na'o zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te yan lag can cig kho na'o zhe na /
translated: But if you say that there is only one whole,

original: de lta yin na gzhan la yang de ltar rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin na gzhan la yang de ltar rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: then it would be perceived as such in other things as well.

original: 'on te gzhan bdag nyid thams cad kyis rtogs par mi nus so zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te gzhan bdag nyid thams cad kyis rtogs par mi nus so zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the other cannot be perceived in its entirety,

original: 'o na ni de'i rang bzhin rtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'o na ni de'i rang bzhin rtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: then its nature is not perceived.

original: de ni 'khrul pa nyid de rtogs pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de ni 'khrul pa nyid de rtogs pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that it is only an error, not a perception,

original: 'khrul pa yang nang gi reg pa'i khyad par gyi rang bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: 'khrul pa yang nang gi reg pa'i khyad par gyi rang bzhin nyid do //
translated: And error is the nature of the special contact within.

original: des na gzhan gyis de bzhin du rtogs par dben par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na gzhan gyis de bzhin du rtogs par dben par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the other is not understood in that way.

original: 'dir ni rig bya gcig pu nyid //
analyzed: 'dir ni rig bya gcig pu nyid //
translated: Here, the object of cognition is one,

original: bde ba la sogs gzhan du 'gyur //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs gzhan du 'gyur //
translated: but pleasure, etc., are different.

original: gal te gzhan gcig pu nyid //
analyzed: gal te gzhan gcig pu nyid //
translated: If the other is one,

original: bde ba la sogs gzhan du 'gyur //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs gzhan du 'gyur //
translated: but pleasure, etc., are different,

original: gal te gzhan gyis gcig rtogs na //
analyzed: gal te gzhan gyis gcig rtogs na //
translated: if the other is understood as one,

original: de lta yin na bde sogs gzhan //
analyzed: de lta yin na bde sogs gzhan //
translated: then pleasure, etc., are different.🔽Therefore, the elements and volition

original: de'i phyir 'byung ba dang ni sems pa dag / snang ba tha dad rtogs pa'i nyid //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'byung ba dang ni sems pa dag / snang ba tha dad rtogs pa'i nyid //
translated: are the nature of the understanding of different appearances.

original: gal te gzhan gyis rig pa na //
analyzed: gal te gzhan gyis rig pa na //
translated: If the other is known,

original: bde ba 'byung ba 'dod na ni //
analyzed: bde ba 'byung ba 'dod na ni //
translated: if pleasure is desired to arise,

original: reg pa de la yid 'ong ba //
analyzed: reg pa de la yid 'ong ba //
translated: that pleasant contact

original: nyid kyis de ni ji ltar gnas //
analyzed: nyid kyis de ni ji ltar gnas //
translated: how does it abide by itself?

original: yid du 'ong phyir rgyu yin na //
analyzed: yid du 'ong phyir rgyu yin na //
translated: If it is a cause because of being pleasant,

original: yid 'ong 'di gang yin par 'dod //
analyzed: yid 'ong 'di gang yin par 'dod //
translated: what is this pleasant thing that is accepted?

original: rang skal 'phro yis 'ga' zhig la //
analyzed: rang skal 'phro yis 'ga' zhig la //
translated: By the extension of one’s own portion,

original: gzhan 'ga' zhig ni yid 'ong na //
analyzed: gzhan 'ga' zhig ni yid 'ong na //
translated: some are pleasant to some others.

original: las nyid skal pa'i sgra yis @119a * //
analyzed: las nyid skal pa'i sgra yis @119a * //
translated: Karma itself is the sound of portion.

original: ni ; / tha dad kyi ni lam du gnas //
analyzed: ni ; / tha dad kyi ni lam du gnas //
translated: It is located on a different path.

original: phan 'dogs pa yi khyad par ni //
analyzed: phan 'dogs pa yi khyad par ni //
translated: The difference in the benefit

original: skye ba 'di la mthong ba med //
analyzed: skye ba 'di la mthong ba med //
translated: is not seen in this life.

original: de lta yin na sems pa gzhan //🔽med kyang 'jig rten gzhan gnas 'dir //
analyzed: de lta yin na sems pa gzhan // med kyang 'jig rten gzhan gnas 'dir //
translated: If that were the case,

original: mang du smra ba ci zhig bya //
analyzed: mang du smra ba ci zhig bya //
translated: then what is the use of speaking much🔽in this world of other beings🔽when there is no other mind?

original: gal te de yi yid 'ong nyid //
analyzed: gal te de yi yid 'ong nyid //
translated: If that pleasantness

original: rgyu las nye bar skyes yin na //
analyzed: rgyu las nye bar skyes yin na //
translated: arises from a cause,

original: gzhan gyis kyang ni rtogs 'gyur te //
analyzed: gzhan gyis kyang ni rtogs 'gyur te //
translated: then it would be understood by others.

original: min na de ni rnam shes nyid //🔽gal te de ni rtogs pa po'i //
analyzed: min na de ni rnam shes nyid // gal te de ni rtogs pa po'i //
translated: If not, then it is just consciousness.🔽If that pleasantness

original: lus nang chud par rtogs na ni //🔽phyi rol du ni rtogs pa de //
analyzed: lus nang chud par rtogs na ni // phyi rol du ni rtogs pa de //
translated: is understood as being inside the body of the experiencer,🔽then how could that understanding

original: ji ltar lus kyi nang du chud //
analyzed: ji ltar lus kyi nang du chud //
translated: of the external be inside the body?

original: gzugs ni snang bar 'gyur na yang //
analyzed: gzugs ni snang bar 'gyur na yang //
translated: Even though form appears,

original: gzhan gyis rtogs pa ma yin phyir //
analyzed: gzhan gyis rtogs pa ma yin phyir //
translated: it is not understood by others.

original: rang gis rig pa'i rang bzhin ni //
analyzed: rang gis rig pa'i rang bzhin ni //
translated: The nature of self-awareness

original: 'byung ba dag las tha dad 'gyur //
analyzed: 'byung ba dag las tha dad 'gyur //
translated: would be different from the elements.

original: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'am gzhan la gzugs snang ba yin yang /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'am gzhan la gzugs snang ba yin yang /
translated: Even though form appears to the conceptual mind or to others,

original: gzhan gyis rtogs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyis rtogs pa ma yin te /
translated: it is not understood by others.

original: des na de ni rang rig pa'i shes pa nyid do //🔽'on te gzhan gyi lus kyi nang du chud pas na mi rig go zhe na /
analyzed: des na de ni rang rig pa'i shes pa nyid do // 'on te gzhan gyi lus kyi nang du chud pas na mi rig go zhe na /
translated: Therefore, it is the very cognition that is self-aware.🔽But if it is not aware because it is inside the body of another,

original: gzhan gyi lus kyang mi rig par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi lus kyang mi rig par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then it follows that it is not aware of one’s own body either.

original: lus kyi nang du chud nyid na //
analyzed: lus kyi nang du chud nyid na //
translated: If it is inside the body,

original: bsgribs par gnas pa 'ba' zhig ni //
analyzed: bsgribs par gnas pa 'ba' zhig ni //
translated: then it is in a hidden place.

original: ji ltar rig 'gyur yul gzhan dag / rnam par rtog par byed pa na //
analyzed: ji ltar rig 'gyur yul gzhan dag / rnam par rtog par byed pa na //
translated: How can it be aware of other objects,

original: rnam par rtog pa med par ni //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa med par ni //
translated: since it is devoid of conceptualization?

original: lus rig de yang de med par ;🔽/ des na gcig gi sgrub byed pa //
analyzed: lus rig de yang de med par ; / des na gcig gi sgrub byed pa //
translated: And if it is not aware of the body,🔽then it cannot be the cause of the body.

original: lhan cig dmigs pa nges pa med //
analyzed: lhan cig dmigs pa nges pa med //
translated: Therefore, the simultaneity of the two is not established.

original: 'on te yang de tha dad par 'gyur mod /
analyzed: 'on te yang de tha dad par 'gyur mod /
translated: But even if they are different,

original: de lta na yang lus nyid de'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: de lta na yang lus nyid de'i rgyu yin te /
translated: the body is the cause of pleasure, etc.

original: bde ba la sogs pa bag chags dang 'brel pa tsam gyis skye ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa bag chags dang 'brel pa tsam gyis skye ba ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not that pleasure, etc. arise merely from the connection with the latent impressions.

original: des na don dam pa nyid do //
analyzed: des na don dam pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, it is the ultimate truth.

original: lus kyang khu ba la sogs pa las yin te /
analyzed: lus kyang khu ba la sogs pa las yin te /
translated: The body is also the cause of semen, etc.

original: des na 'jig rten pha rol med do //
analyzed: des na 'jig rten pha rol med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no other world.

original: 'jig rten 'di 'gyur ba nyid kyi las yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di 'gyur ba nyid kyi las yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the action of the world’s transformation is completed.

original: des na 'khor ba yod pa ma yin no zhe na //
analyzed: des na 'khor ba yod pa ma yin no zhe na //
translated: Therefore, cyclic existence does not exist.🔽In response, Aryadeva says:

original: bshad pa / ji srid lus 'di 'gyur bar du //
analyzed: bshad pa / ji srid lus 'di 'gyur bar du //
translated: As long as this body changes,

original: gzugs sogs bzhin du yid ngo bo //
analyzed: gzugs sogs bzhin du yid ngo bo //
translated: the mind is the same as form, etc.

original: mtshungs 'gyur rnam par rtog pa ni //
analyzed: mtshungs 'gyur rnam par rtog pa ni //
translated: Imagination

original: don gyi gzhan dbang can nyid gang //
analyzed: don gyi gzhan dbang can nyid gang //
translated: is dependent on an object.

original: gang gi tshe 'dod chags la sogs pa lus kyi rgyu can nam /
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'dod chags la sogs pa lus kyi rgyu can nam /
translated: When desire, etc., are the cause of the body or its nature,

original: rang bzhin yin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: rang bzhin yin pa de'i tshe /
translated: then

original: lus ma gyur pa'i sngon rol du yid mtshungs pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: lus ma gyur pa'i sngon rol du yid mtshungs pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: the mind is the same as the body before the body changes,

original: rgyu'am rang bzhin gyis rten mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu'am rang bzhin gyis rten mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the cause or nature is the same as the basis.

original: de lta ma @119b yin na ni /🔽de rten dang brten pa'am /
analyzed: de lta ma @119b yin na ni / de rten dang brten pa'am /
translated: If that were not so,🔽it would not be tenable that the mind is the basis and the body is what is based on the mind,

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: or that the mind is the cause and the body is the result.

original: lus la brten pa'i gzugs la sogs pa ni lus mnyam pa nyid na mi mnyam pa ma yin no //
analyzed: lus la brten pa'i gzugs la sogs pa ni lus mnyam pa nyid na mi mnyam pa ma yin no //
translated: Form, etc., which are based on the body, are not different from the body when the body is the same.

original: 'on te yul gzhan dang gzhan nye ba la rag las nas khyad par du 'gyur ba la skyon med do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te yul gzhan dang gzhan nye ba la rag las nas khyad par du 'gyur ba la skyon med do zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the difference is due to the proximity of other objects, there is no fault.

original: de yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: de yang mi rigs te /
translated: That also is not correct.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang bde ba la sogs pa la don gyi gzhan dbang nyid ci zhig yod /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang bde ba la sogs pa la don gyi gzhan dbang nyid ci zhig yod /
translated: What is the dependence of mental consciousness and pleasure, etc., on other objects?

original: bag chags sad pa tsam las skye ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan zin to //
analyzed: bag chags sad pa tsam las skye ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan zin to //
translated: It has been demonstrated that they arise from the mere awakening of habitual tendencies.

original: gang tshe lus la ltos med par //
analyzed: gang tshe lus la ltos med par //
translated: When consciousness does not depend on the body,
