original: shes pa 'ga' zhig 'ga' zhig gi / bag chags sad pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba //
analyzed: shes pa 'ga' zhig 'ga' zhig gi / bag chags sad pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba //
translated: how could one consciousness be the cause of the awakening of the habitual tendencies of another?

original: des na 'ga' zhig las 'ga' yin //
analyzed: des na 'ga' zhig las 'ga' yin //
translated: Therefore, one would not arise from another.

original: lus rgyu yin na ni sngar gyi skyon du thal lo //
analyzed: lus rgyu yin na ni sngar gyi skyon du thal lo //
translated: If the body were the cause, the previously mentioned fault would arise.

original: gang gi tshe lus ltos pa med par /
analyzed: gang gi tshe lus ltos pa med par /
translated: When consciousness does not depend on the body,

original: bag chags sad pa'i rgyu'i shes pa 'ga' zhig la ltos nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'ga' zhig skye bar khas len pa de'i tshe ni rgyu des na lus 'gyur ba med kyang rnam par shes pa 'gar 'gyur gyi lus rgyu nyid yin na ni ma yin
analyzed: bag chags sad pa'i rgyu'i shes pa 'ga' zhig la ltos nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'ga' zhig skye bar khas len pa de'i tshe ni rgyu des na lus 'gyur ba med kyang rnam par shes pa 'gar 'gyur gyi lus rgyu nyid yin na ni ma yin
translated: When you accept that some mental consciousnesses arise in dependence on some consciousnesses that are the cause of the activation of latent potentialities, then consciousnesses change without the body changing, but not if the body is the cause.

original: no // de'i phyir rnam par shes pa nyid las rnam par shes pa yin gyi lus las ni ma yin te /
analyzed: no // de'i phyir rnam par shes pa nyid las rnam par shes pa yin gyi lus las ni ma yin te /
translated: Therefore consciousnesses arise from consciousnesses, not from the body.

original: des na phung po ni 'khor ba yin no //
analyzed: des na phung po ni 'khor ba yin no //
translated: Therefore the aggregates are samsara.

original: gtan tshigs gzhan yang smras pa ni //🔽rnam par shes min rnam shes kyi //
analyzed: gtan tshigs gzhan yang smras pa ni // rnam par shes min rnam shes kyi //
translated: Another reason is stated:🔽Because there is no appropriator of consciousness

original: nyer len med pa'i phyir yang grub //
analyzed: nyer len med pa'i phyir yang grub //
translated: That is not consciousness, it is established.

original: gal te dngos po thams cad ni //
analyzed: gal te dngos po thams cad ni //
translated: If you assert that all things

original: rnam shes nus ldan yin 'dod na //
analyzed: rnam shes nus ldan yin 'dod na //
translated: Are capable of being consciousness,🔽Then it would be like the assertion

original: rtsva mchog rtse na glang chen brgya //
analyzed: rtsva mchog rtse na glang chen brgya //
translated: That an elephant exists at the tip of a reed

original: sngon tshe ma mthong yod do zhes //🔽de skad grangs can phyugs las gzhan //
analyzed: sngon tshe ma mthong yod do zhes // de skad grangs can phyugs las gzhan //
translated: Even though it is not seen there.🔽What other than a fool would make

original: ngo mtshar bcas pa su brjod rtsol //
analyzed: ngo mtshar bcas pa su brjod rtsol //
translated: Such an amazing and bold statement?

original: rgyu ni lan brgyar rnam phye yang //
analyzed: rgyu ni lan brgyar rnam phye yang //
translated: Even if you analyze it a hundred times,

original: ngo bo gang zhig snang gyur ba'i //
analyzed: ngo bo gang zhig snang gyur ba'i //
translated: the nature of the object that appears

original: ngo bo de ni sngar mi snang //
analyzed: ngo bo de ni sngar mi snang //
translated: is not the nature that appeared before.

original: ji ltar de ni yod par 'gyur //
analyzed: ji ltar de ni yod par 'gyur //
translated: How could it be existent?

original: rnam par shes pa mthun pa dang mi mthun pa dag las /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa mthun pa dang mi mthun pa dag las /
translated: From consciousnesses that are similar and dissimilar,

original: rnam par shes pa phyi ma mthun pa dang mi mthun par mthong ba'i phyir //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa phyi ma mthun pa dang mi mthun par mthong ba'i phyir //
translated: the later consciousnesses are seen to be similar and dissimilar.

original: nges par de 'gyur ba'i rjes su byed pas /
analyzed: nges par de 'gyur ba'i rjes su byed pas /
translated: Therefore, consciousness definitely conforms to the object.

original: rnam par shes pa'i nye bar len pa dang bral ba'i lus las rnam par shes pa mi skye ba'i phyir 'jig rten pha rol grub bo //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i nye bar len pa dang bral ba'i lus las rnam par shes pa mi skye ba'i phyir 'jig rten pha rol grub bo //
translated: Therefore, because consciousness does not arise from a body that is devoid of the appropriation of consciousness, the world beyond is established.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa cig car skye bar thal ba'i phyir ro //🔽'on te yang gal te shes pa nyid las shes pa yin pa de lta na yang 'jig rten pha @120a * //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa cig car skye bar thal ba'i phyir ro // 'on te yang gal te shes pa nyid las shes pa yin pa de lta na yang 'jig rten pha @120a * //
translated: Because it follows that attachment and so on would arise simultaneously.

original: rol mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: rol mi 'grub ste /
translated: But if consciousness arises from consciousness, then even in that case the world beyond is not established,

original: dngos po thams cad rnam par shes pa'i nus pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad rnam par shes pa'i nus pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because all things possess the potential to produce consciousness.

original: de lta bu'i nus pa'i 'bras bu rtsom pa med pa ni 'jig rten pha rol ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de lta bu'i nus pa'i 'bras bu rtsom pa med pa ni 'jig rten pha rol ma yin no zhe na /
translated: The effect of such a potency is not a world beyond.

original: 'di ni grangs can pa'i rtogs pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'di ni grangs can pa'i rtogs pa ma yin nam /
translated: But isn’t this the theory of the Sāṃkhya?

original: gang las rtog ge ba thams cad kyi gtsug gi nor bu bdag nying rlom pa khyed kyi yin par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang las rtog ge ba thams cad kyi gtsug gi nor bu bdag nying rlom pa khyed kyi yin par 'gyur /
translated: From where did you, who are the crest jewel of all logicians, get this?

original: de skad du brjod par rtsol ba ni /🔽gang zhig lung gcig po skyabs su gyur pa /
analyzed: de skad du brjod par rtsol ba ni / gang zhig lung gcig po skyabs su gyur pa /
translated: To make such a claim🔽is to be a Sāṃkhya,

original: ngo tsha med pa'i grangs can phugs nyid smra bar rtsol ba yin gyi /
analyzed: ngo tsha med pa'i grangs can phugs nyid smra bar rtsol ba yin gyi /
translated: a shameless one who takes refuge in a single scripture.

original: ngo tsha dang bcas pa ni de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: ngo tsha dang bcas pa ni de lta ma yin no //
translated: But those who are modest do not do this.

original: rtsva mchog rtse na sngon chad ni ;🔽/ ma mthong glang chen brgya yod par //
analyzed: rtsva mchog rtse na sngon chad ni ; / ma mthong glang chen brgya yod par //
translated: In the tip of the kuśa grass🔽there are a hundred unseen elephants.

original: grangs can las ni gzhan pa yi //
analyzed: grangs can las ni gzhan pa yi //
translated: But for those who are not Sāṃkhya,

original: ngag gi spyod yul 'gyur ma yin //
analyzed: ngag gi spyod yul 'gyur ma yin //
translated: this is not the domain of speech.

original: 'di ltar rgyu ni rnam brgyar rnam phye yang //
analyzed: 'di ltar rgyu ni rnam brgyar rnam phye yang //
translated: Thus, even if the cause is analyzed in a hundred ways,

original: zho spogs rnams kyi rang bzhin gang //
analyzed: zho spogs rnams kyi rang bzhin gang //
translated: what is the nature of the curd and the buttermilk?

original: de ni sngar mthong nus min na //
analyzed: de ni sngar mthong nus min na //
translated: If that was not seen before,

original: de ni de la ji ltar yod //
analyzed: de ni de la ji ltar yod //
translated: how could it be in that?

original: rang bzhin gzhan gyis gal te de //
analyzed: rang bzhin gzhan gyis gal te de //
translated: If the nature of the self is different from that,

original: de nyid yod ces brjod mi bya //
analyzed: de nyid yod ces brjod mi bya //
translated: then it is not correct to say that it exists.

original: rnam shes pa las gzhan rang bzhin ni //
analyzed: rnam shes pa las gzhan rang bzhin ni //
translated: The nature of the self is not different from consciousness,

original: yod pas de yod ji ltar 'gyur //🔽gal te ma sogs shes pa yi //
analyzed: yod pas de yod ji ltar 'gyur // gal te ma sogs shes pa yi //
translated: so how could it exist?

original: nyer len las ni de 'dod na //
analyzed: nyer len las ni de 'dod na //
translated: If you assert that the self is the appropriator of the consciousness of the mother,🔽then the nature of the self is not different from the consciousness of the mother.🔽If you say that the nature of the self is not different from the consciousness of the mother,

original: de yi 'du pa'i bdag nyid ni ldog pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de yi 'du pa'i bdag nyid ni ldog pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: then the nature of the self is not different from the consciousness of the father,

original: 'di la 'gyur //
analyzed: 'di la 'gyur //
translated: and so on.

original: 'on te gal te mes po la sogs pa'i 'du byed kyang 'dod na /
analyzed: 'on te gal te mes po la sogs pa'i 'du byed kyang 'dod na /
translated: If you assert that the self is the appropriator of the formations of the grandfather and so on,

original: ma yin kun la de ma ni //
analyzed: ma yin kun la de ma ni //
translated: then the self is not the appropriator of all.🔽The formations of the rope are not the formations of the snake.

original: thag pa'i 'du byed rjes su 'jug / de'i phyir rang gi rgyud la gnas pa'i rnam par shes pa las rnam par shes pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: thag pa'i 'du byed rjes su 'jug / de'i phyir rang gi rgyud la gnas pa'i rnam par shes pa las rnam par shes pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because consciousness arises from consciousness that exists in one’s own continuum,

original: 'jig rten pha rol grub bo //
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol grub bo //
translated: the world beyond is established.🔽Moreover,

original: gzhan yang / snga na med par 'byung ba la ;
analyzed: gzhan yang / snga na med par 'byung ba la ;
translated: if it arose without a prior cause,

original: / chags sogs nges med thal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: / chags sogs nges med thal bar 'gyur //
translated: then desire and so on would be causeless.

original: gal te 'jig rten pha rol med par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te 'jig rten pha rol med par 'gyur na /
translated: If the world beyond did not exist,

original: de'i tshe snga na med pa'i sems can 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe snga na med pa'i sems can 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then sentient beings would arise without a prior cause.

original: de lta yin na 'dod chags la sogs pa nges par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta yin na 'dod chags la sogs pa nges par 'gyur te /
translated: If that were so, then attachment and so on would be certain,

original: 'ga' zhig 'dod chags dang bral bar yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig 'dod chags dang bral bar yang 'gyur ro //
translated: and some would be free from attachment.

original: gang gi tshe skye ba gzhan nas 'ongs pa de'i tshe srid pa nyid yod pa'i srog chags skye ba'i rgyu yin pa de lta na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe skye ba gzhan nas 'ongs pa de'i tshe srid pa nyid yod pa'i srog chags skye ba'i rgyu yin pa de lta na /
translated: When one comes from another birth, then the life force that exists is the cause of birth.

original: skye bo 'dod chags dang bral bar mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: skye bo 'dod chags dang bral bar mi 'byung ste /
translated: In that case, people would not be free from attachment,

original: 'dod chags med par mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags med par mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they would not be born without attachment.

original: 'byung ba'i bdag las ma 'das phyir //🔽gal te kun chags sogs ldan na //
analyzed: 'byung ba'i bdag las ma 'das phyir // gal te kun chags sogs ldan na //
translated: Because the self does not transcend the elements,🔽if one possesses attachment and so on,

original: 'on te yang @120b 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rgyu ni 'byung ba'i bdag nyid yin la /
analyzed: 'on te yang @120b 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rgyu ni 'byung ba'i bdag nyid yin la /
translated: if the cause of attachment and so on is the nature of the elements,

original: de yang bral ba med pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang bral ba med pa yin no //
translated: and that is not absent,

original: des na rgyu mtshang ba med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: des na rgyu mtshang ba med pa'i phyir /
translated: then because the cause is not faulty,

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa med par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa med par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: attachment and so on would not be absent.

original: gal te de lta yin na rgyu de nyid kyis /
analyzed: gal te de lta yin na rgyu de nyid kyis /
translated: If that were so, then by that cause alone,

original: thams cad 'dod chags mtshungs par 'gyur //
analyzed: thams cad 'dod chags mtshungs par 'gyur //
translated: all would be the same in being attached.

original: gal te 'byung khyad las min na //
analyzed: gal te 'byung khyad las min na //
translated: If it is not from the elements,🔽then it is not from the cause.

original: 'di ltar gal te 'byung ba rnams phan tshun khyad par med pa yin na ni thams cad 'dod chags mtshungs par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te 'byung ba rnams phan tshun khyad par med pa yin na ni thams cad 'dod chags mtshungs par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: If the elements were not different from each other, then all would be the same in their passion.

original: med pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: med pa yang ma yin te /
translated: But they are not the same.

original: des na thams cad 'dod chags mtshungs pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: des na thams cad 'dod chags mtshungs pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, all are not the same in their passion.

original: gal te de lta na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na /
translated: If that is so,

original: 'byung rnams srog chags khyad med kyang //
analyzed: 'byung rnams srog chags khyad med kyang //
translated: then even though the elements are not different for living beings,

original: khyad par 'di rten gang yin pa //
analyzed: khyad par 'di rten gang yin pa //
translated: what is the basis for this difference?

original: de ni phul 'byung 'grib pa bzhin //
analyzed: de ni phul 'byung 'grib pa bzhin //
translated: It is like the increase and decrease of the elements.

original: de 'gyur ba las de med 'gyur //
analyzed: de 'gyur ba las de med 'gyur //
translated: When that changes, that is not.

original: chags sogs nges med ces gang brjod pa de la gzhan gyi /
analyzed: chags sogs nges med ces gang brjod pa de la gzhan gyi /
translated: As for the statement that passion, etc., are not determined,

original: sa la sogs pa'i 'dus pa 'dod chags dang bral ba ni yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: sa la sogs pa'i 'dus pa 'dod chags dang bral ba ni yod pa nyid do //
translated: there is a separation from passion in the coming together of earth, etc.

original: 'on te srog chags 'ga' zhig 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin na ni /
analyzed: 'on te srog chags 'ga' zhig 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin na ni /
translated: But if it is said that some living being becomes separated from passion,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: ci ltar srog chags srog chags ma yin par mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: ci ltar srog chags srog chags ma yin par mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
translated: Just as a living being does not become a non-living being,

original: 'dod chags dang bral bar yang mi 'gyur ro zhes brtsad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral bar yang mi 'gyur ro zhes brtsad pa yin no //
translated: and one would not become free from attachment.

original: gal te de lta na yang ci ltar chags nyid khyad par yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: gal te de lta na yang ci ltar chags nyid khyad par yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: But even if that is so, just as attachment itself does not exist as a distinct real entity,

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa yang yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa yang yin pa'i phyir /
translated: so too, desire and the desirous one are not distinct.

original: thams cad 'dod chags mtshungs pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: thams cad 'dod chags mtshungs pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, all would be the same in being desirous.

original: srog chags nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: srog chags nyid bzhin no //
translated: Like the living being.

original: yang na gal te 'ga' zhig srog chag yin la 'ga' zhig gzhan du yin pa de bzhin du 'dod chag dang ldan pa dang gzhan du'ang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang na gal te 'ga' zhig srog chag yin la 'ga' zhig gzhan du yin pa de bzhin du 'dod chag dang ldan pa dang gzhan du'ang 'gyur ro //
translated: Or, if one is a living being and another is not, then one is desirous and another is not.

original: 'on te srog chags nyid ni tha dad pa med pa la /
analyzed: 'on te srog chags nyid ni tha dad pa med pa la /
translated: But if living being is not distinct,

original: 'dod chags la sos pa tha dad pa yin na /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sos pa tha dad pa yin na /
translated: and desire is distinct,

original: de tshe 'byung ba'i khyad par gyis rgyu gang las tha dad par 'gyur ba de bzhin du 'phel ba dang 'grib pa srid pas gtan nas med par yang 'gyur ba'i phyir /🔽'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de tshe 'byung ba'i khyad par gyis rgyu gang las tha dad par 'gyur ba de bzhin du 'phel ba dang 'grib pa srid pas gtan nas med par yang 'gyur ba'i phyir /🔽'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then, since it is possible that it would increase and decrease due to the distinction of the elements, one would become free from attachment.

original: gal te yang rgyu 'phel ba dang 'grib pa rgyu dang ldan pa yin pa de lta na yang /
analyzed: gal te yang rgyu 'phel ba dang 'grib pa rgyu dang ldan pa yin pa de lta na yang /
translated: But even if the increase and decrease of the cause is due to a cause,

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa rgyu mtshungs pa'i bsag nyid ni ldog pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa rgyu mtshungs pa'i bsag nyid ni ldog pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: still, the accumulation of causes such as attachment is not eliminated.

original: 'di la brjod pa /
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa /
translated: To this, we reply:

original: gal te chags sogs tha dad kyang //
analyzed: gal te chags sogs tha dad kyang //
translated: If, although attachment, etc. are distinct,

original: rgyu mtshungs bdag nyid mi ldog na //
analyzed: rgyu mtshungs bdag nyid mi ldog na //
translated: the similarity of their causes is not eliminated,

original: bdag @121a * //
analyzed: bdag @121a * //
translated: then,

original: nyid 'dra ba'i rgyu can gyi //
analyzed: nyid 'dra ba'i rgyu can gyi //
translated: because of the similarity of their causes,

original: 'dod chags kun la 'dra bar 'gyur //
analyzed: 'dod chags kun la 'dra bar 'gyur //
translated: all attachments would be similar.

original: gal te 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshungs pa nyid gang yin pa de /
analyzed: gal te 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshungs pa nyid gang yin pa de /
translated: If the similarity of the causes of attachment, etc.

original: mi spong ba des na mtshungs pa nyid 'dod chags kyi rgyu yin no //🔽rgyu mtshungs pa yin na yang 'bras bu 'dod chags la sogs pa mtshungs pa nyid de /
analyzed: mi spong ba des na mtshungs pa nyid 'dod chags kyi rgyu yin no // rgyu mtshungs pa yin na yang 'bras bu 'dod chags la sogs pa mtshungs pa nyid de /
translated: is not eliminated, then similarity would be the cause of attachment.🔽If the causes are similar, then the effects, such as attachment, etc., would be similar,

original: rgyu 'dra ba'i bdag nyid ni 'bras bu yang 'dra ba'i bdag nyid can nyid do zhes rigs so //
analyzed: rgyu 'dra ba'i bdag nyid ni 'bras bu yang 'dra ba'i bdag nyid can nyid do zhes rigs so //
translated: because the similarity of the causes would be the similarity of the effects.

original: gal te rgyu mtshungs kyang 'bras bu khyad par dang ldan pa'i phyir mtshungs pa ma yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te rgyu mtshungs kyang 'bras bu khyad par dang ldan pa'i phyir mtshungs pa ma yin na ni /
translated: If, although the cause is the same, the effect is not the same because it has a special quality,

original: de'i tshe de'i 'bras bu nyid du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe de'i 'bras bu nyid du mi 'gyur te /
translated: then at that time it would not be its effect,

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would not conform with the presence or absence of the cause.

original: de'i phyir gang la khyad par gyi rim pa yod pa de la gtan med par 'gyur ba srid pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang la khyad par gyi rim pa yod pa de la gtan med par 'gyur ba srid pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is possible that what has a special quality would not exist at all,

original: 'grib pa'i khyad par yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'grib pa'i khyad par yod pa'i phyir /
translated: because there is a special quality of decrease.

original: dkar po la sogs pa'i yon tan bzhin no //
analyzed: dkar po la sogs pa'i yon tan bzhin no //
translated: It is like the qualities of white, etc.

original: yang na ni mtshungs pa las mi nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang na ni mtshungs pa las mi nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: Or else, it would not deteriorate from being the same.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: mtshungs bdag las 'byung ba lang gi / shes pa'am 'dir yang sa sogs la //🔽srog sogs dag kyang khyad par gyi //
analyzed: mtshungs bdag las 'byung ba lang gi / shes pa'am 'dir yang sa sogs la // srog sogs dag kyang khyad par gyi //
translated: Because, like the consciousness of a cow, or the earth, etc.,🔽life, etc.🔽also do not have a special quality

original: rim par la lar yod ma yin //
analyzed: rim par la lar yod ma yin //
translated: in every case.

original: de ma yin pa'i rang bzhin las ldog pa'am gzhan la yang rung ba mtshungs pa'i khyad par bdag nyid las 'byung ba'i ba lang gi shes pa de ni ba lang ngo //🔽ches shin tu yang ba lang ngo zhes khyad par gyi rim pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa'am /
analyzed: de ma yin pa'i rang bzhin las ldog pa'am gzhan la yang rung ba mtshungs pa'i khyad par bdag nyid las 'byung ba'i ba lang gi shes pa de ni ba lang ngo // ches shin tu yang ba lang ngo zhes khyad par gyi rim pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa'am /
translated: The cognition of a cow that arises from a cow itself, or from something else that is similar to a cow, is not a cognition of a cow that is qualified by a degree of difference.

original: 'jig rten rgyang phan pa'i lta ba la ltos nas sa la sogs pa la srog chags dang cher srog chags dang / ches shin tu srog chags zhes khyad par gyi rim pa dang ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten rgyang phan pa'i lta ba la ltos nas sa la sogs pa la srog chags dang cher srog chags dang / ches shin tu srog chags zhes khyad par gyi rim pa dang ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: Or, in relation to the Lokāyata view, it is not a cognition of a cow that is qualified by a degree of difference, such as “earth is a living being,” “earth is a great living being,” or “earth is a very living being.”

original: de'i phyir rgyu mtshungs pa las ni mtshungs pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu mtshungs pa las ni mtshungs pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, similarity arises from a similar cause.

original: 'grib pa yod na ni gtan chad par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'grib pa yod na ni gtan chad par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: If there were a decrease, there would be complete annihilation.

original: dro rim khyad par yod na yang //
analyzed: dro rim khyad par yod na yang //
translated: If there were a difference in the degree of heat,

original: dro med me 'ga' yod min pa //
analyzed: dro med me 'ga' yod min pa //
translated: there would be fire without heat.

original: de bzhin 'dir yang zhe na min //🔽dro las me gzhan bkag phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin 'dir yang zhe na min // dro las me gzhan bkag phyir ro //
translated: This is not so here, because🔽fire is refuted as being different from heat.

original: me la dro ba'i khyad par ni yod pa kho na'o //
analyzed: me la dro ba'i khyad par ni yod pa kho na'o //
translated: There is only a difference in the degree of heat in fire.

original: de lta na yang dro ba bdag nyid thams cad du med par 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta na yang dro ba bdag nyid thams cad du med par 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not that heat is not present in all of fire.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa yang de bzhin du thams cad du srid pa med par ni mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa yang de bzhin du thams cad du srid pa med par ni mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: And so it is with attachment, etc. It is not that they are not present in all of the elements.

original: ma yin te 'dod chags la sogs pa ni lus las tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin te 'dod chags la sogs pa ni lus las tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: No, because attachment, etc. are different from the body.

original: 'dir @121b mi ni dro ba las tha dad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir @121b mi ni dro ba las tha dad pa ma yin te /
translated: Here, a man is not different from heat,

original: dro ba nyid la me brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dro ba nyid la me brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because fire is spoken of as heat itself.

original: gal te dro ba med na ni /
analyzed: gal te dro ba med na ni /
translated: If there were no heat,

original: me nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: me nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: it would not be fire.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa med na sa la sogs pa nyid du mi 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa med na sa la sogs pa nyid du mi 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not that if there were no attachment, etc. there would be no earth, etc.

original: gal te 'byung ba'i 'dus pa gzhan chos can yin la /
analyzed: gal te 'byung ba'i 'dus pa gzhan chos can yin la /
translated: If the collection of elements is the subject,

original: dro ba de'i chos su yongs su rtog na ni /
analyzed: dro ba de'i chos su yongs su rtog na ni /
translated: and heat is conceived as its attribute,

original: de'i tshe thal bar 'gyur ba'i gnas skabs na dro ba de las rgyun 'chad pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i tshe thal bar 'gyur ba'i gnas skabs na dro ba de las rgyun 'chad pa nyid do //
translated: then at the time of the appearance of ashes, the continuity of heat would be broken.

original: 'on te 'bar ba chos can du brtags pa yin la dro ba chos yin zhing /
analyzed: 'on te 'bar ba chos can du brtags pa yin la dro ba chos yin zhing /
translated: But if the burning is taken as the subject, and heat as the attribute,

original: de ni khyad par gyi rim pa yod kyang de 'chad pa ma yin no zhes bya ba gzhan gyi lan yin na /
analyzed: de ni khyad par gyi rim pa yod kyang de 'chad pa ma yin no zhes bya ba gzhan gyi lan yin na /
translated: This is the opponent’s reply.

original: de yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: de yang mi rigs te /
translated: But that is not correct.

original: sngags rgyud la sogs nus pa yis //
analyzed: sngags rgyud la sogs nus pa yis //
translated: Because of the power of the mantra,

original: dro ba med par 'bar bar 'gyur //
analyzed: dro ba med par 'bar bar 'gyur //
translated: the fire blazes without heat.

original: nor bu 'bar ba dro med par //
analyzed: nor bu 'bar ba dro med par //
translated: The blazing jewel is seen without heat.

original: mthong ba de ni mi 'thad min //
analyzed: mthong ba de ni mi 'thad min //
translated: That is not incorrect.

original: dbyer med phyir 'bar dro ba la //
analyzed: dbyer med phyir 'bar dro ba la //
translated: Because of inseparability, the fire blazes and is hot.

original: ltos te chos can nyid kyang yin //
analyzed: ltos te chos can nyid kyang yin //
translated: It is also the subject.

original: mdog dang dbyibs kyi 'bar ba ni //🔽med kyang dro ba yod pa'i phyir ;
analyzed: mdog dang dbyibs kyi 'bar ba ni // med kyang dro ba yod pa'i phyir ;
translated: The fire of color and shape🔽exists without heat.

original: / chos can nyid du de mi 'thad //
analyzed: / chos can nyid du de mi 'thad //
translated: Therefore, it is not correct as the subject.

original: des na de ni dbye ba yin //🔽'bar ba ni dro ba med par mi 'byung la /
analyzed: des na de ni dbye ba yin // 'bar ba ni dro ba med par mi 'byung la /
translated: Therefore, that is the division.🔽The fire does not occur without heat.

original: dro ba ni 'bar ba med par mi 'byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: dro ba ni 'bar ba med par mi 'byung ba ma yin no //
translated: But heat does not occur without fire.

original: des na chos can nyid du mi 'thad do //
analyzed: des na chos can nyid du mi 'thad do //
translated: Therefore, it is not correct as the subject.

original: gtan mi 'bral ba'i 'bral ba dang de'i dro ba dag ni chos dang chos can gyi dngos po ma yin no //
analyzed: gtan mi 'bral ba'i 'bral ba dang de'i dro ba dag ni chos dang chos can gyi dngos po ma yin no //
translated: The heat of the fire that is never separated from it is not the entity of the subject and object.

original: gtan tshigs ni khyad par dang bcas pa yin te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs ni khyad par dang bcas pa yin te /
translated: The reason is qualified.

original: gang zhig gzhan yod yon tan ni //
analyzed: gang zhig gzhan yod yon tan ni //
translated: The qualities of something else

original: khyad par rim pa dang ldan par //
analyzed: khyad par rim pa dang ldan par //
translated: are experienced in a certain order.

original: de dag de yi khyad par ni //
analyzed: de dag de yi khyad par ni //
translated: Those qualities are not

original: la lar 'chad 'gyur dkar sogs bzhin //
analyzed: la lar 'chad 'gyur dkar sogs bzhin //
translated: experienced in another way, as in the case of white, etc.

original: gang zhig gzhan du 'gyur ba'i yon tan khyad par gyi rim pa nyams su myong ba can de dag ni la lar 'chad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig gzhan du 'gyur ba'i yon tan khyad par gyi rim pa nyams su myong ba can de dag ni la lar 'chad pa ma yin te /
translated: Those qualities that are experienced in a certain order in another thing are not experienced in another way.

original: dper na snam bu la sogs pa la dkar po la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na snam bu la sogs pa la dkar po la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like white, etc., in a cloth, etc.

original: gang gis yod pa gzhan de la dkar po la sogs pa 'chad par 'gyur ba /
analyzed: gang gis yod pa gzhan de la dkar po la sogs pa 'chad par 'gyur ba /
translated: If the qualities of something else are experienced in another way, as in the case of white, etc.,

original: dkar po la sogs pa rang bzhin la tha dad pa'i snam bu la sogs pa gzhan gang yod ce na /
analyzed: dkar po la sogs pa rang bzhin la tha dad pa'i snam bu la sogs pa gzhan gang yod ce na /
translated: what other thing, different from the nature of white, etc., is there in a cloth, etc.?

original: de ni bden te 'on kyang snam bu la sogs pa ni rig bya'i rang bzhin yin gyi /
analyzed: de ni bden te 'on kyang snam bu la sogs pa ni rig bya'i rang bzhin yin gyi /
translated: That is true, but a cloth, etc., is the nature of something that can be perceived.

original: kha dog gi khyad par gyi rang bzhin ni ma yin te /
analyzed: kha dog gi khyad par gyi rang bzhin ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not the nature of a particular color,

original: de med kyang snam bu yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med kyang snam bu yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because a cloth, etc., exists even when that does not.

original: des na gzhan gyis zhes bya ba'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: des na gzhan gyis zhes bya ba'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: Thus, the meaning of “other” is as follows.

original: gang zhig rgyun gyis 'jug pa la //🔽'chad pa'i chos dang skye ba'i chos gang yin pa de ni gtan chad pa'i chos @122a * //
analyzed: gang zhig rgyun gyis 'jug pa la // 'chad pa'i chos dang skye ba'i chos gang yin pa de ni gtan chad pa'i chos @122a * //
translated: The meaning of the statement is that whatever is engaged in a continuum

original: su yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: su yang 'gyur te /
translated: would be a phenomenon that is completely terminated, because it would be a phenomenon that is terminated and arises.

original: dper na dkar po la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni ngag gi don to //
analyzed: dper na dkar po la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni ngag gi don to //
translated: For example, it would be like white, etc.

original: yang na me nyid rjes su 'jug pa na dro ba khyad par gyi rim pa yod kyang 'byung ba dang bral ba ma yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: yang na me nyid rjes su 'jug pa na dro ba khyad par gyi rim pa yod kyang 'byung ba dang bral ba ma yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: Or, just as fire, when engaged, has a continuum of heat, even though there is a sequence of distinctions, it is not devoid of the elements.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: But that is not so for attachment, etc.,

original: 'chad pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'chad pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because their termination is possible.

original: nus pa mi 'chad do zhe na /
analyzed: nus pa mi 'chad do zhe na /
translated: If you say that their potency is not terminated,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: that is not so,

original: nus pa'i don gzhan yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nus pa'i don gzhan yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because potency has a different meaning.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa nyid ni nus pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa nyid ni nus pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn’t attachment, etc., itself potency?

original: nus pa yang la lar 'chad pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nus pa yang la lar 'chad pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because potency is sometimes seen to be terminated.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bshad pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: gzugs sogs bzhin du nges min de //
analyzed: gzugs sogs bzhin du nges min de //
translated: It is not like form, etc., because it is not definite.

original: de dag 'byung dang dbyer med phyir //
analyzed: de dag 'byung dang dbyer med phyir //
translated: because they are inseparable from the elements.

original: gal te de mtshungs she na min //
analyzed: gal te de mtshungs she na min //
translated: If you say that they are the same, no,

original: chags sogs lhan cig skye thal phyir //
analyzed: chags sogs lhan cig skye thal phyir //
translated: because attachment, etc., would be innate.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa ni gzugs dang ro la sogs pa ltar 'byung ba dag dbyer med pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa ni gzugs dang ro la sogs pa ltar 'byung ba dag dbyer med pa yin te /
translated: Attachment, etc., are not inseparable from the elements, like form, taste, etc.

original: de med kyang 'byung ba rnams yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med kyang 'byung ba rnams yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the elements exist even when they do not.

original: gzugs dang ro la sogs pa med par ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs dang ro la sogs pa med par ma yin no //
translated: Form, taste, etc., do not exist when they do not.

original: 'on te der yang de lta bu nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te der yang de lta bu nyid do zhe na /
translated: If you say that the same is true of the elements, no,

original: de yang mi bden te /
analyzed: de yang mi bden te /
translated: because that is not so.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams lus dang lhan cig skye bar thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams lus dang lhan cig skye bar thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it follows that attachment, etc., would be innate with the body.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa ni lus dang thams cad kyi tshe lhan cig 'byung ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa ni lus dang thams cad kyi tshe lhan cig 'byung ba yang ma yin no //
translated: Attachment, etc., are not always innate with the body.

original: 'byung ba chen po tsam de kho nar smra ba rnams kyi gzugs la sogs pa 'byung ba dag las tha dad pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po tsam de kho nar smra ba rnams kyi gzugs la sogs pa 'byung ba dag las tha dad pa yang ma yin te /
translated: For those who maintain that form, etc., are just the great elements, form, etc., are not different from the elements,

original: de kho na mang por thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de kho na mang por thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it follows that there would be many of those.

original: des na rnam par dbyer med pa ni lhan cig skye ba yin no //
analyzed: des na rnam par dbyer med pa ni lhan cig skye ba yin no //
translated: Thus, non-differentiation is co-emergence.

original: gal te yul gyi rgyu can yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te yul gyi rgyu can yin pa'i phyir /
translated: If it is the cause of the object,

original: yul nye bar gnas pa med na res 'ga' med par yang 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: yul nye bar gnas pa med na res 'ga' med par yang 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: then it would not exist sometimes, because the object would not be present.

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so,

original: rnam par brtags pa'i yul yin phyir //
analyzed: rnam par brtags pa'i yul yin phyir //
translated: because the object is imagined,

original: yul yang nges byed ma yin no //
analyzed: yul yang nges byed ma yin no //
translated: the object is not the determiner.

original: skal mnyam rgyu dang bral ba'i phyir //
analyzed: skal mnyam rgyu dang bral ba'i phyir //
translated: Because it is devoid of the cause of homogeneity,

original: chags sogs nges pa med pa 'am //
analyzed: chags sogs nges pa med pa 'am //
translated: attachment, etc., are not determined.

original: rgyu ni nye phyir blo rnams kun //
analyzed: rgyu ni nye phyir blo rnams kun //
translated: Because the cause is near, all cognitions

original: thams cad tshe na skye bar 'gyur //
analyzed: thams cad tshe na skye bar 'gyur //
translated: arise at all times.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rgyu ni yul gyi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa dang 'brel pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rgyu ni yul gyi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa dang 'brel pa ma yin te /
translated: The cause of attachment, etc., is not related to the presence or absence of the object,

original: de med par 'gyur ba nyams su myong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med par 'gyur ba nyams su myong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because its absence is experienced.

original: skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yang mi 'dod de /
analyzed: skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yang mi 'dod de /
translated: Nor is it the cause of homogeneity,

original: des na 'dod @122b chags la sogs pa nges pa med pa'i phyir res 'ga' mi skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na 'dod @122b chags la sogs pa nges pa med pa'i phyir res 'ga' mi skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: because attachment, etc., are not determined. Therefore, they do not arise sometimes.

original: des na nges pa med pas lus 'dod chags la sogs pa re re dang lhan cig 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na nges pa med pas lus 'dod chags la sogs pa re re dang lhan cig 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, since there is no certainty, the body would arise simultaneously with each of desire, etc.

original: yang na 'dod chags la sogs pa thams cad kyi rgyu lus dang lhan cig 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang na 'dod chags la sogs pa thams cad kyi rgyu lus dang lhan cig 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Or else, the body would arise simultaneously with the cause of all desire, etc.

original: thams cad kyi rgyu lus nye bar gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad kyi rgyu lus nye bar gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the cause of all would be present in the body.

original: 'on te gang gi 'dod chags la sogs pa lhan cig mi 'byung ba de 'dra ba de ni lus kyi yongs su gyur ba'i khyad par nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te gang gi 'dod chags la sogs pa lhan cig mi 'byung ba de 'dra ba de ni lus kyi yongs su gyur ba'i khyad par nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: But if the body is transformed in such a way that desire, etc. do not arise simultaneously with it,

original: gal te de lta na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na /
translated: then in that case,

original: gang gis de dag de ltar 'gyur ba de'i yongs su 'gyur ba'i khyad par de 'dra ba de ga las yin ;
analyzed: gang gis de dag de ltar 'gyur ba de'i yongs su 'gyur ba'i khyad par de 'dra ba de ga las yin ;
translated: what is the cause of that transformation of the body, by which desire, etc. do not arise simultaneously with it?

original: gang yang rung ba las she na //
analyzed: gang yang rung ba las she na //
translated: If you say that it is any cause whatsoever,

original: kun tshe 'byung bar yang mi 'gyur //
analyzed: kun tshe 'byung bar yang mi 'gyur //
translated: then desire, etc. would not arise at all.

original: gal te de ltar ma mthong zhes //
analyzed: gal te de ltar ma mthong zhes //
translated: If you say that you do not see any such cause,

original: 'ga' yang rgyu dang bcas mi 'gyur //
analyzed: 'ga' yang rgyu dang bcas mi 'gyur //
translated: then nothing would have a cause.

original: me med par yang du bar 'gyur //
analyzed: me med par yang du bar 'gyur //
translated: Smoke would arise even without fire.

original: kun las ci yi phyir mi 'gyur //
analyzed: kun las ci yi phyir mi 'gyur //
translated: Why would it not arise from everything?

original: de la rnam 'gyur 'ga' zhig ces //
analyzed: de la rnam 'gyur 'ga' zhig ces //
translated: “Some manifestations”

original: de ltar brjod par nus pa yin //
analyzed: de ltar brjod par nus pa yin //
translated: can be said in the same way.

original: dngos po rgyu med pa la yang //
analyzed: dngos po rgyu med pa la yang //
translated: Even if things are causeless,

original: yul la sogs pa nges par 'gyur //
analyzed: yul la sogs pa nges par 'gyur //
translated: the object and so on would be ascertained.

original: nges pa med pa ma mthong zhes //
analyzed: nges pa med pa ma mthong zhes //
translated: “There is no ascertainment, because it is not seen”

original: der yang brjod par nus pa yin //🔽gal te rnam pa thams cad du //
analyzed: der yang brjod par nus pa yin // gal te rnam pa thams cad du //
translated: can be said in the same way.🔽If one relies on mere seeing

original: mthong ba tsam la rten byed na //
analyzed: mthong ba tsam la rten byed na //
translated: in every way,

original: mthong ba gnyis med nyid yin pas //
analyzed: mthong ba gnyis med nyid yin pas //
translated: because there is no second seeing,

original: 'dir ni tha snyad 'jig par 'gyur //🔽gal te tha snyad dor bar ni //
analyzed: 'dir ni tha snyad 'jig par 'gyur // gal te tha snyad dor bar ni //
translated: the conventions would be destroyed.🔽If one understands

original: mu nus par ni rtogs byed na //🔽'jig rten pha rol la sogs pa //
analyzed: mu nus par ni rtogs byed na // 'jig rten pha rol la sogs pa //
translated: that it is possible to reject conventions,🔽then how could this

original: 'di yang gzhan du ji ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: 'di yang gzhan du ji ltar 'gyur //
translated: world beyond and so on be otherwise?

original: ji ltar rjes su dpag pa yis //
analyzed: ji ltar rjes su dpag pa yis //
translated: Just as inference

original: tha snyad thams cad byed 'gyur ba //🔽de bzhin 'jig rten pha rol la yang //
analyzed: tha snyad thams cad byed 'gyur ba // de bzhin 'jig rten pha rol la yang //
translated: can perform all conventions,🔽in the same way,

original: 'di ni ji ltar 'dor bar byed //
analyzed: 'di ni ji ltar 'dor bar byed //
translated: how could this reject the world beyond?🔽The cognition of difference and the object

original: tha dad shes dang don dag dang // sngon po la sogs byas pa'am //
analyzed: tha dad shes dang don dag dang // sngon po la sogs byas pa'am //
translated: are made blue and so on,

original: snga dang phyi ma'i ngo bo ni //
analyzed: snga dang phyi ma'i ngo bo ni //
translated: or the nature of earlier and later

original: mngon sum gyis ni rab grub med //🔽des na tha snyad dbye ba ni //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis ni rab grub med // des na tha snyad dbye ba ni //
translated: And it is not established by direct perception.🔽Therefore, all the distinctions of convention

original: thams cad rjes su dpag par byas //
analyzed: thams cad rjes su dpag par byas //
translated: Are to be inferred.

original: des na rjes dpag spangs nas ni //
analyzed: des na rjes dpag spangs nas ni //
translated: Thus, having abandoned inference,

original: 'ga' yang 'tsho bar nus ma yin //
analyzed: 'ga' yang 'tsho bar nus ma yin //
translated: No one is able to live.🔽Therefore, this is clear:

original: de'i phyir / gang dag mthong ba'i don spangs nas //
analyzed: de'i phyir / gang dag mthong ba'i don spangs nas //
translated: Those who abandon the object of seeing

original: ma mthong gzhan ni rtogs byed pa //🔽rmongs pa zan gong spangs nas ni //
analyzed: ma mthong gzhan ni rtogs byed pa // rmongs pa zan gong spangs nas ni //
translated: And realize something else that is not seen🔽Are confused, like one who abandons food

original: lag stong ldag byed ci bzhin no //🔽zhes bya ba de gsal ba yin te /
analyzed: lag stong ldag byed ci bzhin no // zhes bya ba de gsal ba yin te /
translated: And bites the empty fist.

original: blang dang dor bya'i khyad par ni //
analyzed: blang dang dor bya'i khyad par ni //
translated: The distinction of what is to be adopted and what is to be rejected

original: rnam dbye mngon sum las @123a * //
analyzed: rnam dbye mngon sum las @123a * //
translated: Is not made by direct perception.

original: ma yin // 'di ni spang bya min no zhes //
analyzed: ma yin // 'di ni spang bya min no zhes //
translated: This is not to be abandoned

original: 'di ni mngon sum tsam gyis min //
analyzed: 'di ni mngon sum tsam gyis min //
translated: Is not by direct perception alone.

original: blang bya nyid ni yod pa yang //
analyzed: blang bya nyid ni yod pa yang //
translated: What exists as something to be adopted

original: dor bya nyid ni bkag las yin //
analyzed: dor bya nyid ni bkag las yin //
translated: Is from the negation of what is to be rejected.

original: blang bya nyid du bzhag pa ni //
analyzed: blang bya nyid du bzhag pa ni //
translated: What is posited as something to be adopted

original: dor bya las ni bzlog phyir ro //
analyzed: dor bya las ni bzlog phyir ro //
translated: Is from turning away from what is to be rejected.

original: rtogs byed don du gnyer rnams kyi //
analyzed: rtogs byed don du gnyer rnams kyi //
translated: For those who seek to realize

original: blang bya rtag tu don bya yin //
analyzed: blang bya rtag tu don bya yin //
translated: What is to be adopted is always meaningful.

original: de ni mngon sum gyis mi mthong //
analyzed: de ni mngon sum gyis mi mthong //
translated: It is not seen by direct perception.

original: de las 'jug par 'dod pa rnams //🔽des na blang bya'i dngos po ni //
analyzed: de las 'jug par 'dod pa rnams // des na blang bya'i dngos po ni //
translated: Those who wish to engage in that🔽Do not know the object of adoption

original: mngon sum gyis ni rig ma yin //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis ni rig ma yin //
translated: Through direct perception.

original: mngon sum 'byung 'gyur don byed ni //
analyzed: mngon sum 'byung 'gyur don byed ni //
translated: The object of direct perception is not an object of activity

original: rig min bzlas pa yang ma yin //
analyzed: rig min bzlas pa yang ma yin //
translated: That is known or not known.

original: spang bya dbang po las 'das phyir //
analyzed: spang bya dbang po las 'das phyir //
translated: The object of rejection is beyond the senses,

original: spang bya dgag pa'ang ga la yod //
analyzed: spang bya dgag pa'ang ga la yod //
translated: So how can there be a negation of the object of rejection?

original: dngos po 'di ni med do zhes //
analyzed: dngos po 'di ni med do zhes //
translated: The thought This thing does not exist

original: rtogs 'di mngon sum las ma yin //🔽blang dang dor bya rtogs pa yi //
analyzed: rtogs 'di mngon sum las ma yin // blang dang dor bya rtogs pa yi //
translated: Is not from direct perception.🔽There is no direct perception

original: mngon sum gnyi ga yod ma yin //
analyzed: mngon sum gnyi ga yod ma yin //
translated: Of both the object of adoption and the object of rejection.

original: 'dir yang sngar gyi rigs pa ni //
analyzed: 'dir yang sngar gyi rigs pa ni //
translated: Here, the previous reasoning

original: slar la bzlog na 'jug pa yin //🔽gal te shin tu goms pa yi //
analyzed: slar la bzlog na 'jug pa yin // gal te shin tu goms pa yi //
translated: Is reversed and engages again.🔽If it is said that everything is understood

original: mngon sum las kun rtogs she na //
analyzed: mngon sum las kun rtogs she na //
translated: From direct perception through thorough familiarity,

original: ma rtogs pa la goms pa med //
analyzed: ma rtogs pa la goms pa med //
translated: Without understanding, there is no familiarity,

original: des na phan tshun brten pa yin //
analyzed: des na phan tshun brten pa yin //
translated: So they are mutually dependent.

original: ji srid mngon sum med par ni //
analyzed: ji srid mngon sum med par ni //
translated: As long as there is no direct perception,

original: goms pa las ni rtogs ma yin //
analyzed: goms pa las ni rtogs ma yin //
translated: There is no understanding from familiarity.

original: ji srid rtogs med ma goms la //
analyzed: ji srid rtogs med ma goms la //
translated: As long as there is no understanding, there is no familiarity.

original: mngon sum skye bar 'gyur ma yin //
analyzed: mngon sum skye bar 'gyur ma yin //
translated: But it is not born as direct perception.

original: gal te mngon sum 'dir tshad yin na ni //
analyzed: gal te mngon sum 'dir tshad yin na ni //
translated: If direct perception were valid cognition here,

original: blang dang cig shos rnam 'byed med par 'gyur //
analyzed: blang dang cig shos rnam 'byed med par 'gyur //
translated: There would be no distinction between what is to be adopted and what is to be rejected.

original: des na rang gi rang bzhin tsam rig ste //
analyzed: des na rang gi rang bzhin tsam rig ste //
translated: Therefore, it cognizes only its own nature,

original: gnyis med de nyid du ni thal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: gnyis med de nyid du ni thal bar 'gyur //
translated: And it would follow that it is nondual and real.

original: rjes su dpag pa la brten nas //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa la brten nas //
translated: Based on inference,

original: blang bya la sogs pa rnam 'byed nyid //
analyzed: blang bya la sogs pa rnam 'byed nyid //
translated: There is the distinction between what is to be adopted and what is to be rejected.

original: des na tha snyad rtogs pas na //
analyzed: des na tha snyad rtogs pas na //
translated: Therefore, through understanding conventions,

original: gzhan yang yongs su tshol mi byed //
analyzed: gzhan yang yongs su tshol mi byed //
translated: One does not seek anything further.

original: 'on te gnyis med la brten nas //
analyzed: 'on te gnyis med la brten nas //
translated: But if, based on nonduality,

original: 'jig rten pha rol spong byed na //🔽'di yang byos shig de tsam gyis //
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol spong byed na // 'di yang byos shig de tsam gyis //
translated: One rejects a world beyond,🔽Then this is not the way to do it,

original: 'di ni rnam par gnas ma yin //
analyzed: 'di ni rnam par gnas ma yin //
translated: For this is not how it is.

original: 'jig rten 'di yang yod min te //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di yang yod min te //
translated: This world does not exist,

original: des na med pa pa yang med //🔽de lta yin na thams cad ni //
analyzed: des na med pa pa yang med // de lta yin na thams cad ni //
translated: So there is no nihilism.🔽If that were so,

original: spangs phyir sems ni grol ba nyid //
analyzed: spangs phyir sems ni grol ba nyid //
translated: Then all would be liberated through abandonment.

original: 'on te 'jig rten 'di la gang //
analyzed: 'on te 'jig rten 'di la gang //
translated: But if this world

original: gus pa 'di ni rmongs pa ste //
analyzed: gus pa 'di ni rmongs pa ste //
translated: Is out of respect for it,

original: 'di yang zad 'dod su zhig ni //
analyzed: 'di yang zad 'dod su zhig ni //
translated: Then who would desire

original: rmongs pa gzhan ni 'dod par byed //
analyzed: rmongs pa gzhan ni 'dod par byed //
translated: But others are deluded about this.

original: rmongs pa 'di nyid ga las yin //
analyzed: rmongs pa 'di nyid ga las yin //
translated: Where does this delusion come from?

original: gal te thog mtha' med grub na //
analyzed: gal te thog mtha' med grub na //
translated: If it is established that there is no beginning or end,

original: de nyid 'jig rten pha rol te //
analyzed: de nyid 'jig rten pha rol te //
translated: Then this very thing is the next world.

original: mang du smra ba gzhan don med//
analyzed: mang du smra ba gzhan don med//
translated: But speaking much is pointless.

original: @123b 'on te 'di rgyu med nyid na //
analyzed: @123b 'on te 'di rgyu med nyid na //
translated: But if this has no cause,

original: thams cad rgyu med nyid du 'gyur //
analyzed: thams cad rgyu med nyid du 'gyur //
translated: Then everything would have no cause.

original: de lta yin na med pa pa //
analyzed: de lta yin na med pa pa //
translated: If that were so, then the nihilistic

original: khyod kyis smras pa don med 'gyur //
analyzed: khyod kyis smras pa don med 'gyur //
translated: Meaningless words you speak would be true.

original: gal te 'gar yang smras pa 'di //
analyzed: gal te 'gar yang smras pa 'di //
translated: If these words

original: nyer mkho min na ci don nyid //
analyzed: nyer mkho min na ci don nyid //
translated: Are not useful, then what is their meaning?

original: 'on te 'di la don 'ga' yod //
analyzed: 'on te 'di la don 'ga' yod //
translated: But if they have some meaning,

original: 'di de nyid kyi rgyur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di de nyid kyi rgyur 'gyur ro //
translated: Then this would be the cause of reality.

original: 'on te gzhan gyis gzhan la ni //
analyzed: 'on te gzhan gyis gzhan la ni //
translated: But if another

original: 'di ltar brgal zhing brtag byed na //
analyzed: 'di ltar brgal zhing brtag byed na //
translated: Questions and analyzes another,

original: gal te 'ga' yi rgyu min na //
analyzed: gal te 'ga' yi rgyu min na //
translated: If it is not the cause of anything,

original: des byas pas kyang don ci yod //
analyzed: des byas pas kyang don ci yod //
translated: Then what is the point of what it produces?

original: gal te 'di ni ma rig pas //
analyzed: gal te 'di ni ma rig pas //
translated: If it is produced by ignorance,

original: byas nyid su yis len zhe na //
analyzed: byas nyid su yis len zhe na //
translated: Who is it that appropriates it?

original: gal te ma rig chad min na //
analyzed: gal te ma rig chad min na //
translated: If ignorance is not cut off,

original: gzhan gyis bshad pa don med nyid //
analyzed: gzhan gyis bshad pa don med nyid //
translated: Then the explanation of others is meaningless.

original: 'on te ma rig chad na yang //
analyzed: 'on te ma rig chad na yang //
translated: But if ignorance is cut off,

original: gzhan gyis brjod pa don med nyid //
analyzed: gzhan gyis brjod pa don med nyid //
translated: But the statements of others are meaningless.

original: ma rig rgyu dang ldan nyid na'ang //
analyzed: ma rig rgyu dang ldan nyid na'ang //
translated: Even if ignorance has a cause,

original: thog med ma rig rtogs par 'gyur //
analyzed: thog med ma rig rtogs par 'gyur //
translated: ignorance would be beginningless.

original: de lta yin dang 'khor ba ni //
analyzed: de lta yin dang 'khor ba ni //
translated: If that were so, then samsara

original: rtsod pa med par grub pa nyid //
analyzed: rtsod pa med par grub pa nyid //
translated: would be established without dispute.

original: ma rig rnam rtog las gzhan med //
analyzed: ma rig rnam rtog las gzhan med //
translated: Ignorance is nothing other than conceptualization.

original: de yang rnam rtog snga ma las //
analyzed: de yang rnam rtog snga ma las //
translated: And that is from a previous conceptualization.

original: des ni rnam par rtog pa 'di ;
analyzed: des ni rnam par rtog pa 'di ;
translated: Therefore, this conceptualization

original: / thog med rgyun 'brel grub pa nyid //
analyzed: / thog med rgyun 'brel grub pa nyid //
translated: is established as being connected to an endless continuum.

original: de'i phyir bde ba la sogs pa ni thog ma med pa'i bag chags yongs su smin pas byas pa tsam yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir bde ba la sogs pa ni thog ma med pa'i bag chags yongs su smin pas byas pa tsam yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, pleasure and so on are merely created by the ripening of beginningless latent propensities.

original: don dam par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam par ni ma yin no //
translated: They are not ultimately real.

original: des na don dam par ni thams cad sdug bsngal ba nyid do //
analyzed: des na don dam par ni thams cad sdug bsngal ba nyid do //
translated: Therefore, ultimately everything is only suffering.

original: sdug bsngal de yang /
analyzed: sdug bsngal de yang /
translated: And that suffering

original: de ni res 'ga' dmigs pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de ni res 'ga' dmigs pa'i phyir //
translated: is impermanent because it is sometimes observed.

original: mi rtag nyes pa'i rten phyir dang // rgyu dbang phyir yang sdug bsngal yin //
analyzed: mi rtag nyes pa'i rten phyir dang // rgyu dbang phyir yang sdug bsngal yin //
translated: It is also suffering because it is the basis of faults and because it is the power of the cause.

original: bdag min byin gyis brlabs pa'ang min //
analyzed: bdag min byin gyis brlabs pa'ang min //
translated: It is not a self, nor is it empowered.

original: rgyu min byin gyis brlabs pa min //
analyzed: rgyu min byin gyis brlabs pa min //
translated: It is not a cause, nor is it empowered.

original: rtag pa'ang ji ltar skyed byed yin //
analyzed: rtag pa'ang ji ltar skyed byed yin //
translated: How could a permanent thing be a producer?

original: de phyir gcig las du ma ni //
analyzed: de phyir gcig las du ma ni //
translated: Therefore, a plurality does not arise from a unity,

original: dus tha dad pa skye mi 'gyur //
analyzed: dus tha dad pa skye mi 'gyur //
translated: nor does a plurality produce a plurality.

original: mi rtag pa nyid dang ; sdug bsngal ba nyid dang / stong pa nyid dang / bdag med pa nyid ces bya ba ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid dang ; sdug bsngal ba nyid dang / stong pa nyid dang / bdag med pa nyid ces bya ba ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: The four aspects of the truth of suffering are impermanence, suffering, emptiness, and selflessness.

original: des na res 'ga' dmigs par bya ba nyid kyis mi rtag pa yin no //
analyzed: des na res 'ga' dmigs par bya ba nyid kyis mi rtag pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, impermanence is the state of being sometimes an object of knowledge.

original: rtag pa rtag tu mi dmigs par bya ba'i rang bzhin ni res 'ga' dmigs par mi 'thad de /
analyzed: rtag pa rtag tu mi dmigs par bya ba'i rang bzhin ni res 'ga' dmigs par mi 'thad de /
translated: It is not tenable that a permanent thing, whose nature is always to be an object of knowledge, is sometimes not an object of knowledge,

original: dmigs par bya ba dang cig shos kyi rang bzhin dag phan tshun spangs te gnas pa nyid kyis 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs par bya ba dang cig shos kyi rang bzhin dag phan tshun spangs te gnas pa nyid kyis 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the nature of being an object of knowledge and the nature of not being an object of knowledge are mutually exclusive.

original: dmigs par bya ba nyid ni yod pa yin no zhes pa bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs par bya ba nyid ni yod pa yin no zhes pa bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to demonstrate that the state of being an object of knowledge exists,🔽it is said, “It is not tenable that a permanent thing is sometimes an object of knowledge and sometimes not an object of knowledge.”

original: thams cad kyi tshe thams cad dmigs par nus pa ni ma yin te mi rtag pa ni rim gyis dmigs pa yin pa'i @124a * //
analyzed: thams cad kyi tshe thams cad dmigs par nus pa ni ma yin te mi rtag pa ni rim gyis dmigs pa yin pa'i @124a * //
translated: It is not possible for everything to be an object of knowledge at all times, because impermanence is an object of knowledge in sequence.

original: phyir ro // gcig la ni rim pa srid pa ma yin te /
analyzed: phyir ro // gcig la ni rim pa srid pa ma yin te /
translated: For, in the case of one thing, a sequence is not possible,

original: rim pa dang ldan pa cig shos nyid du mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rim pa dang ldan pa cig shos nyid du mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the other, which possesses a sequence, does not appear.

original: mngon sum mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because direct perception does not operate.

original: de med na rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de med na rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because, in the absence of that, inference does not exist,

original: mngon sum sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is preceded by direct perception.

original: rjes su dpag pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin na ni /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin na ni /
translated: If it is preceded by inference,

original: long ba brgyud par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: long ba brgyud par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: then it follows that the blind lead the blind.

original: de'i phyir 'du byed kyi phung po rnams ni mi rtag pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'du byed kyi phung po rnams ni mi rtag pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, the aggregates of the formative forces are impermanent.

original: sdug bsngal ba nyid ni /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba nyid ni /
translated: The truth of suffering is so called

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa nyes pa rnams kyi rten yin pa'i phyir dang / rgyu'i stobs kyi phyir te /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa nyes pa rnams kyi rten yin pa'i phyir dang / rgyu'i stobs kyi phyir te /
translated: because it is the basis of faults such as attachment and because of the power of the cause.

original: rgyu dang 'brel pa'i phyir yang sdug bsngal ba yin te /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'brel pa'i phyir yang sdug bsngal ba yin te /
translated: It is also suffering because it is related to a cause.

original: gzhan dbang thams cad sdug bsngal yin //
analyzed: gzhan dbang thams cad sdug bsngal yin //
translated: All that is dependent is suffering.

original: zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis so //
translated: This is the way.

original: yang gi sgras ni goms pa tsam la brten pa'i phyir ro zhes rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: yang gi sgras ni goms pa tsam la brten pa'i phyir ro zhes rtogs par bya'o //
translated: The word “also” should be understood as meaning “because it is based on mere habituation.”

original: bdag gi rang bzhin ma yin la bdag gis byin gyis brlabs pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag gi rang bzhin ma yin la bdag gis byin gyis brlabs pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not the nature of the self, nor is it empowered by the self,

original: rgyu ma yin pa ni byin gyis rlob par byed pa nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu ma yin pa ni byin gyis rlob par byed pa nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not tenable that that which is not a cause is an empowerer.

original: byin gyis rlob par byed pa ni gdon mi za bar phan 'dogs pa dang bcas par 'gyur dgos so //
analyzed: byin gyis rlob par byed pa ni gdon mi za bar phan 'dogs pa dang bcas par 'gyur dgos so //
translated: An empowerer must certainly be a benefactor.

original: phan 'dogs pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / gal te phung po rnams bdag gi rang bzhin yin na /
analyzed: phan 'dogs pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / gal te phung po rnams bdag gi rang bzhin yin na /
translated: If the aggregates were the nature of the self,

original: rtag pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtag pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: they would be permanent.

original: skyod par byed pa ma yin pa yang dngos po nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: skyod par byed pa ma yin pa yang dngos po nyid ma yin te /
translated: That which is not a mover is not a thing,

original: dmigs pa mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not able to be observed.

original: shes pa dus tha dad pa du ma ni /
analyzed: shes pa dus tha dad pa du ma ni /
translated: Many cognitions, which are different in time,

original: rtag pa nyid kyis gcig las skye ba ma yin no //
analyzed: rtag pa nyid kyis gcig las skye ba ma yin no //
translated: are not produced from one thing, because of permanence.

original: bdag gis byin gyis brlabs pa can du ni dmigs pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag gis byin gyis brlabs pa can du ni dmigs pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Nor is it observed to be empowered by the self.

original: phung po rnams kyi rang bzhin dmigs pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: phung po rnams kyi rang bzhin dmigs pa gang yin pa de ni /
translated: The nature of the aggregates is perceived.🔽

original: mi brtan pa nyid do //
analyzed: mi brtan pa nyid do //
translated: The nature of the aggregates is not perceived as stable.

original: gal te byin gyis ma brlabs pa'i rgyud dag ji ltar rang gi 'bras bu la 'jug ste /
analyzed: gal te byin gyis ma brlabs pa'i rgyud dag ji ltar rang gi 'bras bu la 'jug ste /
translated: If the mind is not empowered, how does it engage in its own effect?

original: de'i phyir byin gyis brlabs par rjes su dpag go zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir byin gyis brlabs par rjes su dpag go zhe na /
translated: Therefore, it is inferred that the mind is empowered.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: That is not so,

original: mi rtag pa'i sems pa byin gyis brlabs pa tsam gyis rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i sems pa byin gyis brlabs pa tsam gyis rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the mind is perfected by the mere empowerment of impermanent volition.

original: sems pa yang thog ma med pa can du bstan zin to //
analyzed: sems pa yang thog ma med pa can du bstan zin to //
translated: And it has already been shown that volition is beginningless.

original: des na / rgyu gzhan dag ni tshogs na yang //
analyzed: des na / rgyu gzhan dag ni tshogs na yang //
translated: Therefore, even when other causes are assembled,

original: 'bras bu skye ba med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: 'bras bu skye ba med pa'i phyir //
translated: the effect does not arise.

original: rgyu gzhan rjes su dpog 'gyur na //
analyzed: rgyu gzhan rjes su dpog 'gyur na //
translated: If other causes are inferred,

original: de ni rtag rnams la yod min //
analyzed: de ni rtag rnams la yod min //
translated: that does not exist for the eternalists.

original: gal te rgyu gzhan pa dus pa yin yang 'bras bu skyed par byed pa ma @124b yin na de'i tshe gang ma tshang bas 'bras bu skyed par mi 'gyur ba'i rgyu gzhan yang yod pa ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te rgyu gzhan pa dus pa yin yang 'bras bu skyed par byed pa ma @124b yin na de'i tshe gang ma tshang bas 'bras bu skyed par mi 'gyur ba'i rgyu gzhan yang yod pa ma yin na /
translated: If other causes are not the cause of the arising of the effect, then at that time, when other causes are assembled, the effect does not arise due to the incompleteness of other causes.

original: de ltar ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen rung ba'i khyad par tsam gyis 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen rung ba'i khyad par tsam gyis 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the immediately preceding condition is established by the mere special quality of being suitable.

original: gang gis de med pas rnam par rtog par 'gyur ba rtag pa dang khyab pa dag ni nam yang 'gar yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gis de med pas rnam par rtog par 'gyur ba rtag pa dang khyab pa dag ni nam yang 'gar yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But permanent and pervasive entities never exist anywhere, because they are not nonexistent.

original: rjes su 'gro ba tsam gyis skyed par byed pa yin na ni /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba tsam gyis skyed par byed pa yin na ni /
translated: If they were causes by mere association,

original: nam mkha' la sogs pa thams cad byin gyis rlob par byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nam mkha' la sogs pa thams cad byin gyis rlob par byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: then everything, such as space, would be a cause.

original: de dag yod pa yin yang rgyu rnams rang gi 'bras bu la 'jug pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de dag yod pa yin yang rgyu rnams rang gi 'bras bu la 'jug pa'i phyir te /
translated: Even though they exist, causes are engaged in their own effects,

original: de dag kyang rtag pa dang khyab pa nyid du mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag kyang rtag pa dang khyab pa nyid du mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are similar in being permanent and pervasive.

original: de dag ni byin gyis rlob par byed pa po nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de dag ni byin gyis rlob par byed pa po nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: They are not causes because they do not have the activity of blessing.

original: khyab pa dang rtag pa nyid kyi phyir de nyid mi 'grub pa'o //
analyzed: khyab pa dang rtag pa nyid kyi phyir de nyid mi 'grub pa'o //
translated: That is not established because they are permanent and pervasive.

original: rtag par khyab pa ma yin yang //
analyzed: rtag par khyab pa ma yin yang //
translated: Even though they are not permanent and pervasive,

original: thams cad du ni rgyu nyid 'gyur //
analyzed: thams cad du ni rgyu nyid 'gyur //
translated: they are causes of everything.

original: nye ba nyid kyi rgyu min te //
analyzed: nye ba nyid kyi rgyu min te //
translated: They are not causes of what is near.

original: ring ba yin yang rgyur mthong ngo //
analyzed: ring ba yin yang rgyur mthong ngo //
translated: Even though distant, it is seen as a cause.

original: sgra sogs yul ni thag ring yang //
analyzed: sgra sogs yul ni thag ring yang //
translated: Sound and other objects, even though distant,

original: rang 'bras sgrub par byed pa yin //
analyzed: rang 'bras sgrub par byed pa yin //
translated: are the producers of their own effects.

original: de'i phyir rjes 'gro tsam gyis ni //
analyzed: de'i phyir rjes 'gro tsam gyis ni //
translated: Therefore, by mere concomitance,

original: thams cad rgyu nyid yin par 'gyur //
analyzed: thams cad rgyu nyid yin par 'gyur //
translated: everything would be a cause.

original: res 'ga' ba nyid yin pas na //
analyzed: res 'ga' ba nyid yin pas na //
translated: Since it is sometimes the case,

original: sdug bsngal 'di rgyu bcas nyid 'grub //
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'di rgyu bcas nyid 'grub //
translated: this suffering is established as having a cause.

original: rgyu med gzhan la mi ltos phyir //
analyzed: rgyu med gzhan la mi ltos phyir //
translated: Because it does not depend on another that is causeless,

original: rtag tu yod pa'am med par 'gyur //
analyzed: rtag tu yod pa'am med par 'gyur //
translated: it would always exist or not exist.

original: kun 'byung ba'i bden pa la'ang rnam pa bzhi nyid do //
analyzed: kun 'byung ba'i bden pa la'ang rnam pa bzhi nyid do //
translated: The truth of origination also has four aspects.

original: rgyu nyid dang kun 'byung ba dang / rab tu skye ba nyid dang rkyen nyid do //
analyzed: rgyu nyid dang kun 'byung ba dang / rab tu skye ba nyid dang rkyen nyid do //
translated: They are: cause, origination, strong production, and condition.

original: de la rgyu ni rgyu ma yin pa spangs pas so //
analyzed: de la rgyu ni rgyu ma yin pa spangs pas so //
translated: Among them, cause is the cause that is distinguished from the non-cause.

original: kun 'byung ba ni rgyu gcig nyid spangs pas so //
analyzed: kun 'byung ba ni rgyu gcig nyid spangs pas so //
translated: Origination is the single cause that is distinguished from the non-cause.

original: rab tu skye ba ni mi nus pa spangs pas te /
analyzed: rab tu skye ba ni mi nus pa spangs pas te /
translated: Strong production is distinguished from the non-powerful.

original: 'di las rab tu 'byung bas na rab tu skye ba'o //
analyzed: 'di las rab tu 'byung bas na rab tu skye ba'o //
translated: Because it strongly arises from this, it is strong production.

original: rkyen ni gtso bo spangs pas so //
analyzed: rkyen ni gtso bo spangs pas so //
translated: Condition is distinguished from the non-chief.

original: de la / sdug bsngal gyi ni rgyu yod ces //
analyzed: de la / sdug bsngal gyi ni rgyu yod ces //
translated: The cause of suffering is taught

original: dang por nyid du bstan pa nyid //
analyzed: dang por nyid du bstan pa nyid //
translated: First of all, it is taught that

original: gzhan ni res 'ga' ba min te //
analyzed: gzhan ni res 'ga' ba min te //
translated: The other is not occasional,

original: rgyu ldan la ni mthong ba yin //
analyzed: rgyu ldan la ni mthong ba yin //
translated: For it is seen in the presence of a cause.

original: rgyu med pa yi dngos po ni //
analyzed: rgyu med pa yi dngos po ni //
translated: A thing without a cause

original: yod pa'am gang na gzhan nyid 'gyur //
analyzed: yod pa'am gang na gzhan nyid 'gyur //
translated: Either exists or does not exist.

original: ci lta ci ltar rgyu med la //
analyzed: ci lta ci ltar rgyu med la //
translated: The more a thing is without a cause,

original: de ltar rtag par 'gyur ba yin //
analyzed: de ltar rtag par 'gyur ba yin //
translated: The more it will be permanent.

original: rab rib can shes skra la sogs //
analyzed: rab rib can shes skra la sogs //
translated: The consciousness of one with cataracts

original: yul med par yang skye ba'i phyir //🔽rang rig pas ni rtogs bya ba //
analyzed: yul med par yang skye ba'i phyir // rang rig pas ni rtogs bya ba //
translated: Arises without an object.🔽The sphere of reality, which is to be realized

original: chos kyi dbyings ni rgyu med can //🔽res 'ga' ba min mtshan nyid can //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings ni rgyu med can // res 'ga' ba min mtshan nyid can //
translated: By reflexive awareness,🔽Is not occasional, and it is characterized

original: rtag pa nyid du dmigs pa yin //
analyzed: rtag pa nyid du dmigs pa yin //
translated: By being perceived as permanent.

original: mo gsham bu @125a * //
analyzed: mo gsham bu @125a * //
translated: The son of a barren woman and so on

original: sogs rgyu yin //
analyzed: sogs rgyu yin //
translated: Are not causes.

original: bdag nyid med phyir rtag tu med //
analyzed: bdag nyid med phyir rtag tu med //
translated: Because they do not exist, they are always nonexistent.

original: 'dir brtsad pa /🔽ji ltar tsher ma la sogs kyi //
analyzed: 'dir brtsad pa / ji ltar tsher ma la sogs kyi //
translated: Here, someone objects:🔽Just as the sharpness of thorns and so on

original: rno ba'i rgyu sogs rgyu med pa //
analyzed: rno ba'i rgyu sogs rgyu med pa //
translated: Do not have a cause,

original: de ltar 'di dag rgyu med 'gyur //
analyzed: de ltar 'di dag rgyu med 'gyur //
translated: In the same way, these things would be without a cause.

original: zhes ni kha cig rab tu brjod //
analyzed: zhes ni kha cig rab tu brjod //
translated: This is what some have said.

original: rgyu med par smra ba dag go //
analyzed: rgyu med par smra ba dag go //
translated: The theory of causeless origination.

original: rang bzhin nyid kyis 'byung ba chen po'i ngo bo nyid ni byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rang bzhin nyid kyis 'byung ba chen po'i ngo bo nyid ni byed pa ma yin te /
translated: The nature of the great elements is not a cause, because it is not a cause of the specific differences.

original: yul dang dus dang gnas skabs kyi khyad par dang ldan pa nyid kyis na khyad par nyid byed pa yin no //
analyzed: yul dang dus dang gnas skabs kyi khyad par dang ldan pa nyid kyis na khyad par nyid byed pa yin no //
translated: The specific differences are the cause, because they are endowed with the specific differences of place, time, and condition.

original: de la khyad par dag kyang rgyu med can du dmigs so //
analyzed: de la khyad par dag kyang rgyu med can du dmigs so //
translated: And the specific differences are also observed to be without a cause.

original: 'phang mdung dang / khab dang / mdung dang / thur ma la sogs pa rnams kyi lcags la sogs pa'i rang bzhin nyid ni /
analyzed: 'phang mdung dang / khab dang / mdung dang / thur ma la sogs pa rnams kyi lcags la sogs pa'i rang bzhin nyid ni /
translated: The nature of iron, etc., of a spear, arrow, needle, awl, etc.,

original: mgar ba la sogs pas byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mgar ba la sogs pas byed pa ma yin te /
translated: is not made by a blacksmith, etc.,

original: rno ba nyid byed pa'i yul yin no //
analyzed: rno ba nyid byed pa'i yul yin no //
translated: because sharpness is the object of the cause.

original: lcags la sogs pa la yang sa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin nyid ni /
analyzed: lcags la sogs pa la yang sa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin nyid ni /
translated: And the nature of earth, etc., of iron, etc.,

original: gzhan gyis byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyis byed pa ma yin te /
translated: is not made by another,

original: lcags la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lcags la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it makes the nature of iron, etc.

original: mgar ba la sogs pa med kyang /
analyzed: mgar ba la sogs pa med kyang /
translated: Even without a blacksmith, etc.,

original: tsher ma la sogs pa la rno ba mthong bas /
analyzed: tsher ma la sogs pa la rno ba mthong bas /
translated: the sharpness of a thorn, etc., is seen.

original: de med kyang yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med kyang yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, even without that, it exists.

original: rgyu nges pa med pa can 'di nyid rgyu med pa can yin no //
analyzed: rgyu nges pa med pa can 'di nyid rgyu med pa can yin no //
translated: This very cause, which is not determined, is causeless.

original: de bzhin du 'gro ba sna tshogs su byed pa'i khyad par gzhan yang rgyu med pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'gro ba sna tshogs su byed pa'i khyad par gzhan yang rgyu med pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: In the same way, the difference that produces the variety of the world would be causeless.

original: 'di la 'gal ba ci yod ce na //
analyzed: 'di la 'gal ba ci yod ce na //
translated: What is the contradiction in that?
