original: de yang ma yin te /🔽gang yod nyid na'ang gang skye ba'am //
analyzed: de yang ma yin te / gang yod nyid na'ang gang skye ba'am //
translated: That is not so.🔽When something exists, what is produced?

original: gang 'gyur na yang rnam 'gyur ba //
analyzed: gang 'gyur na yang rnam 'gyur ba //
translated: What is transformed?

original: de ni der rgyur rab tu brjod //
analyzed: de ni der rgyur rab tu brjod //
translated: That is declared to be the cause of that.

original: de ni de rnams la yang yod //
analyzed: de ni de rnams la yang yod //
translated: That exists in those.

original: 'di la bsam pa ni /
analyzed: 'di la bsam pa ni /
translated: The idea is this:

original: gal te khyad par nyid bskyed par bya ba yin na /
analyzed: gal te khyad par nyid bskyed par bya ba yin na /
translated: If the difference itself is what is to be produced,

original: de dag ni rgyu med pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni rgyu med pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: then those are not causeless.

original: rgya shug gi tsher ma'i rno ba dang 'khyog pa ni rgya shug gi sa bon med par yod pa ma yin no / de'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir de'i 'bras bu yin yang rgyu med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rgya shug gi tsher ma'i rno ba dang 'khyog pa ni rgya shug gi sa bon med par yod pa ma yin no / de'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir de'i 'bras bu yin yang rgyu med pa ma yin no //
translated: The sharpness and curvature of a myrobalan fruit thorn do not exist without the myrobalan seed. It is not causeless because it follows the presence and absence of that and conforms to it.

original: 'on kyang mgar bas kyang byed pa des na 'khrul pas de skad brjod do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on kyang mgar bas kyang byed pa des na 'khrul pas de skad brjod do zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the potter also makes it, then we say that it is produced by error.

original: de yang ji lta ba bzhin ma yin te /🔽blo sngon byed pa dmigs pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de yang ji lta ba bzhin ma yin te / blo sngon byed pa dmigs pa'i phyir //
translated: That is not so,🔽Because the mind is observed to precede.

original: blo ldan rgyu yin de lta na //
analyzed: blo ldan rgyu yin de lta na //
translated: The wise say that the mind is the cause.

original: dbang phyug byed pa po de'i phyir //
analyzed: dbang phyug byed pa po de'i phyir //
translated: Therefore, Ishvara is not the agent.

original: rgya shug gi ni tsher ma la sogs pa dpe de nyid la ni rgyu med par ni 'gyur ba ma yin /
analyzed: rgya shug gi ni tsher ma la sogs pa dpe de nyid la ni rgyu med par ni 'gyur ba ma yin /
translated: In that very example, the thorns of the jujube tree, etc., are not causeless.

original: khyad par rtog phyir min zhe na //
analyzed: khyad par rtog phyir min zhe na //
translated: If you say that it is not so because of the difference,

original: khyad par yod mod rgyu bcas nyid //
analyzed: khyad par yod mod rgyu bcas nyid //
translated: There is a difference, but it has a cause.

original: 'ga' zhig @125b rgya shug sa bon las //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig @125b rgya shug sa bon las //
translated: Some are from the seed of the jujube,

original: gzhan ni mgar ba la sogs las //
analyzed: gzhan ni mgar ba la sogs las //
translated: Others from the potter, etc.

original: gal te khyad par mtshon med na //
analyzed: gal te khyad par mtshon med na //
translated: If there is no difference in the example,

original: khyad par med pa kho nar zad //
analyzed: khyad par med pa kho nar zad //
translated: There is no difference at all.

original: gang phyir mthong ba tsam gyis ni //
analyzed: gang phyir mthong ba tsam gyis ni //
translated: Because the difference is not ascertained merely by seeing,

original: khyad par yongs su 'dzin ma yin //
analyzed: khyad par yongs su 'dzin ma yin //
translated: The difference is not ascertained.

original: gnyis med de nyid rgyu yin te //
analyzed: gnyis med de nyid rgyu yin te //
translated: Non-duality is the cause of reality,

original: de nyid rgyu med yin par 'gyur //
analyzed: de nyid rgyu med yin par 'gyur //
translated: But that itself becomes causeless.

original: de phyir gang las khyad par yod //
analyzed: de phyir gang las khyad par yod //
translated: Therefore, from what is there a difference?

original: de nyid las ni rgyu bcas yin //
analyzed: de nyid las ni rgyu bcas yin //
translated: But it is not established that it has a cause.

original: 'di ltar rgyu dang bral ba yi //
analyzed: 'di ltar rgyu dang bral ba yi //
translated: For, without a cause,

original: khyad par nyid ni rab grub med //
analyzed: khyad par nyid ni rab grub med //
translated: a difference is not established.

original: de phyir gal te tha dad pa'am gal te phyi'i don nyid yin na rnam pa thams cad du rgyu dang bcas pa yin la /
analyzed: de phyir gal te tha dad pa'am gal te phyi'i don nyid yin na rnam pa thams cad du rgyu dang bcas pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, if it is different or if it is external, it must have a cause in every way.

original: de lta ma yin na ni bzlog pa nyid do //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ni bzlog pa nyid do //
translated: If it is not so, it is the opposite.

original: gal te gang yod pa nyid na gang skye ba de rgyu yin na /
analyzed: gal te gang yod pa nyid na gang skye ba de rgyu yin na /
translated: If that which exists and that which arises are the cause,

original: reg pa yang mthong ba'i rgyu yin par thal te reg pa med par med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: reg pa yang mthong ba'i rgyu yin par thal te reg pa med par med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: it follows that contact is the cause of seeing, because it does not exist without contact.

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: tshogs pa gcig la rag las phyir //
analyzed: tshogs pa gcig la rag las phyir //
translated: Because it depends on the same collection,

original: gzugs dang reg bya phan tshun du //🔽rnam par dbye ba med des na //
analyzed: gzugs dang reg bya phan tshun du // rnam par dbye ba med des na //
translated: form and the tangible are not mutually exclusive.

original: reg pa med par mthong ba min //
analyzed: reg pa med par mthong ba min //
translated: Therefore, without contact, there is no seeing.

original: der ni reg pa med par gzugs nyid mi 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: der ni reg pa med par gzugs nyid mi 'byung ba yin no //
translated: In that case, without contact, form itself does not occur.

original: gal te rgyu mtshan yin //
analyzed: gal te rgyu mtshan yin //
translated: If it is a reason,

original: phan tshun mi 'bral ba nyid kyis //
analyzed: phan tshun mi 'bral ba nyid kyis //
translated: because they are not mutually exclusive,

original: dus mtshungs 'di lta bu'i ldog pa las ni rgyur 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: dus mtshungs 'di lta bu'i ldog pa las ni rgyur 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: But it is not the case that the reverse is the case, i.e., that contact is the cause of seeing.

original: 'on kyang gal te gzugs nye bar bstan nas reg pa med na mthong ba med par bstan pa yin na 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang gal te gzugs nye bar bstan nas reg pa med na mthong ba med par bstan pa yin na 'gyur ro //
translated: However, if it is shown that there is no seeing when there is no contact, even though form is present, then contact is the cause of seeing.🔽Or,

original: yang na / reg pa gzugs rgyu nyid yin phyir //
analyzed: yang na / reg pa gzugs rgyu nyid yin phyir //
translated: because contact is the cause of form,

original: mthong ba la ni rgyu mtshan yin //
analyzed: mthong ba la ni rgyu mtshan yin //
translated: it is the reason for seeing.

original: phan tshun mi 'bral ba nyid kyis //
analyzed: phan tshun mi 'bral ba nyid kyis //
translated: Because they are not separate from each other,

original: dus mtshungs pa dag kyang /🔽rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: dus mtshungs pa dag kyang / rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ram /
translated: the four primary elements are simultaneous.🔽They are the cause of form,

original: gzugs kyi rten pa'i rang bzhin gyi rgyu 'byung ba'i rang bzhin gyis reg pa nyid de /🔽des na brgyud nas reg pa mthong ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir gtan tshigs mi mthun pa'i phyogs la 'jug pa ma yin pas 'khrul pa med pa nyid do //
analyzed: gzugs kyi rten pa'i rang bzhin gyi rgyu 'byung ba'i rang bzhin gyis reg pa nyid de / des na brgyud nas reg pa mthong ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir gtan tshigs mi mthun pa'i phyogs la 'jug pa ma yin pas 'khrul pa med pa nyid do //
translated: because they are the cause of the primary elements that are the basis of form.🔽Therefore, because contact is the cause of seeing, indirectly, it is the cause of seeing. Thus, the reason is not inconclusive, i.e., it is not the case that it is present when the property to be proven is absent.

original: de ltar na re zhig rgyu ma yin pa nyid bkag pa'i phyir rgyu nyid ces bya ba'i rnam pa gcig rnam par gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig rgyu ma yin pa nyid bkag pa'i phyir rgyu nyid ces bya ba'i rnam pa gcig rnam par gnas pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the one type of cause that has been refuted is the noncause.

original: kun 'byung ba nyid ces bya ba'i rnam pa gnyis bshad pa ni /
analyzed: kun 'byung ba nyid ces bya ba'i rnam pa gnyis bshad pa ni /
translated: The two aspects of origination are explained.

original: rtag rnams bkag phyir dbang phyug la //
analyzed: rtag rnams bkag phyir dbang phyug la //
translated: Since the eternal is refuted,

original: sogs pa dag kyang srid min te //
analyzed: sogs pa dag kyang srid min te //
translated: the creator, etc. are not possible.

original: de'i phyir sdug bsngal rgyu dang bcas pa yin yang /
analyzed: de'i phyir sdug bsngal rgyu dang bcas pa yin yang /
translated: Therefore, although suffering has a cause,

original: de las rtag pa gcig pu'i rgyu bkag pas kun 'byung gi rnam pa nyid du gnod mi za ba yin no //
analyzed: de las rtag pa gcig pu'i rgyu bkag pas kun 'byung gi rnam pa nyid du gnod mi za ba yin no //
translated: since the cause of just the eternal one is refuted, it is not contradicted as the aspect of origination.

original: gal te rgyu gcig yin na rtag pa @126a * //🔽nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te rgyu gcig yin na rtag pa @126a * // nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: If there is one cause, it would be eternal.

original: rtag pa ni ltos pa med pas khyad par du byar med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa ni ltos pa med pas khyad par du byar med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the eternal is independent, it cannot be distinguished.

original: gtso bo la sogs pa rtag pa de rnams kyang sngar bkag zin to //
analyzed: gtso bo la sogs pa rtag pa de rnams kyang sngar bkag zin to //
translated: Those eternal principles, etc. have already been refuted earlier.

original: de ga las she na /
analyzed: de ga las she na /
translated: How is that?

original: nus pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nus pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are not capable.

original: rim dang cig car dag gi don byed nus pa dang bral ba'i phyir rnam pa gsum pa rab tu skye ba nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: rim dang cig car dag gi don byed nus pa dang bral ba'i phyir rnam pa gsum pa rab tu skye ba nyid ma yin no //
translated: Because they are devoid of the ability to perform an action successively or simultaneously, the third kind does not arise at all.

original: rnam pa 'di ni srid pa nyid kyis yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa 'di ni srid pa nyid kyis yin no //
translated: This is possible only through existence.

original: de nyid brjod pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid brjod pa ni /
translated: That is stated:

original: nus med phyir ro de yi phyir //
analyzed: nus med phyir ro de yi phyir //
translated: because it is powerless.

original: srid 'dod rgyu yin gang gi phyir //🔽mi rnams yul gyi khyad par ni //
analyzed: srid 'dod rgyu yin gang gi phyir // mi rnams yul gyi khyad par ni //
translated: Therefore, craving is the cause of existence,🔽because people are motivated by the desire to obtain

original: yongs 'dzin de thob bsam pas byas //
analyzed: yongs 'dzin de thob bsam pas byas //
translated: the particular object of their craving.

original: rgyu gzhan nam las ni rab tu skye ba gzhan nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu gzhan nam las ni rab tu skye ba gzhan nyid ma yin no //
translated: The cause of craving is not a different cause, nor is it karma.

original: las sam lus sam ma rig pa'am rab tu skye ba ma yin te /
analyzed: las sam lus sam ma rig pa'am rab tu skye ba ma yin te /
translated: Craving is not karma, nor is it the body, nor is it ignorance, nor is it birth.

original: nus pa'i rgyu zhes bya ba'i ming gzhan dang ldan pa'i sred pa med na skye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nus pa'i rgyu zhes bya ba'i ming gzhan dang ldan pa'i sred pa med na skye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because without craving, which has another name, “the cause of power,” there is no birth.

original: sred pa ni rab tu skye ba nyid du mthong ba yin te /
analyzed: sred pa ni rab tu skye ba nyid du mthong ba yin te /
translated: Craving is seen to be the cause of birth.

original: 'di ltar yongs su 'dzin pa dang kun tu 'dzin pa'i ming gi rnam grangs pa can ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar yongs su 'dzin pa dang kun tu 'dzin pa'i ming gi rnam grangs pa can ni /
translated: Because the synonyms for “grasping” and “clinging”

original: de thob pa'i sred pas byas pa yin la /
analyzed: de thob pa'i sred pas byas pa yin la /
translated: are “the craving to obtain that,”

original: yongs su 'dzin pa de yang skye ba rjes su 'brel pa yin no //
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin pa de yang skye ba rjes su 'brel pa yin no //
translated: and that grasping is connected with birth.

original: des na 'di'i rab tu skye ba ni srid pa yin no //
analyzed: des na 'di'i rab tu skye ba ni srid pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, its birth is existence.

original: srid 'dod ni ma 'ongs pa'i skye ba'i don du gnyer ba'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: srid 'dod ni ma 'ongs pa'i skye ba'i don du gnyer ba'i rnam pa'o //
translated: The desire for existence is the form of craving that seeks future birth.

original: gal te yul gyi khyad par don du gnyer ba la sogs pa ni kun 'byung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te yul gyi khyad par don du gnyer ba la sogs pa ni kun 'byung ba ma yin te /
translated: Those who seek the attributes of objects and so on are not origin

original: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis /
analyzed: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis /
translated: because the Bhagavān said:

original: de la kun 'byung 'phags pa'i bden pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la kun 'byung 'phags pa'i bden pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the noble ones’ truth of origin?

original: gang 'di srid pa kun 'byung ba can dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang ldan pa de dang der mngon par dga' ba can de /
analyzed: gang 'di srid pa kun 'byung ba can dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang ldan pa de dang der mngon par dga' ba can de /
translated: It is the origin of existence, which is associated with the pleasureseeking desire that delights in this and that.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: 'dod pa'i sred pa dang / srid pa'i sred pa dang 'jig pa'i sred pa zhes gsungs pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i sred pa dang / srid pa'i sred pa dang 'jig pa'i sred pa zhes gsungs pa yin no zhe na /
translated: The craving for desire realm objects, the craving for existence, and the craving for the destruction of existence.

original: 'di ni 'gal ba med de /
analyzed: 'di ni 'gal ba med de /
translated: This is not contradictory because:

original: de ni srid 'dod gang phyir yang //
analyzed: de ni srid 'dod gang phyir yang //
translated: Since it is the desire for existence,🔽those who desire to obtain happiness and to discard suffering

original: srog chags bde sdug thob pa dang // 'dor 'dod 'jug pa de dag ni //
analyzed: srog chags bde sdug thob pa dang // 'dor 'dod 'jug pa de dag ni //
translated: and to enter existence are

original: 'dod dang 'jig sred yin par 'dod //🔽gang 'di gnas dang longs spyod la sogs pa la sred pa de ni srid pa'i 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod dang 'jig sred yin par 'dod // gang 'di gnas dang longs spyod la sogs pa la sred pa de ni srid pa'i 'dod pa ste /
translated: said to have the craving for desire and the craving for existence.🔽The craving for abodes, enjoyments, and so on is the desire for existence.

original: 'khor pa'i srid pa dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang ldan pa /
analyzed: 'khor pa'i srid pa dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang ldan pa /
translated: It is the desire that delights in the existence of samsara.

original: de dang der mngon par dga' ba can no //
analyzed: de dang der mngon par dga' ba can no //
translated: and is attached to this and that.

original: de thams cad nyid ni 'dod pa'i sred pa dang srid pa'i sred pa dang / 'jig pa'i sred pa yin no //
analyzed: de thams cad nyid ni 'dod pa'i sred pa dang srid pa'i sred pa dang / 'jig pa'i sred pa yin no //
translated: All of these are the craving for desire, the craving for existence, and the craving for non-existence.

original: gang zhig gnas la sogs pa la sred pa de ni srid @126b pa'i sred pa ste /
analyzed: gang zhig gnas la sogs pa la sred pa de ni srid @126b pa'i sred pa ste /
translated: The craving for the various abodes, etc. is the craving for existence.

original: srid pa'i 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: srid pa'i 'dod pa'o //
translated: It is the desire for existence.

original: bde ba'i don du gnyer ba'i rnam pa gang yin pa de ni 'dod pa'i sred pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba'i don du gnyer ba'i rnam pa gang yin pa de ni 'dod pa'i sred pa'o //
translated: The aspect of seeking pleasure is the craving for desire.

original: sdug bsngal dang bral bar 'dod pa de ni 'jig pa'i sred pa yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang bral bar 'dod pa de ni 'jig pa'i sred pa yin no //
translated: The desire to be separated from suffering is the craving for non-existence.

original: des na 'gal ba med pa nyid do //
analyzed: des na 'gal ba med pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, there is no contradiction.

original: kun 'byung gi bden ba bstan pa lung dang 'gal ba 'ga' med do //
analyzed: kun 'byung gi bden ba bstan pa lung dang 'gal ba 'ga' med do //
translated: There is no contradiction with the scriptures in the teaching of the truth of origination.

original: bdag tu chags pa'i rgyu nyid las //
analyzed: bdag tu chags pa'i rgyu nyid las //
translated: From the cause of attachment to self

original: bde min bde bar 'du shes pa //
analyzed: bde min bde bar 'du shes pa //
translated: One perceives what is not pleasure as pleasure.

original: kun la rab tu 'jug 'gyur ba //
analyzed: kun la rab tu 'jug 'gyur ba //
translated: It occurs in all cases.

original: de phyir sred pa srid rten yin //
analyzed: de phyir sred pa srid rten yin //
translated: Therefore, craving is the support of existence.

original: ngar 'dzin pa yi gzhi yin phyir //
analyzed: ngar 'dzin pa yi gzhi yin phyir //
translated: Because it is the basis of the conception of “I,”

original: gcig tu sgro btags pa'i sems ni bdag go //
analyzed: gcig tu sgro btags pa'i sems ni bdag go //
translated: The mind that is imputed as one is the self.

original: de la chags pa de ni thams cad la rab tu 'jug pa'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: de la chags pa de ni thams cad la rab tu 'jug pa'i rgyu yin te /
translated: Attachment is the cause of engaging in all of them.🔽Because of the four errors, the ignorant engage in the abode,

original: gnas dang longs spyod la sogs pa //
analyzed: gnas dang longs spyod la sogs pa //
translated: enjoyments, etc.

original: don dam par bde ba dang bral ba na /
analyzed: don dam par bde ba dang bral ba na /
translated: which are ultimately devoid of happiness,

original: bde ba ma yin pa la /🔽phyin ci log bzhis nyams pa dag 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bde ba ma yin pa la / phyin ci log bzhis nyams pa dag 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and which are not happiness.

original: de'i phyir srid pa'i rten yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir srid pa'i rten yin no //
translated: Therefore, attachment is the cause of cyclic existence.

original: snying rje ldan pa ma gtogs pa //🔽sred pa med pa gang du yang //
analyzed: snying rje ldan pa ma gtogs pa // sred pa med pa gang du yang //
translated: But the compassionate one,🔽who is without attachment,

original: 'jug dang rjes 'brang can ma yin //
analyzed: 'jug dang rjes 'brang can ma yin //
translated: does not engage in or pursue anything,

original: de ni 'khor ba'i rgyu ma yin //🔽de nyid kyi phyir sred pa ni 'jug pa lhan cig byed pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ni 'khor ba'i rgyu ma yin // de nyid kyi phyir sred pa ni 'jug pa lhan cig byed pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: and therefore is not a cause of cyclic existence.

original: rkyen tsam yin gyi /
analyzed: rkyen tsam yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, attachment is merely a condition for engaging in cyclic existence,

original: nye bar len pa nyid ni ma yin te /
analyzed: nye bar len pa nyid ni ma yin te /
translated: but it is not the appropriator.

original: de la nye bar len pa ni sems yin no //
analyzed: de la nye bar len pa ni sems yin no //
translated: The mind is the appropriator.

original: de'i rkyen ni res 'ga' srid pa yin la res 'ga' ni snying rje yin no //
analyzed: de'i rkyen ni res 'ga' srid pa yin la res 'ga' ni snying rje yin no //
translated: Sometimes its condition is attachment, and sometimes it is compassion.

original: 'dis rkyen nyid ces bya ba'i rnam pa bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis rkyen nyid ces bya ba'i rnam pa bshad pa yin no //
translated: This explains the term “merely a condition.”

original: gal te rkyen nyid kyang /
analyzed: gal te rkyen nyid kyang /
translated: If it is merely a condition,

original: sred pa ni rkyen ma yin te /
analyzed: sred pa ni rkyen ma yin te /
translated: Craving is not a condition for the body,

original: 'on kyang lus yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang lus yin no //
translated: but the body is a condition for craving.

original: des na lus dang 'brel pa ni 'dod chags dang bral ba ma yin no //
analyzed: des na lus dang 'brel pa ni 'dod chags dang bral ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, one who is related to the body is not free from attachment.

original: 'di nyid ston pa ni /
analyzed: 'di nyid ston pa ni /
translated: The masters have stated this very point:🔽“One who is free from attachment is not seen to be born,

original: chags bral skye ba ma mthong phyir //
analyzed: chags bral skye ba ma mthong phyir //
translated: because one who is free from attachment is not seen to be born.

original: zhes ni slob dpon rnams kyis gsungs //
analyzed: zhes ni slob dpon rnams kyis gsungs //
translated: So have the masters taught.🔽🔽

original: lus med chags pa ma mthong phyir //
analyzed: lus med chags pa ma mthong phyir //
translated: “Attachment is not seen to exist without a body,

original: lus las kyang ni 'dod chags 'gyur //
analyzed: lus las kyang ni 'dod chags 'gyur //
translated: therefore attachment arises from the body.🔽”

original: ji ltar 'dod chags dang bral ba skye ba ma mthong ba'i phyir /🔽'dod chags skye ba rgyu yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod chags dang bral ba skye ba ma mthong ba'i phyir / 'dod chags skye ba rgyu yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as one who is free from attachment is not seen to be born,🔽therefore attachment arises from the body.

original: rigs pa 'di nyid las lus 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rigs pa 'di nyid las lus 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, by this very reasoning, the body is the cause of attachment, etc.

original: lus med par chags pa ma mthong ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: lus med par chags pa ma mthong ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: “Attachment is not seen to exist without a body.🔽”

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: 'dod chags med kyang snying rje'i dbang gis skye bar 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags med kyang snying rje'i dbang gis skye bar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Even without attachment, one is born through the power of compassion.

original: de'i mngon par dga' ba'i yul nyid ni sred pas byas pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i mngon par dga' ba'i yul nyid ni sred pas byas pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The object of his delight is made by craving.

original: khyad par tsam gyi rgyu yin pas na /
analyzed: khyad par tsam gyi rgyu yin pas na /
translated: It is the cause of mere distinction.🔽

original: sred pa ni rkyen tsam @127a * //
analyzed: sred pa ni rkyen tsam @127a * //
translated: Therefore, craving is merely a condition.

original: yin no // de bzhin du gal te lus kyang 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rkyen tsam yin la /
analyzed: yin no // de bzhin du gal te lus kyang 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rkyen tsam yin la /
translated: Similarly, if the body is merely a condition for attachment, etc.,

original: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa nyid nye bar len pa'i rgyu yin na ni /
analyzed: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa nyid nye bar len pa'i rgyu yin na ni /
translated: and improper mental attention is the substantial cause of appropriation,

original: de'i tshe 'dod pa nyid sgrub pa yin no zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: de'i tshe 'dod pa nyid sgrub pa yin no zhes ston pa ni /
translated: then at that time, the assertion that craving is the establishment of appropriation is demonstrated.

original: rgyu mtshan khas blangs phyir na 'dod//
analyzed: rgyu mtshan khas blangs phyir na 'dod//
translated: Craving is asserted because the reason is accepted.

original: nyer len nyid ni gsal ba yin //
analyzed: nyer len nyid ni gsal ba yin //
translated: The substantial cause is clearly stated.

original: rigs 'di rjes su 'dod na ni //
analyzed: rigs 'di rjes su 'dod na ni //
translated: If this principle is accepted,

original: rang nyid rang 'dod la gnod 'gyur //
analyzed: rang nyid rang 'dod la gnod 'gyur //
translated: then one’s own assertion is undermined.

original: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa'i rjes su 'brel pa'i lus kyang 'dod chags kyi rgyur 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa'i rjes su 'brel pa'i lus kyang 'dod chags kyi rgyur 'dod pa yin no //
translated: The body, which is related to improper mental attention, is asserted to be the cause of attachment.

original: de ni yul bzhin du res 'ga' bag chags sad pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: de ni yul bzhin du res 'ga' bag chags sad pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: It is the cause of the activation of the latent impressions, like an object.

original: rigs pa 'dis ni lus kyang 'dod chags kyi rgyu can nyid du sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: rigs pa 'dis ni lus kyang 'dod chags kyi rgyu can nyid du sgrub par byed do //
translated: This reasoning proves that the body also has attachment as its cause.

original: des na phan tshun rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: des na phan tshun rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because they are mutually causal,

original: de lta bu tshogs pa thog ma med pa las skye ba rab tu 'byung bas /
analyzed: de lta bu tshogs pa thog ma med pa las skye ba rab tu 'byung bas /
translated: Thus, since arising occurs from a beginningless collection of such causes and conditions,

original: skye ba gzhan rab tu grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: skye ba gzhan rab tu grub pa'i phyir /
translated: the arising of another is well established.

original: tshu rol mdzes pa pas dpyad pa mes tshig pa yin no //
analyzed: tshu rol mdzes pa pas dpyad pa mes tshig pa yin no //
translated: The Lokayatas are burned by their own words.

original: gal te yon tan dang bcas pa rdzas nyid skye ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te yon tan dang bcas pa rdzas nyid skye ba ma yin nam /
translated: But isn’t it the case that a substance endowed with qualities arises?

original: des na 'di gnyis ni phan tshun rgyu ma yin no //🔽gal te skye ba chags mthong phyir //
analyzed: des na 'di gnyis ni phan tshun rgyu ma yin no // gal te skye ba chags mthong phyir //
translated: Therefore, these two are not reciprocal causes.🔽If you say that attachment arises simultaneously with arising,

original: skye dang lhan cig 'byung zhe na //
analyzed: skye dang lhan cig 'byung zhe na //
translated: because attachment is seen when the body arises,🔽then it exists prior to the arising of homogeneous

original: skal mnyam skye las sngar grub yin //
analyzed: skal mnyam skye las sngar grub yin //
translated: causes.

original: srid la mi shes rgyu yin yang //
analyzed: srid la mi shes rgyu yin yang //
translated: Although ignorance is the cause of cyclic existence,

original: ma brjod sred pa 'dir bshad pa //
analyzed: ma brjod sred pa 'dir bshad pa //
translated: craving is explained here because it is the cause of projecting a new🔽existence.

original: rgyun ni 'phen byed pa yi phyir //
analyzed: rgyun ni 'phen byed pa yi phyir //
translated: Since the continuum is projected,

original: gal te 'dod chags la sogs pa skye ba dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa lus kyi rgyu ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te 'dod chags la sogs pa skye ba dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa lus kyi rgyu ma yin na /
translated: If attachment and so on are not the cause of the body because they arise simultaneously with the arising of the body,

original: de'i tshe lus kyang 'dod chags la sogs pa'i ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe lus kyang 'dod chags la sogs pa'i ma yin no //
translated: then the body is not the cause of attachment and so on.

original: rgyu med pa nyid kyang ma yin pa de'i phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa rigs mthun pa'i rgyus bskyed pa'i phyir mngon par 'dod pa 'grub bo //
analyzed: rgyu med pa nyid kyang ma yin pa de'i phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa rigs mthun pa'i rgyus bskyed pa'i phyir mngon par 'dod pa 'grub bo //
translated: and not without a cause. Therefore, the thesis of the opponent is established, since desire, etc. are generated by a cause of the same kind.

original: gal te srid pa gcig pu ni rgyu ma yin pa yin nam /
analyzed: gal te srid pa gcig pu ni rgyu ma yin pa yin nam /
translated: Is only existence a cause?

original: ma rig pa dang sred pa dang las gsum rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma rig pa dang sred pa dang las gsum rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: No, because ignorance, craving, and karma are causes.

original: de dang der mngon par dga' ba can gyi sred pa nyid kun 'byung ba'i bden par bstan pa ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: de dang der mngon par dga' ba can gyi sred pa nyid kun 'byung ba'i bden par bstan pa ci ltar zhe na /
translated: Why is craving, which delights in this and that, taught as the truth of origination?

original: de ni med de rgyu nyid yin yang de ma thag pa'i rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni med de rgyu nyid yin yang de ma thag pa'i rgyu ma yin no //
translated: That is not so, because although it is a cause, it is not an immediate cause.

original: sred pa nyid bar du ma chod pas rgyu yin te /
analyzed: sred pa nyid bar du ma chod pas rgyu yin te /
translated: Craving is a cause because it is not interrupted.

original: 'khor bar rgyur skul bar byed pa yang yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khor bar rgyur skul bar byed pa yang yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is also the instigator of the cause of cyclic existence.

original: gti mug dang las dag ni yod kyang srid pa med pa 'gar yang 'jug par byed pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gti mug dang las dag ni yod kyang srid pa med pa 'gar yang 'jug par byed pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Although delusion and karma exist, they do not instigate entry into any existence whatsoever.

original: phyin ci log yod kyang /
analyzed: phyin ci log yod kyang /
translated: Even though error exists,

original: sred pa @127b med na dung la 'jug pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sred pa @127b med na dung la 'jug pa ma yin te /
translated: without craving, one does not enter cyclic existence.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bshad pa /
translated: For this very reason, it is said:

original: de ma thag pa nyid kyang min //
analyzed: de ma thag pa nyid kyang min //
translated: Nor is it the immediately preceding condition,

original: de yod pa ni med phyir ro //
analyzed: de yod pa ni med phyir ro //
translated: because it does not exist when that exists.

original: sred pa med na ni las kyis sbyar ba'i rgyal srid la sogs pa yang 'dor bar byed do //🔽gal te blo las kyi rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sred pa med na ni las kyis sbyar ba'i rgyal srid la sogs pa yang 'dor bar byed do // gal te blo las kyi rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir /
translated: If craving does not exist, one would abandon even the kingdom, etc. that are created by karma.

original: 'dor ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'dor ba ma yin nam /
translated: But isn’t it that the mind follows after karma?🔽How could one abandon what is obtained by karma?

original: gang gis thob par 'dor bar byed pa de'i las nyid de 'dra ba yin no //
analyzed: gang gis thob par 'dor bar byed pa de'i las nyid de 'dra ba yin no //
translated: The karma itself is like that by which one obtains and abandons.

original: 'on te thar pa'i bdag nyid rnams la skye ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod na /
analyzed: 'on te thar pa'i bdag nyid rnams la skye ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod na /
translated: But if you say that it is because those who are liberated do not take rebirth,

original: de dag kyang las zad pa nyid kyis thar pa yin te /
analyzed: de dag kyang las zad pa nyid kyis thar pa yin te /
translated: then they are liberated by the exhaustion of karma itself.

original: de lta ma yin na med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: If it were otherwise, they would not exist.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: gal te las 'di thad pa ste //
analyzed: gal te las 'di thad pa ste //
translated: If this karma is exhausted,

original: srid pa dang ni rnam 'bral na //
analyzed: srid pa dang ni rnam 'bral na //
translated: and if one is separated from existence,

original: sred pa gtso bo'i rgyu yi zhes //
analyzed: sred pa gtso bo'i rgyu yi zhes //
translated: then craving is the primary cause.

original: 'di nyid 'dir ni rig par ldan //
analyzed: 'di nyid 'dir ni rig par ldan //
translated: This is known here by the wise.

original: 'on te 'di la srid yin na //
analyzed: 'on te 'di la srid yin na //
translated: But if this is existence,

original: las zad pa ni med pa nyid //
analyzed: las zad pa ni med pa nyid //
translated: then the exhaustion of karma is nonexistence.

original: srid bcas de las gzhan pa dang // gzhan pa'i las ni yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: srid bcas de las gzhan pa dang // gzhan pa'i las ni yang 'gyur ro //
translated: and the other is the karma of the other.

original: de ltar na re zhig kun 'byung gi mtshan nyid /
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig kun 'byung gi mtshan nyid /
translated: Thus, the characteristic of origination is explained.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnam bzhir bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnam bzhir bshad pa yin no //
translated: The four noble truths have been explained.

original: da ni sdug bsngal de 'gog pa srid pa yin no zhes 'gog pa'i bden pa'i rnam pa bzhi 'chad de /
analyzed: da ni sdug bsngal de 'gog pa srid pa yin no zhes 'gog pa'i bden pa'i rnam pa bzhi 'chad de /
translated: Now, the four aspects of the truth of cessation are explained, beginning with the statement, “The cessation of that suffering is possible.”

original: de ni gtan du ba min te /
analyzed: de ni gtan du ba min te /
translated: It is not permanent,

original: rgyu la gags sogs srid phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu la gags sogs srid phyir ro //
translated: because it is possible to obstruct the cause, etc.

original: 'khor phyir thar pa med ce na //
analyzed: 'khor phyir thar pa med ce na //
translated: If you say that there is no liberation because of cyclic existence,

original: ma yin 'dod dang ma grub phyir //
analyzed: ma yin 'dod dang ma grub phyir //
translated: that is not so, because of the desire for it and because of nonestablishment.

original: 'gog pa nyid dang / zhib nyid dang / gya nom pa nyid dang / nges par 'byung ba nyid de rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa nyid dang / zhib nyid dang / gya nom pa nyid dang / nges par 'byung ba nyid de rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: The four aspects are cessation, peace, excellence, and definite release.

original: 'gog pa nyid do zhes smras pa la 'gog pa nyid do zhes brjod do //
analyzed: 'gog pa nyid do zhes smras pa la 'gog pa nyid do zhes brjod do //
translated: “Cessation” is said to be cessation.

original: grol ba rnams kyang 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan par pha rol pos khas blangs pa de bkag pas na zhi ba nyid do //
analyzed: grol ba rnams kyang 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan par pha rol pos khas blangs pa de bkag pas na zhi ba nyid do //
translated: “Peace” is peace because of the negation of the opponent’s assertion that the liberated person possesses attachment and so on.

original: de las kyang mchog tu gyur pa'i thar pa yod do zhes zhes bya ba spangs pas na gya nom pa zhes bya ba'i rnam pa yin no //
analyzed: de las kyang mchog tu gyur pa'i thar pa yod do zhes zhes bya ba spangs pas na gya nom pa zhes bya ba'i rnam pa yin no //
translated: And since it is superior to that, it is the aspect of “sublime” because it rejects the idea that there is a liberation superior to that.

original: thar pa yang slar thar pa ma yin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de bsal na nges par 'byung ba nyid ces bya ba nyid rnam pa bzhi pa yin no //
analyzed: thar pa yang slar thar pa ma yin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de bsal na nges par 'byung ba nyid ces bya ba nyid rnam pa bzhi pa yin no //
translated: And since it is liberation, it is the aspect of “definite emergence” because it rejects the idea that liberation is not liberation.

original: de la rnam pa dang po ni //
analyzed: de la rnam pa dang po ni //
translated: The first aspect is

original: de ni gtan du ba min te //
analyzed: de ni gtan du ba min te //
translated: It is not permanent,

original: gtan du ni 'gyur ba ma yin te 'gog pa yang yin no //
analyzed: gtan du ni 'gyur ba ma yin te 'gog pa yang yin no //
translated: It is not permanent, but it is cessation.

original: 'khor ba pa yin pa'i phyir thar pa ma yin pa ni nyes pa yang ma yin te 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khor ba pa yin pa'i phyir thar pa ma yin pa ni nyes pa yang ma yin te 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And it is not the case that it is not liberation because it is samsara, because that is accepted.

original: thar pa ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: thar pa ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Liberation does not exist at all.

original: 'ga' zhig bcings pa de ni thar pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig bcings pa de ni thar pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: For one who is bound, liberation does not exist,

original: de'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because it is by nature that.

original: thar pa la yang bcings pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: thar pa la yang bcings pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: And for one who is liberated, there is no bondage,

original: de ni rtag tu @128a * //
analyzed: de ni rtag tu @128a * //
translated: because it is always

original: thar pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thar pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: by nature liberation.

original: 'on kyang sems kyi rgyun ma dag par 'gyur ba chogs pa'i khyad par las dag pa'i cha gzhan skyed pa 'ba' zhig go //
analyzed: 'on kyang sems kyi rgyun ma dag par 'gyur ba chogs pa'i khyad par las dag pa'i cha gzhan skyed pa 'ba' zhig go //
translated: But the continuum of mind is impure, and it is only from the special transformation of the continuum that a different pure part is produced.

original: de la phyi ma dag pa'i cha ni 'khor ba nyid du ma grub po //
analyzed: de la phyi ma dag pa'i cha ni 'khor ba nyid du ma grub po //
translated: And the latter, the pure part, is not established as cyclic existence.

original: don dam par ni 'khor ba pa 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par ni 'khor ba pa 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: In reality, there is no such thing as a cyclic existence.

original: skad cig rnams 'khor ba ma yin pa'i phyir dang / rgyun kyang don dam par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig rnams 'khor ba ma yin pa'i phyir dang / rgyun kyang don dam par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the moments are not cyclic existence, and because a continuum does not exist ultimately.

original: des na 'khor ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshegs ni ma grub bo //
analyzed: des na 'khor ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshegs ni ma grub bo //
translated: Therefore, the reason “because of cyclic existence” is not established.

original: gang la thar pa yod pa'i thar pa po yang med do //
analyzed: gang la thar pa yod pa'i thar pa po yang med do //
translated: And there is no liberator who is liberated.

original: gal te bcings pa thar min na //
analyzed: gal te bcings pa thar min na //
translated: If the bound one is not liberated,

original: gzhan bcings gzhan ni gol 'gyur te //
analyzed: gzhan bcings gzhan ni gol 'gyur te //
translated: then one bound and one unbound would exist simultaneously.🔽One would experience the suffering of hunger and thirst,

original: gzhan ni bkres dang gzhan drangs dang // gzhan gyi gso ba'i sdug bsngal myong //🔽gzhan ni nad las thar bar 'gyur //
analyzed: gzhan ni bkres dang gzhan drangs dang // gzhan gyi gso ba'i sdug bsngal myong // gzhan ni nad las thar bar 'gyur //
translated: while another would be nourished.🔽One would be sick,

original: gzhan ni dka' thub kyis gdungs la //
analyzed: gzhan ni dka' thub kyis gdungs la //
translated: while another would be tormented by austerities,

original: gzhan ni mtho ris bde ba myong //
analyzed: gzhan ni mtho ris bde ba myong //
translated: and another would experience the happiness of heaven.

original: gzhan ni bstan bcos sbyong bas ngal //
analyzed: gzhan ni bstan bcos sbyong bas ngal //
translated: Others are exhausted by studying treatises.

original: gzhan ni bstan bcos rtogs de'i tshe//
analyzed: gzhan ni bstan bcos rtogs de'i tshe//
translated: Others, when they understand the treatises,

original: rtogs ldan rgyu sbyor ci zhig dgos //
analyzed: rtogs ldan rgyu sbyor ci zhig dgos //
translated: what need do they have for a teacher?

original: 'di la lan du /
analyzed: 'di la lan du /
translated: To this we reply:

original: 'di ltar / ji srid bdag cag ma bcom zhing //🔽de yi yongs su gdung 'gyur ba //
analyzed: 'di ltar / ji srid bdag cag ma bcom zhing // de yi yongs su gdung 'gyur ba //
translated: As long as we are not destroyed🔽and are tormented by that,

original: de srid sdug bsngal sgro btags nas //
analyzed: de srid sdug bsngal sgro btags nas //
translated: we are attached to suffering

original: rang bzhin du ni gnas pa med //
analyzed: rang bzhin du ni gnas pa med //
translated: and do not abide in our nature.

original: grol ba po ni med na yang //
analyzed: grol ba po ni med na yang //
translated: Even though there is no liberator,

original: log par sgro 'dogs gzhom phyir brtson //
analyzed: log par sgro 'dogs gzhom phyir brtson //
translated: we strive to destroy false superimposition.

original: 'dod chags bral ba'i gnas pa ni //
analyzed: 'dod chags bral ba'i gnas pa ni //
translated: Abiding free from attachment

original: brtse ba'am yang na las dag gis //
analyzed: brtse ba'am yang na las dag gis //
translated: is through love or karma.

original: 'di la bsam pa ni /
analyzed: 'di la bsam pa ni /
translated: The thought here is this:

original: gal te re zhig 'dir kho na mthong ba la brjod na ni de'i tshe grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: gal te re zhig 'dir kho na mthong ba la brjod na ni de'i tshe grub pa nyid do //
translated: If you say that you see only this much, then that is established.

original: de dag ni 'ga' zhig tu 'jug pa 'am rtsol ba byed pa ma yin no //🔽chos nyid spangs bar bya ba na //
analyzed: de dag ni 'ga' zhig tu 'jug pa 'am rtsol ba byed pa ma yin no // chos nyid spangs bar bya ba na //
translated: They do not engage in or exert themselves in anything.

original: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said, “Abandoning reality is to be rejected.”

original: 'on te nged lta bu la yin la /
analyzed: 'on te nged lta bu la yin la /
translated: But if you say, “It is for someone like me,”🔽then you are not a yogi.

original: de'i tshe gcig po mngon par bzlog pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i tshe gcig po mngon par bzlog pa'i phyir /
translated: At that time, in order to refute the one,

original: bcings pa de nyid grol ba yin pas de dag gi gcig pa de nyid do //
analyzed: bcings pa de nyid grol ba yin pas de dag gi gcig pa de nyid do //
translated: the bound one is liberated, so that is the same one.

original: dngos po don dam par yod do zhes te /
analyzed: dngos po don dam par yod do zhes te /
translated: “Things exist ultimately” is said,

original: de tsam gyis ni de ltar tha snyad byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de tsam gyis ni de ltar tha snyad byed pa ma yin te /
translated: but that is not the way to make such a convention,

original: tha snyad ni rtogs pa la ltos pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha snyad ni rtogs pa la ltos pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because convention depends on understanding.

original: 'di ltar don dam pa na sbrul ni spang bar bya ba yin pa'i yul ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar don dam pa na sbrul ni spang bar bya ba yin pa'i yul ma yin te /
translated: Thus, ultimately, a rope is not an object to be abandoned,

original: 'on kyang sbrul nyid du lhag par mos pa yul yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang sbrul nyid du lhag par mos pa yul yin no //
translated: but rather the object of the imagination of a snake.

original: 'on te gal te kun rdzob tu gcig nyid yin pa lta bu na yang kun rdzob tu tha snyad yod par 'gyur mod don dam par ni gcig @128b med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on te gal te kun rdzob tu gcig nyid yin pa lta bu na yang kun rdzob tu tha snyad yod par 'gyur mod don dam par ni gcig @128b med pa'i phyir /
translated: But if, although they are the same in the conventional sense, there is a conventional existence, since ultimately there is no one,

original: ji ltar don dam pa'i tha snyad du 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar don dam pa'i tha snyad du 'gyur zhe na /
translated: how can there be an ultimate convention?

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: ce ltar gcig nyid kun rdzob pa //
analyzed: ce ltar gcig nyid kun rdzob pa //
translated: How can one be conventional?

original: tha snyad kyang ni kun rdzob nyid //
analyzed: tha snyad kyang ni kun rdzob nyid //
translated: Convention is itself conventional.

original: ji ltar de nyid du gcig med //
analyzed: ji ltar de nyid du gcig med //
translated: How can there be no one ultimately?

original: tha snyad kyi ni dngos med yin //
analyzed: tha snyad kyi ni dngos med yin //
translated: But it is a non-entity in conventional terms.🔽It is not the case that there is no effort

original: rang gi ngo bo las gzhan pa //🔽'bad pa'ang la lar yod ma yin //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo las gzhan pa // 'bad pa'ang la lar yod ma yin //
translated: In some cases, other than in its own nature.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ni //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ni //
translated: The state of being a cause and an effect

original: rtsod pa'i skabs 'byed byed pa min //
analyzed: rtsod pa'i skabs 'byed byed pa min //
translated: Is not what initiates a dispute.

original: ci phyir 'di las 'bras 'di zhes //
analyzed: ci phyir 'di las 'bras 'di zhes //
translated: “Why is this the effect of that?”

original: bya 'di mkhas pa'i tshul ma yin //
analyzed: bya 'di mkhas pa'i tshul ma yin //
translated: This is not the way of the wise.

original: de ltar rtogs pa dang ldan pa //
analyzed: de ltar rtogs pa dang ldan pa //
translated: Thus, one who possesses this realization

original: 'gar yang 'jug dang rtog pa min //
analyzed: 'gar yang 'jug dang rtog pa min //
translated: Is never engaged in or conceptualizes anything.

original: sngon dang phyi mar dmigs pa ni //
analyzed: sngon dang phyi mar dmigs pa ni //
translated: Since the prior and subsequent moments

original: tshad mas rab tu rig med phyir //🔽skad cig tsam la 'gar yang ni //
analyzed: tshad mas rab tu rig med phyir // skad cig tsam la 'gar yang ni //
translated: Are not known by valid cognition,🔽It is not possible for there to be

original: 'jug pa srid pa nyid ma yin //🔽des na rtsol ba 'ga' yang ni //
analyzed: 'jug pa srid pa nyid ma yin // des na rtsol ba 'ga' yang ni //
translated: Engagement in any way, even for an instant.🔽Therefore, there is no effort whatsoever,

original: yod min de phyir nor pa nyid //
analyzed: yod min de phyir nor pa nyid //
translated: And so it is a mistake.

original: khas blangs nas kyang brjod pa ni //
analyzed: khas blangs nas kyang brjod pa ni //
translated: Even though one accepts this, one can say,

original: 'dod chags bral ba'i gnas pa ni //
analyzed: 'dod chags bral ba'i gnas pa ni //
translated: “The state of being free from attachment”

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: And so forth.🔽If there is no engagement

original: dam pa'i don rtogs 'gyur ba na//🔽gal te 'jug pa med nyid na //
analyzed: dam pa'i don rtogs 'gyur ba na// gal te 'jug pa med nyid na //
translated: In the realization of the ultimate,

original: chags bral spyod par mi 'gyur te //
analyzed: chags bral spyod par mi 'gyur te //
translated: One will not engage in the conduct of freedom from attachment.

original: snga phyi rnam dbye la brten nas //
analyzed: snga phyi rnam dbye la brten nas //
translated: On the basis of the distinction between earlier and later,

original: spyod pa shes pa rtogs na yang //
analyzed: spyod pa shes pa rtogs na yang //
translated: even though one understands the knowledge of the bodhisattva’s conduct,

original: snying rje yis ni 'jug pa yin //🔽ji ltar rgyal po skyes bu la //
analyzed: snying rje yis ni 'jug pa yin // ji ltar rgyal po skyes bu la //
translated: one enters through compassion.🔽Just as a king is devoted

original: phan byed la brgyud rang brtson bzhin //
analyzed: phan byed la brgyud rang brtson bzhin //
translated: to the person who benefits him,

original: smon lam gtso bor byed pas na //
analyzed: smon lam gtso bor byed pas na //
translated: because of the preeminence of the vow,

original: de yi 'bras bu smon lam gyi //
analyzed: de yi 'bras bu smon lam gyi //
translated: the result of the vow

original: las kyi mthu las skyes pa yin //
analyzed: las kyi mthu las skyes pa yin //
translated: arises from the power of the vow.

original: 'di la brgal ba ci zhig yin //
analyzed: 'di la brgal ba ci zhig yin //
translated: What is the objection to this?

original: de phyir rnam pa lta bu'i ldog par sgro btags pa spang ba'i phyir brtson pa yin te /
analyzed: de phyir rnam pa lta bu'i ldog par sgro btags pa spang ba'i phyir brtson pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, we strive to eliminate the superimposition of the reversal of the aspect,

original: de lta ma yin na /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na /
translated: because otherwise

original: rmongs pa'i sdug bsngal myong bas spang bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rmongs pa'i sdug bsngal myong bas spang bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: the experience of the suffering of delusion would not be eliminated.

original: gal te las kyi gnas pa yin na'o na skye ba gzhan gyi las kyang yod pa'i phyir skye ba gzhan dang 'brel par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te las kyi gnas pa yin na'o na skye ba gzhan gyi las kyang yod pa'i phyir skye ba gzhan dang 'brel par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is the persistence of karma, then because the karma of another birth also exists, it would be connected with another birth.

original: 'on te dgra bcom pa las lan nus pa med na /
analyzed: 'on te dgra bcom pa las lan nus pa med na /
translated: But if the karma of the arhat is powerless,

original: gnas par yang mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gnas par yang mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: then it would not persist.

original: 'di la bshad pa /
analyzed: 'di la bshad pa /
translated: The response to this is as follows.

original: 'phags la ldog med 'dod phyir ro //🔽srid pa'i srid las rnam brgal ba'i //
analyzed: 'phags la ldog med 'dod phyir ro // srid pa'i srid las rnam brgal ba'i //
translated: because it is accepted that the noble ones cannot turn back.

original: las gzhan 'phen nus ma yin te //
analyzed: las gzhan 'phen nus ma yin te //
translated: The karma that projects a rebirth is incapable of projecting another rebirth

original: lhan cig byed pa zad pa'i phyir //
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa zad pa'i phyir //
translated: when the conditions that produce it have been exhausted.

original: 'phags pa ni rtsol ba med pa bzlog par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'phags pa ni rtsol ba med pa bzlog par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: The noble ones cannot turn back from the effortless state.

original: rtsol ba yang 'dod chags dang bral bas spang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rtsol ba yang 'dod chags dang bral bas spang bar 'gyur te /
translated: And effort is abandoned through detachment,

original: btang snyoms pa nyid kyis de ni 'ga' yang re ba mi 'cha' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: btang snyoms pa nyid kyis de ni 'ga' yang re ba mi 'cha' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because one who is indifferent does not form any expectations.

original: re ba med pa de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: re ba med pa de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: And because of the absence of expectations,

original: @129a * // skye ba gzhan 'grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: @129a * // skye ba gzhan 'grub pa ma yin no //
translated: another rebirth is not produced.

original: de'i phyir lhan cig byed pa sred pa'i mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir sngon gyi sred pas bskyed pa'i skye ba de gcig 'ba' zhig tu zad kyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir lhan cig byed pa sred pa'i mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir sngon gyi sred pas bskyed pa'i skye ba de gcig 'ba' zhig tu zad kyi /
translated: Therefore, because the defining characteristic of craving, which is a cooperative condition, is absent, that one birth that was produced by previous craving is exhausted,

original: gzhan ni med do zhes gnas so //
analyzed: gzhan ni med do zhes gnas so //
translated: and there is no other.

original: gal te brtse ba ni sdug bsngal las bskyab par bya pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te brtse ba ni sdug bsngal las bskyab par bya pa'i phyir /
translated: If compassion is the desire to protect from suffering,

original: sems can la 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: sems can la 'gyur gyi /
translated: it is directed toward sentient beings,

original: gzhan la ma yin pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gzhan la ma yin pa ma yin nam /
translated: not toward anything else.

original: bdag tu lta ba spangs pa'i phyir ni sems can 'ga' yang med la /
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba spangs pa'i phyir ni sems can 'ga' yang med la /
translated: Because of abandoning the view of self, there are no sentient beings at all.

original: sems can du lta ba yang med pa yin no //
analyzed: sems can du lta ba yang med pa yin no //
translated: And there is no view of sentient beings.

original: des na brtse ba'i phyir na sems can du lta ba ma spangs par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: des na brtse ba'i phyir na sems can du lta ba ma spangs par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Therefore, because of compassion, the view of sentient beings is not abandoned.

original: 'di la lan du /
analyzed: 'di la lan du /
translated: The response to that is:

original: sdug bsngal shes la 'gal med phyir //
analyzed: sdug bsngal shes la 'gal med phyir //
translated: Because there is no contradiction in knowing suffering,

original: 'du byed snga ma 'jug pa can //
analyzed: 'du byed snga ma 'jug pa can //
translated: the previous compositional activity is engaged.

original: dngos chos brtse ba skye ba de //
analyzed: dngos chos brtse ba skye ba de //
translated: That compassion arises from the reality of things

original: sems can rjes 'bral can ma yin //
analyzed: sems can rjes 'bral can ma yin //
translated: is not separate from sentient beings.

original: gang gi tshe sdug bsngal la gsum dang ldan pa mtha' dag sdug bsngal ba'o zhes mngon sum du byas pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe sdug bsngal la gsum dang ldan pa mtha' dag sdug bsngal ba'o zhes mngon sum du byas pa de'i tshe /
translated: When one actualizes that the entirety of the three types of suffering is suffering,

original: kun 'byung gi mtshan nyid sred pa dang 'bral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kun 'byung gi mtshan nyid sred pa dang 'bral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then one becomes free from craving, which is the characteristic of the origin.

original: kun 'byung spangs pa la ni 'dod chags la sogs pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: kun 'byung spangs pa la ni 'dod chags la sogs pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because there is no attachment and so on in the abandonment of the origin,

original: sems can gyi tshogs mtha' dag dang 'gal ba med pa mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: sems can gyi tshogs mtha' dag dang 'gal ba med pa mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: there is equality without contradiction with the entirety of sentient beings.

original: des na sdug bsngal mthong ba las dngos po la brten pa nyid kyis brtse ba chen po skye ba yin gyi de'i gnas skabs na sems can du 'dzin pa dang 'brel pa ni med do //
analyzed: des na sdug bsngal mthong ba las dngos po la brten pa nyid kyis brtse ba chen po skye ba yin gyi de'i gnas skabs na sems can du 'dzin pa dang 'brel pa ni med do //
translated: Therefore, great compassion arises from seeing suffering, based on things, but at that time, it is not related to the apprehension of sentient beings.

original: de lta bur 'gyur ba'i sems can du 'dzin pa'i lta ba spangs pa'i bsam pa gang yin pa de ni brtse ba yin la /
analyzed: de lta bur 'gyur ba'i sems can du 'dzin pa'i lta ba spangs pa'i bsam pa gang yin pa de ni brtse ba yin la /
translated: Compassion is the intention that abandons the view that apprehends sentient beings as existing in such a way.

original: de yang bdag tu lta ba spangs pa kho na'i yin gyi gzhan gyi ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang bdag tu lta ba spangs pa kho na'i yin gyi gzhan gyi ni ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, it is the intention of one who has abandoned the view of the transitory collection, but not of others.

original: bdag tu lta ba ma spangs pa ni ji ltar gzhan dag de spang ba'i don du 'bad par 'gyur /
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba ma spangs pa ni ji ltar gzhan dag de spang ba'i don du 'bad par 'gyur /
translated: How could one who has not abandoned the view of the transitory collection strive to abandon that view for others?

original: gal te 'dod chags dang brtse ba la khyad ci zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: gal te 'dod chags dang brtse ba la khyad ci zhig yod ce na /
translated: If you ask, “What is the difference between attachment and compassion?”

original: 'di ni khyad par med de /🔽de bdag min pa'i chos la ni //
analyzed: 'di ni khyad par med de / de bdag min pa'i chos la ni //
translated: There is no difference in their mode of apprehension.🔽Attachment is the desire for what is not real

original: bdag gzhan sgro 'dogs pa la chags //🔽sdug bsngal rgyun rig tsam las ni //
analyzed: bdag gzhan sgro 'dogs pa la chags // sdug bsngal rgyun rig tsam las ni //
translated: In the form of self and other.🔽Compassion arises from merely knowing

original: brtse bskyed par 'gyur ba yin //
analyzed: brtse bskyed par 'gyur ba yin //
translated: The continuum of suffering.

original: 'dod chags dang brtse ba ni khyad che ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang brtse ba ni khyad che ste /
translated: Attachment and compassion are very different.

original: rgyu tha dad pa'i phyir dang yul tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu tha dad pa'i phyir dang yul tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because their causes are different and because their objects are different.

original: 'di ltar ma 'ongs pa med par sgro btags nas bdag nyid ma 'ongs pa'i bde ba dang phrad par smon pas dbang du byas pa'i 'dod chags ni de las 'jug pa yin la yul yang de'i bdag nyid ma yin pa @129b la de'i bdag nyid du mthong bar🔽'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar ma 'ongs pa med par sgro btags nas bdag nyid ma 'ongs pa'i bde ba dang phrad par smon pas dbang du byas pa'i 'dod chags ni de las 'jug pa yin la yul yang de'i bdag nyid ma yin pa @129b la de'i bdag nyid du mthong bar 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: Thus, attachment that is governed by the hope of attaining future pleasure, having imagined the future as if it were nonexistent, is engaged in that object, which is not of the nature of the future, as if it were of that nature.

original: phyin ci log rnam pa bzhis bsgom pa'i yid ni /
analyzed: phyin ci log rnam pa bzhis bsgom pa'i yid ni /
translated: The mind that is cultivated by the four errors

original: chags par 'gyur gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //🔽brtse ba ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyun tsam mngon du byas pa nyid la /
analyzed: chags par 'gyur gyi gzhan ni ma yin no // brtse ba ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyun tsam mngon du byas pa nyid la /
translated: becomes attached, but not otherwise.🔽Compassion is engaged in order to eliminate the suffering of others,🔽and it is engaged in order to eliminate the suffering of others,🔽and it is engaged in order to eliminate the suffering of others,

original: log par mngon par rlom pa dang bral bar bya ba'i don du 'jug pa yin no //🔽gal te bdag gis 'di'i sdug bsngal bzlog par bya'o snyam pa'i bsam pa med pa ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /🔽'di la lan du /
analyzed: log par mngon par rlom pa dang bral bar bya ba'i don du 'jug pa yin no // gal te bdag gis 'di'i sdug bsngal bzlog par bya'o snyam pa'i bsam pa med pa ji ltar 'gyur zhe na / 'di la lan du /
translated: and it is engaged in order to eliminate the suffering of others,🔽and it is engaged in order to eliminate the suffering of others,🔽and it is engaged in order to eliminate the suffering of others,🔽and it is engaged in order to eliminate the suffering of others,🔽and it is engaged in order to eliminate the suffering of others,🔽and it is engaged in order to eliminate the suffering of others,🔽and it is engaged in order to eliminate the suffering of others,🔽and it is engaged in order to eliminate the suffering of others,🔽and it is engaged in order to eliminate the suffering of others,🔽and it is engaged in order to eliminate the suffering of others,🔽and it is engaged in order to eliminate the suffering of others,🔽and it is engaged in order to eliminate the suffering of others,🔽and it is engaged in order to eliminate the suffering of others,🔽and it is engaged in order to eliminate the suffering of others,🔽and it is engaged in order to eliminate the suffering of others,🔽and it is engaged in order to eliminate the suffering of others,🔽and it is engaged in order to eliminate the suffering of others,🔽and it is engaged in order to eliminate the suffering of others,🔽and it is engaged in order to eliminate the suffering of others,🔽and it is engaged in order to eliminate the suffering of others,🔽and it is engaged in order to eliminate the suffering of others,🔽and it is engaged in order to eliminate the suffering of others,🔽and it is engaged in order to eliminate the suffering of others,🔽and it is engaged in order to eliminate the suffering of others,🔽and it is engaged in order to eliminate the suffering of others,🔽and it is engaged in order to eliminate the suffering of others,

original: gal te bdag don la 'jug na //🔽de lta nyid du thal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: gal te bdag don la 'jug na //🔽de lta nyid du thal bar 'gyur //
translated: and it is engaged in order to eliminate the suffering of others,🔽and it is engaged in order to eliminate the suffering of others

original: gzhan don cam la 'jug rnams la //
analyzed: gzhan don cam la 'jug rnams la //
translated: But for those who engage in altruism,

original: rang 'dzin ched ka che ba min //
analyzed: rang 'dzin ched ka che ba min //
translated: there is no great purpose in self-grasping.

original: rgyal po'i dpe ni bstan zin te //
analyzed: rgyal po'i dpe ni bstan zin te //
translated: The example of the king has already been explained.

original: de'i phyir 'di la mi 'thad med //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di la mi 'thad med //
translated: Therefore, there is no inconsistency here.

original: yang na snga ma snga ma yis //
analyzed: yang na snga ma snga ma yis //
translated: Or else, the later ones arise

original: skyes bu dam pa'i 'du byed la //
analyzed: skyes bu dam pa'i 'du byed la //
translated: from the formative forces of the holy beings.

original: 'jug 'gyur rgyun mthong yod min zhing //
analyzed: 'jug 'gyur rgyun mthong yod min zhing //
translated: The continuum is not seen to exist,

original: 'jug pa'ang 'ga' zhig yod ma yin //
analyzed: 'jug pa'ang 'ga' zhig yod ma yin //
translated: nor is there any engagement at all.

original: gnas pa ma yin tshad med phyir //
analyzed: gnas pa ma yin tshad med phyir //
translated: It is not permanent because it is immeasurable.

original: khyod cag 'khrul pa nyid du zad //
analyzed: khyod cag 'khrul pa nyid du zad //
translated: You are simply mistaken.

original: des na 'di ni brtse ba dang 'dod chags kyi khyad par yin te /
analyzed: des na 'di ni brtse ba dang 'dod chags kyi khyad par yin te /
translated: Therefore, this is the difference between love and attachment.

original: shin tu rgyu skyed pas chog go //
analyzed: shin tu rgyu skyed pas chog go //
translated: It is sufficient to have generated the cause.

original: gal te de kho na mthong ba la skye ba'i phyir brtse / gal te bdag la gnod pa byed pa mthong na khro bar 'gyur ba rang bzhin du ni 'gyur ba nyid de /
analyzed: gal te de kho na mthong ba la skye ba'i phyir brtse / gal te bdag la gnod pa byed pa mthong na khro bar 'gyur ba rang bzhin du ni 'gyur ba nyid de /
translated: If love arises from seeing reality, and if one becomes angry when seeing someone harming oneself, then one would be by nature angry.

original: mi gtsang ba la sogs pa mthong ba la rgyab kyis phyogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhe na / mi sdug pa bsgom pas ni thar pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: mi gtsang ba la sogs pa mthong ba la rgyab kyis phyogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhe na / mi sdug pa bsgom pas ni thar pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Because one turns one’s back on seeing impurity, etc.

original: 'on kyang sdug bsngal la sogs pa mthong ba las yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang sdug bsngal la sogs pa mthong ba las yin no //
translated: But liberation is not from the meditation on foulness, but from seeing suffering, etc.

original: bdag yod na ni de rang dbang yin pas gzhan sdug bsngal bar byed pa'i phyir sdang bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: bdag yod na ni de rang dbang yin pas gzhan sdug bsngal bar byed pa'i phyir sdang bar 'gyur na /
translated: If there were a self, then since it would be independent, one would be angry because it would cause the suffering of others.

original: gang gi tshe 'di rgyu la rag las pa de'i rang gi ngo bo tsam gyis 'jug pa dang gnod par byed pa'i dus na de nyid med pa la gnod par bya bar mi nus pa de'i tshe ni sngar bar 'dzin pa'i don med do //
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'di rgyu la rag las pa de'i rang gi ngo bo tsam gyis 'jug pa dang gnod par byed pa'i dus na de nyid med pa la gnod par bya bar mi nus pa de'i tshe ni sngar bar 'dzin pa'i don med do //
translated: But when it is dependent on causes, then the meaning of grasping it as previously existing is meaningless, since it functions by its mere intrinsic reality and when it is being harmed, it is powerless to be harmed in the absence of that.

original: gti mug nyes pa'i rtsa ba de //
analyzed: gti mug nyes pa'i rtsa ba de //
translated: Delusion is the root of faults.

original: de yang sems can 'dzin pa yin //
analyzed: de yang sems can 'dzin pa yin //
translated: And that is grasping sentient beings.

original: de med nyes rgyu la khro min //
analyzed: de med nyes rgyu la khro min //
translated: Without that, one is not angry at the cause of faults.

original: des na brtse ba nyes med 'dod //
analyzed: des na brtse ba nyes med 'dod //
translated: Therefore, compassion is asserted to be faultless.

original: gal te bdag la gnod pa byed pa mthong na khro bar 'gyur ba yin na /
analyzed: gal te bdag la gnod pa byed pa mthong na khro bar 'gyur ba yin na /
translated: If one is angry when seeing someone who harms oneself,

original: bdag ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: There is no self at all.🔽However, even without sentient beings, the mere apprehension of sentient beings is the sole cause of anger.

original: 'on kyang sems can med par yang sems can du 'dzin pa tsam 'ba' zhig khro ba'i rgyu yin pas sems can du 'dzin pa med pa na ni /
analyzed: 'on kyang sems can med par yang sems can du 'dzin pa tsam 'ba' zhig khro ba'i rgyu yin pas sems can du 'dzin pa med pa na ni /
translated: When there is no apprehension of sentient beings,

original: gti mug ni sems can du lta ba'i rmongs pa med pa'i phyir /🔽rang nyid @130a * //
analyzed: gti mug ni sems can du lta ba'i rmongs pa med pa'i phyir / rang nyid @130a * //
translated: delusion is the confusion of the view of sentient beings.

original: med pa yin no //
analyzed: med pa yin no //
translated: It does not exist by itself.

original: de bas na nyes pa thams cad dang bral ba'i rtsa ba ni skyon yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na nyes pa thams cad dang bral ba'i rtsa ba ni skyon yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the root of being free from all faults is not a fault.

original: gal te 'dod chags dang bral ba lus dang bcas pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te 'dod chags dang bral ba lus dang bcas pa yin na /
translated: If one who is free from attachment has a body,

original: de'i tshe ma grol ba nyid du mi 'gyur ram zhe na /
analyzed: de'i tshe ma grol ba nyid du mi 'gyur ram zhe na /
translated: then is he not liberated?

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: This is not so.🔽

original: nyes pa dang bral ba'i sems yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyes pa dang bral ba'i sems yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the mind is free from faults.🔽Moreover,

original: gzhan yang / grol med ma yin sngon du med //
analyzed: gzhan yang / grol med ma yin sngon du med //
translated: He is not liberated, nor was he previously unliberated.

original: zad na gzhan mtshams mi sbyor phyir //
analyzed: zad na gzhan mtshams mi sbyor phyir //
translated: If he were to cease, he would not link with another.

original: 'du byed nus pa ma zad pa //
analyzed: 'du byed nus pa ma zad pa //
translated: If conditioned forces were not exhausted,

original: gal te gnas pa nyes med nyid //
analyzed: gal te gnas pa nyes med nyid //
translated: then abiding would be faultless.

original: skye ba gzhan mtshams sbyor ba dang // 'gal ba'i yid la gnas pa ji ltar grol ba ma yin //🔽sngon gyi 'du byed skye ba de skyed par byed pa yang zad ba'i phyir mtshams sbyor ba ma yin no //
analyzed: skye ba gzhan mtshams sbyor ba dang // 'gal ba'i yid la gnas pa ji ltar grol ba ma yin // sngon gyi 'du byed skye ba de skyed par byed pa yang zad ba'i phyir mtshams sbyor ba ma yin no //
translated: How can one who is intent on the cessation of the life-cycle be liberated?🔽The prior formative forces that produce birth are exhausted, and so there is no rebirth.

original: gang dag skye ba gzhan du mtshan sbyor ba med par bya ba'i phyir 'du byed zad 'dod pa med pas /
analyzed: gang dag skye ba gzhan du mtshan sbyor ba med par bya ba'i phyir 'du byed zad 'dod pa med pas /
translated: Those who desire the exhaustion of the formative forces do not desire the exhaustion of the life-cycle in order to be reborn.

original: 'du byed pa zad pa de ni ji srid 'du byed rjes su 'jug gi bar du gnas pa la nyes pa med pa nyid do /
analyzed: 'du byed pa zad pa de ni ji srid 'du byed rjes su 'jug gi bar du gnas pa la nyes pa med pa nyid do /
translated: There is no fault in the exhaustion of the formative forces remaining as long as the life-cycle continues.

original: snying rje dman pa nyid phyir yang //
analyzed: snying rje dman pa nyid phyir yang //
translated: And also because of the deficiency of compassion,

original: gnas pa'i 'bad rtsol chen po med //
analyzed: gnas pa'i 'bad rtsol chen po med //
translated: there is no great effort to remain.

original: gang dag brtse ba chen po pa //
analyzed: gang dag brtse ba chen po pa //
translated: Those who have great compassion

original: gzhan gyi ngor ni bzhugs pa yin //
analyzed: gzhan gyi ngor ni bzhugs pa yin //
translated: remain for the sake of others.

original: 'du byed zad pa'i phyir dang / snying rje dman pa nyid kyi phyir yang gnas pa'i 'bad rtsol med pas gtan du gnas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'du byed zad pa'i phyir dang / snying rje dman pa nyid kyi phyir yang gnas pa'i 'bad rtsol med pas gtan du gnas pa ma yin no //
translated: And also because of the deficiency of compassion, there is no great effort to remain.

original: thugs rje chen po dang ldan pa dag ni gnas pa nyid do //
analyzed: thugs rje chen po dang ldan pa dag ni gnas pa nyid do //
translated: Those who possess great compassion remain.

original: de bzhed pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhed pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they desire to remain.

original: gal te lam nus pa yin na de'i tshe dang po rgyun du zhugs pa'i lam nyid du srid pa 'chad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te lam nus pa yin na de'i tshe dang po rgyun du zhugs pa'i lam nyid du srid pa 'chad par 'gyur te /
translated: If the path is capable of that, then at the time of the first path of the stream-enterer, existence would be severed,

original: 'jig tshogs su lta ba dang bral ba'i phyir ro /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs su lta ba dang bral ba'i phyir ro /
translated: because one would be free from the view of the transitory collection.

original: 'di ltar 'jig tshogs su lta ba dang / the tshom dang tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa spangs pas rgyun du zhugs par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jig tshogs su lta ba dang / the tshom dang tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa spangs pas rgyun du zhugs par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Thus, one becomes a stream-enterer by abandoning the view of the transitory collection, doubt, and the clinging to rules and ritual as supreme.

original: gti mug nyes pa'i rtsa ba ste /
analyzed: gti mug nyes pa'i rtsa ba ste /
translated: Delusion is the root of faults,

original: de yang sems can 'dzin pa yin no zhes kyang brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang sems can 'dzin pa yin no zhes kyang brjod pa yin no //
translated: and it is also said to be the grasping of sentient beings.

original: des na lam gzhan don med par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: des na lam gzhan don med par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Therefore, the other paths would be purposeless.

original: 'di la bshad pa /
analyzed: 'di la bshad pa /
translated: The explanation of this is as follows:

original: gal te 'jig tshogs lta bral phyir //
analyzed: gal te 'jig tshogs lta bral phyir //
translated: If, due to being free from the view of the transitory collection,

original: lam dang bor ni srid med 'gyur //
analyzed: lam dang bor ni srid med 'gyur //
translated: existence would not occur on the first path,

original: lhan cig skyes ba ma spangs phyir //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes ba ma spangs phyir //
translated: then, since the innate [afflictions] would not be abandoned,

original: spangs na srid pa ga la yod //
analyzed: spangs na srid pa ga la yod //
translated: how could existence occur if they were abandoned?

original: 'jig tshogs su lta ba mtha' dag spangs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs su lta ba mtha' dag spangs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: But it is not the case that all views of the perishing aggregates are abandoned,

original: mngon par 'du byed pa las byung ba nyid spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pa las byung ba nyid spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the view of the perishing aggregates that arises from mental construction is not abandoned.

original: lhan cig skyes pa ni spangs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa ni spangs pa ma yin no //
translated: The innate view of the perishing aggregates is not abandoned.

original: lam dang po pa @130b ni bden pa mthong ba tsam yin la /
analyzed: lam dang po pa @130b ni bden pa mthong ba tsam yin la /
translated: The first path is the mere seeing of the truth.

original: mthong bas kyang mngon par 'du byed pa las byung ba'i bdag tu 'dzin pa spangs pa yin te /
analyzed: mthong bas kyang mngon par 'du byed pa las byung ba'i bdag tu 'dzin pa spangs pa yin te /
translated: And by seeing, the view of the perishing aggregates that arises from mental construction is abandoned,

original: gzhi med pa'i nyon mongs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhi med pa'i nyon mongs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is a non-existent affliction.

original: nye bar bstan pa las byung ba'i bdag lta ba de ni /
analyzed: nye bar bstan pa las byung ba'i bdag lta ba de ni /
translated: That view of the perishing aggregates that arises from teaching

original: bzlog pa mthong ba tsam nyid kyis spong ba yin la /🔽lhan cig skyes pa'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba ni thog ma med pa nas goms pas brtan pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bzlog pa mthong ba tsam nyid kyis spong ba yin la / lhan cig skyes pa'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba ni thog ma med pa nas goms pas brtan pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: is abandoned by the mere seeing of its negation.

original: gnyen po goms pa'i lam nyid kyis spong ba yin te /
analyzed: gnyen po goms pa'i lam nyid kyis spong ba yin te /
translated: But the innate view of the perishing aggregates is abandoned by the path of repeated practice, because it is firm, being habituated from beginningless time.

original: des na lhan cig skyes pa spangs pa las srid pa zad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na lhan cig skyes pa spangs pa las srid pa zad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the extinction of existence is due to the abandonment of the innate view of the perishing aggregates.

original: gang gi 'dod pas lhan cig skyes pa yang spangs par 'dod pas ni spangs nas srid pa ga la yod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi 'dod pas lhan cig skyes pa yang spangs par 'dod pas ni spangs nas srid pa ga la yod par 'gyur te /
translated: How could one who wishes to abandon connate nescience exist in cyclic existence?

original: shes rab rnon po'i ni lam dang po nyid nus pa thams cad dang ldan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: shes rab rnon po'i ni lam dang po nyid nus pa thams cad dang ldan pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the first path of those with sharp wisdom is endowed with all powers.

original: de nyid lam thams cad kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de nyid lam thams cad kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: That is the nature of all paths.

original: gal te sems can du lta ba lhan cig skyes pa bdag gi rnam pa can yin na /
analyzed: gal te sems can du lta ba lhan cig skyes pa bdag gi rnam pa can yin na /
translated: If the connate view of the transitory collection has the aspect of self,

original: de'i tshe bdag med pas mngon par 'du byed pa nyid las de las blo 'gyur ba yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe bdag med pas mngon par 'du byed pa nyid las de las blo 'gyur ba yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: then at that time, the mind would be transformed from that by the manifest activity of selflessness, but not otherwise.

original: skyed par byed pa'i dngos po med na nye bar bstan pa tsam zhig rgyu yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: skyed par byed pa'i dngos po med na nye bar bstan pa tsam zhig rgyu yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
