translated: If the cause of the view of the transitory collection does not exist, mere teaching would be the cause.

original: 'di la bshad pa /🔽bde bar 'gyur ba'am sdug bsngal bar //
analyzed: 'di la bshad pa / bde bar 'gyur ba'am sdug bsngal bar //
translated: The treatise responds:🔽When one wishes,

original: ma gyur cig ces 'dod pa na //
analyzed: ma gyur cig ces 'dod pa na //
translated: “May I be happy or may I not suffer,”

original: nga'o snyam pa'i blo gang des //
analyzed: nga'o snyam pa'i blo gang des //
translated: the mind that thinks “I”

original: sems can lta la lhan cig skyes //
analyzed: sems can lta la lhan cig skyes //
translated: views sentient beings and is connate.

original: nga zhes mthong ba med par ni //
analyzed: nga zhes mthong ba med par ni //
translated: Without seeing “I,”

original: 'ga' yang bdag la chags pa min //🔽bdag la sred pa med par yang //
analyzed: 'ga' yang bdag la chags pa min // bdag la sred pa med par yang //
translated: No one is attached to the self.🔽And one does not run toward pleasure

original: bde ba 'dod pas mngon rgyug min //
analyzed: bde ba 'dod pas mngon rgyug min //
translated: because of desire for the self.

original: bdag bde bar gyur cig ce'am //
analyzed: bdag bde bar gyur cig ce'am //
translated: The thought “May I be happy”

original: rnam pa gzhan du ma gyur ces bya ba de lta ba'i rnam pa can //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du ma gyur ces bya ba de lta ba'i rnam pa can //
translated: or “May I not be unhappy” is the form of the view of the self.

original: nga'o snyam pa'i blo thog ma med pa'i bag chags kyi dbang gis skyes par 'gyur ba de ni sems can du lta ba lhan cig skyes pa yin no //
analyzed: nga'o snyam pa'i blo thog ma med pa'i bag chags kyi dbang gis skyes par 'gyur ba de ni sems can du lta ba lhan cig skyes pa yin no //
translated: The innate view of the self is the thought “I am,” which arises through the power of beginningless predispositions.

original: de spangs ba'i phyir ni srid pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de spangs ba'i phyir ni srid pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of the abandonment of that, there is no existence.

original: bdag go zhes ma mthong na ni //
analyzed: bdag go zhes ma mthong na ni //
translated: If one does not see the self,

original: bdag tu zhen par mi 'gyur gyi //
analyzed: bdag tu zhen par mi 'gyur gyi //
translated: one does not adhere to the self.

original: mthong ba la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba la ni ma yin no //
translated: But one does not abandon the view of the self by seeing the self.

original: bdag la zhen pa med par yang bde ba 'dod pas mgon par rgyug par mi byed pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag la zhen pa med par yang bde ba 'dod pas mgon par rgyug par mi byed pa yin no //
translated: And one does not run toward pleasure because of desire for the self.

original: gang zhig sems can du lhan cig skyes pas bcug pa'i bdag nyid du zhen pa dang 'brel pa de ci ltar yang srid med par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang zhig sems can du lhan cig skyes pas bcug pa'i bdag nyid du zhen pa dang 'brel pa de ci ltar yang srid med par 'gyur /
translated: How could one who is attached to the self, which is implanted by the innate view of the self, ever be without existence?

original: des na sems can du lta ba lhan cig skyes pa yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: des na sems can du lta ba lhan cig skyes pa yod pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because the innate view of sentient beings exists,

original: lam dang po nyid du 'khor ba med pa ma yin @131a * //
analyzed: lam dang po nyid du 'khor ba med pa ma yin @131a * //
translated: samsara is not absent from the very beginning of the path.

original: te ; sems can du lta ba mtha' dag spangs pa las gdon mi za bar 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bya bar nges so //
analyzed: te ; sems can du lta ba mtha' dag spangs pa las gdon mi za bar 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bya bar nges so //
translated: It is certain that samsara is not necessarily absent from the complete abandonment of the view of sentient beings.

original: 'dis ni zhi ba nyid ces bya ba'i rnam pa bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni zhi ba nyid ces bya ba'i rnam pa bshad pa yin no //
translated: This explains the term “peace.”

original: gal te bdag yod na /
analyzed: gal te bdag yod na /
translated: If the self exists,

original: bcings pa de nyid grol ba yin pa de'i phyir bdag la yongs su tshim pa'i khyad par las thar ba de gya nom par 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: bcings pa de nyid grol ba yin pa de'i phyir bdag la yongs su tshim pa'i khyad par las thar ba de gya nom par 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
translated: then the very one who is bound is liberated. Therefore, liberation is not sublime due to the special satisfaction of the self.

original: bdag med pa na go gang las tshim par 'gyur /
analyzed: bdag med pa na go gang las tshim par 'gyur /
translated: If the self does not exist, from what is there satisfaction?

original: gal te 'gyur na de 'khrul pa nyid yin pas nyes pa dang bcas pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: gal te 'gyur na de 'khrul pa nyid yin pas nyes pa dang bcas pa nyid yin te /
translated: If there is satisfaction, then that is a mistake and is faulty.

original: 'di thar pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'di thar pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: This is not liberation.

original: 'di la lan btab pa ni /
analyzed: 'di la lan btab pa ni /
translated: The response to this is:

original: sdug bsngal skye ba'i rgyu nyid ni //
analyzed: sdug bsngal skye ba'i rgyu nyid ni //
translated: The cause of the arising of suffering

original: 'ching yin rtag la de ga las //
analyzed: 'ching yin rtag la de ga las //
translated: is bondage. How could it be permanent?

original: sdug bsngal mi skyed rgyu nyid ni //
analyzed: sdug bsngal mi skyed rgyu nyid ni //
translated: But if it is not the cause of suffering,

original: thar yin rtag la de ga las //
analyzed: thar yin rtag la de ga las //
translated: how can liberation be the eternal?

original: gal te bdag rtag pa dang / de bzhin khyab pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te bdag rtag pa dang / de bzhin khyab pa yin no //
translated: If the self is permanent and all-pervading,

original: de'i tshe rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa med pa'i phyir de rang nyid bdag gi sdug bsngal skyed par nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i tshe rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa med pa'i phyir de rang nyid bdag gi sdug bsngal skyed par nus pa ma yin te /
translated: then it cannot be the cause of suffering, because it is not the case that it is present when suffering is produced and absent when it is not.

original: nam mkha' bzhin no //
analyzed: nam mkha' bzhin no //
translated: It is like space.

original: gal te rang dbang dang nus pa yin na ji ltar bdag la sdug bsngal bskyed de /
analyzed: gal te rang dbang dang nus pa yin na ji ltar bdag la sdug bsngal bskyed de /
translated: If it is independent and has the ability to produce suffering, how can it produce suffering for itself?

original: rang gsad par bya ba'i phyir gshed byed sgrub pa ni rtog ba dang ldan par rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gsad par bya ba'i phyir gshed byed sgrub pa ni rtog ba dang ldan par rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not reasonable for a rational person to create a demon in order to kill itself.

original: 'on te 'di rmongs pa yin na /
analyzed: 'on te 'di rmongs pa yin na /
translated: But if it is ignorant,

original: de'i tshe bdag nyid mi shes pa ji ltar bdag yin /
analyzed: de'i tshe bdag nyid mi shes pa ji ltar bdag yin /
translated: then how can it be the self, which is unknowing?

original: mi dmigs pa'i phyir 'di med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i phyir 'di med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: It would be nonexistent, because it is not perceived.

original: 'on te 'di de'i rang bzhin nyid yin na de'i tshe nam yang gzhan du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir de 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te 'di de'i rang bzhin nyid yin na de'i tshe nam yang gzhan du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir de 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But if it is the nature of the self, then it is not tenable that it is ever otherwise.

original: 'on te bdag nyid shes kyang chos dang chos ma yin pas sdug bsngal bskyed do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te bdag nyid shes kyang chos dang chos ma yin pas sdug bsngal bskyed do zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the self, though it is not suffering, is the cause of suffering because of virtue and vice,

original: de lta na yang rtag pa dang khyab pa ni 'ga' yang sdug bsngal bskyed pa'i rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta na yang rtag pa dang khyab pa ni 'ga' yang sdug bsngal bskyed pa'i rgyu ma yin no //
translated: then even so, a permanent and all-pervading cause is not the cause of suffering.🔽If the self is of the nature of suffering, then it is not associated with suffering.

original: gal te 'di de'i tshe sdug bsngal gyi rang bzhin yin na de'i tshe sdug bsngal sdug bsngal dang ldan pa ma yin no //🔽de'i ngo bo yin na gzhan du ;
analyzed: gal te 'di de'i tshe sdug bsngal gyi rang bzhin yin na de'i tshe sdug bsngal sdug bsngal dang ldan pa ma yin no // de'i ngo bo yin na gzhan du ;
translated: If it is of the nature of suffering, it cannot be otherwise.

original: mi 'gyur te des na thar pa med do //
analyzed: mi 'gyur te des na thar pa med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no liberation.

original: gzhan gyi dngos por 'gyur na ni rtag pa ma yin pa'i phyir bdag ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dngos por 'gyur na ni rtag pa ma yin pa'i phyir bdag ma yin no //
translated: If it is of the nature of something else, it is not the self, because it is not permanent.

original: de ltar bde ba dang sdug bsngal tha dad pa yin na de'i tshe bdag bde ba can ma yin la sdug pa can yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar bde ba dang sdug bsngal tha dad pa yin na de'i tshe bdag bde ba can ma yin la sdug pa can yang ma yin no //
translated: Thus, if pleasure and suffering are different, then the self is neither pleasurable nor painful.

original: bde ba gzhan gyis gzhan bde ba nyid du ni 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bde ba gzhan gyis gzhan bde ba nyid du ni 'gyur ro //
translated: But if pleasure is of the nature of something else, then it is not the self.

original: 'on te der 'du ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te der 'du ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the self is the cause of pleasure and suffering because it is their basis,

original: 'du ba yang gzhan nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'du ba yang gzhan nyid ma yin nam /
translated: then the self is not permanent, because it is the cause of pleasure and suffering.🔽But if you say that the self is the cause of pleasure and suffering because it is their support,🔽then the self is not permanent, because it is the cause of pleasure and suffering.

original: gzhan nyid ma yin pa nyid na ni skyon de nyid do //
analyzed: gzhan nyid ma yin pa nyid na ni skyon de nyid do //
translated: If it is not different, then the same error arises.

original: bde ba dang bde ba ma yin pa la sogs @131b pa'i rang bzhin yin na ni /
analyzed: bde ba dang bde ba ma yin pa la sogs @131b pa'i rang bzhin yin na ni /
translated: If it has the nature of pleasure, pain, etc.,

original: rang bzhin gzhan dang gzhan nyid pas mi rtag pa nyid do //
analyzed: rang bzhin gzhan dang gzhan nyid pas mi rtag pa nyid do //
translated: then it is impermanent, because of having a different nature.

original: ci ste 'di don dam par rnam par 'gyur ba med pa nyid de /
analyzed: ci ste 'di don dam par rnam par 'gyur ba med pa nyid de /
translated: But if it is ultimately without transformation,

original: bde ba la sogs pas rtogs pa 'khrul pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pas rtogs pa 'khrul pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: then the realization of pleasure, etc. is just an error.

original: de yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang ma yin te /
translated: That is not so,

original: gal te 'khrul pa bdag las ni //
analyzed: gal te 'khrul pa bdag las ni //
translated: because if error is from the self,

original: gzhan na bdag med rig med phyir ;
analyzed: gzhan na bdag med rig med phyir ;
translated: then there is no awareness of no-self.

original: / de yi rang bzhin rig ce na //
analyzed: / de yi rang bzhin rig ce na //
translated: If you say that its nature is awareness,

original: rang rig ji ltar 'khrul pa yin //
analyzed: rang rig ji ltar 'khrul pa yin //
translated: how can self-awareness be error?

original: gal te thar kyang bde nyid na //
analyzed: gal te thar kyang bde nyid na //
translated: If liberation is just pleasure,

original: thar pa gya nom mi 'gyur te //
analyzed: thar pa gya nom mi 'gyur te //
translated: then liberation is not sublime,

original: de la de ni rmongs yod phyir //
analyzed: de la de ni rmongs yod phyir //
translated: because there is delusion about that,

original: de phyir bdag ni thar ldan min //🔽gang la yongs su tshim pa yi //
analyzed: de phyir bdag ni thar ldan min // gang la yongs su tshim pa yi //
translated: so the self does not possess liberation.🔽For one who has a succession of moments

original: skad cig gzhan dang gzhan srid pa //
analyzed: skad cig gzhan dang gzhan srid pa //
translated: of complete satisfaction,

original: de yi thar te gya nom ste ;
analyzed: de yi thar te gya nom ste ;
translated: there is liberation, which is sublime,

original: / nor dang mi rigs med pa yin //
analyzed: / nor dang mi rigs med pa yin //
translated: free of wealth and unrighteousness.

original: gal te bcings dang thar pa gnyis //
analyzed: gal te bcings dang thar pa gnyis //
translated: If you say that bondage and freedom

original: gzhi mi gcig par thal zhe na //
analyzed: gzhi mi gcig par thal zhe na //
translated: are not the same basis,

original: kun rdzob tu ni gcig pa yin //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu ni gcig pa yin //
translated: then they are the same in the conventional.

original: dngos po bzlog pa med pa nyid //
analyzed: dngos po bzlog pa med pa nyid //
translated: The opposite of an entity is not nonexistent.

original: gang zhig thar de bcings pas kyang //
analyzed: gang zhig thar de bcings pas kyang //
translated: If one who is liberated were also bound,

original: de yi tshe na ci zhig bya //
analyzed: de yi tshe na ci zhig bya //
translated: then what would be the point of that?

original: gal te nga sngon gyur to zhes //
analyzed: gal te nga sngon gyur to zhes //
translated: If one says, “I existed in the past,”

original: 'gyur na de yang gang du mkho //
analyzed: 'gyur na de yang gang du mkho //
translated: then what would be the need for that?

original: sngar ni gcig tu nges pa'i phyir //
analyzed: sngar ni gcig tu nges pa'i phyir //
translated: Because it is certain that it is one,

original: rtogs sngon byed can mi 'gyur la //
analyzed: rtogs sngon byed can mi 'gyur la //
translated: there would be no prior cognizer.

original: de yang rigs pa min zhe na //
analyzed: de yang rigs pa min zhe na //
translated: If you say that is illogical,

original: de ni 'dod pa nyid yin la //🔽yang na de ni gzhan don du //
analyzed: de ni 'dod pa nyid yin la // yang na de ni gzhan don du //
translated: then that is precisely what we assert.🔽Or else, we previously stated

original: rab tu sbyor zhes sngar brjod do //
analyzed: rab tu sbyor zhes sngar brjod do //
translated: that it is applied for the sake of others.

original: thar pa de ni gya nom nyid //
analyzed: thar pa de ni gya nom nyid //
translated: Liberation is excellent

original: gzhan pa dag ni bzlog pa yin //
analyzed: gzhan pa dag ni bzlog pa yin //
translated: and the others are the opposite.

original: 'on te 'di snyam du bdag ni rtag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on te 'di snyam du bdag ni rtag pa ma yin te /
translated: If you think, “I am not permanent,

original: sngar gyi skyon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sngar gyi skyon du 'gyur ro //
translated: then the previous error would ensue.

original: mi rtag pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: mi rtag pa yang ma yin te /
translated: I am not impermanent,

original: rtog pa sngon du byed pa yin par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtog pa sngon du byed pa yin par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that it would be a prior conceptualization.”

original: des na rtag pa dang mi rtag pa nyid du brjod bya ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: des na rtag pa dang mi rtag pa nyid du brjod bya ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, it is not to be expressed as permanent or impermanent.

original: de yang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: de yang mi 'thad de /
translated: That is also untenable.

original: mi rtag nyid du brjod med gang //
analyzed: mi rtag nyid du brjod med gang //
translated: What is not to be expressed as impermanent

original: de ni 'ga' yi rgyu ma yin //🔽brjod bya min la'ang bcings dang thar //
analyzed: de ni 'ga' yi rgyu ma yin // brjod bya min la'ang bcings dang thar //
translated: is not a cause of anything.🔽Also, bondage and liberation

original: ci lta bu yang yod ma yin //
analyzed: ci lta bu yang yod ma yin //
translated: do not exist in what is not to be expressed.

original: mi rtag pa nyid du brjod du med par zhes bya ba ni /🔽'di ni mi rtag pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni ma yin na /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid du brjod du med par zhes bya ba ni / 'di ni mi rtag pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni ma yin na /
translated: What is not to be expressed as impermanent is not impermanent.

original: gang de ma yin pa de ni rgyu nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: gang de ma yin pa de ni rgyu nyid ma yin no //
translated: What is not that is not a cause.

original: rgyu la mi rtag pa nyid kyis khyab pa yin no zhes gzhan tu gtan la phab bo //
analyzed: rgyu la mi rtag pa nyid kyis khyab pa yin no zhes gzhan tu gtan la phab bo //
translated: It is established elsewhere that being a cause is pervaded by being impermanent.

original: des na khyad par med pa byed pas rgyu nyid kyang srid pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na khyad par med pa byed pas rgyu nyid kyang srid pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, since it is not differentiated, it is not possible that it is a cause.

original: gang zhig rtag pa yang ma yin pa de ni gtan med pa nyid do //
analyzed: gang zhig rtag pa yang ma yin pa de ni gtan med pa nyid do //
translated: What is not permanent is utterly nonexistent.

original: 'on te bcings pa dang thar pa dag gzhi gcig pa'i phyir mi rtag pa nyid ma yin la /
analyzed: 'on te bcings pa dang thar pa dag gzhi gcig pa'i phyir mi rtag pa nyid ma yin la /
translated: But if bondage and liberation do not exist in what is not to be expressed, then bondage and liberation do not exist.

original: rgyu yin pa'i phyir rtag pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba lan du @132a * //
analyzed: rgyu yin pa'i phyir rtag pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba lan du @132a * //
translated: Because it is a cause, it is not permanent.

original: 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: This is the response.

original: de yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: de yang mi rung ste /
translated: But that is also unacceptable, because:

original: rtag dang mi rtag las grol ba'i //
analyzed: rtag dang mi rtag las grol ba'i //
translated: An entity that is free from permanence and impermanence

original: ngo bo nyid ni dmigs ma yin //🔽thams cad ldog dang rjes su ni //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ni dmigs ma yin // thams cad ldog dang rjes su ni //
translated: is not perceived.🔽Because it is seen that everything

original: 'jug pa nyid du mthong phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jug pa nyid du mthong phyir ro //
translated: is both reversed and engaged.

original: ci ste gal te gzhan du mi 'gyur na //
analyzed: ci ste gal te gzhan du mi 'gyur na //
translated: But if it does not become something else,

original: gnyi ga'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ro zhe na //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ro zhe na //
translated: it would have the nature of both.

original: de la'ang nyes pa gang gi phyir //🔽gang gi rang bzhin 'jig med pa //
analyzed: de la'ang nyes pa gang gi phyir // gang gi rang bzhin 'jig med pa //
translated: But that also has a fault, because:🔽The wise say that that which has an indestructible nature

original: de la mkhas rnams rtag ces brjod //
analyzed: de la mkhas rnams rtag ces brjod //
translated: is permanent.

original: des na ngo tsha'i lta ba 'di //🔽spangs te de ni rtag par brjod //
analyzed: des na ngo tsha'i lta ba 'di // spangs te de ni rtag par brjod //
translated: Therefore, abandoning this view of shame,🔽it is said to be permanent.

original: 'jig pa yang yin pa la rtag pa yang yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni 'gal lo //
analyzed: 'jig pa yang yin pa la rtag pa yang yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni 'gal lo //
translated: It is contradictory to say that something is both destroyed and permanent.

original: gang gi phyir 'jig pa med pa de ni rtag pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'jig pa med pa de ni rtag pa yin te /
translated: Because that which is not destroyed is permanent.

original: zhig pa dang mi dmigs pa dang med pa zhes bya ba ni don gcig yin la /
analyzed: zhig pa dang mi dmigs pa dang med pa zhes bya ba ni don gcig yin la /
translated: Destroyed, not perceived, and nonexistent are synonyms.

original: mi 'jig pa dang rtag pa dang / dmigs pa zhes bya ba yang don gcig yin par grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi 'jig pa dang rtag pa dang / dmigs pa zhes bya ba yang don gcig yin par grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: And it would be established that “non-destruction” and “permanence” have the same meaning.

original: des na rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dag gcig nyid yin zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: des na rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dag gcig nyid yin zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Therefore, “permanence” and “impermanence” are one,

original: dmigs pa dang mi dmigs pa dag yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dmigs pa dang mi dmigs pa dag yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: which means that “apprehended” and “non-apprehended” are one.

original: dmigs pa dang mi dmigs pa dag kyang ci ltar gcig tu 'gyur /
analyzed: dmigs pa dang mi dmigs pa dag kyang ci ltar gcig tu 'gyur /
translated: How could “apprehended” and “non-apprehended” be one?

original: gcig nyid du ni rtog pa gang //
analyzed: gcig nyid du ni rtog pa gang //
translated: The one who conceives of them as one

original: de ni gcig ces bya bar gnas //
analyzed: de ni gcig ces bya bar gnas //
translated: is one who is situated in the one.

original: gal te ma rtogs rtogs yin na //
analyzed: gal te ma rtogs rtogs yin na //
translated: If non-apprehension is apprehension,

original: 'di ni ha cang bab col yin //
analyzed: 'di ni ha cang bab col yin //
translated: this is a very foolish assertion.

original: gal te rtag pa dang mi rtag pa nyid gcig yin na de'i tshe rtogs pa dang ma rtogs pa gcig yin no zhes bya bar thal bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: gal te rtag pa dang mi rtag pa nyid gcig yin na de'i tshe rtogs pa dang ma rtogs pa gcig yin no zhes bya bar thal bar 'gyur la /
translated: If permanence and impermanence are one, then it follows that apprehension and non-apprehension are one.

original: de ltar na yang 'brel pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na yang 'brel pa yin no //
translated: In that case, there would be a connection.

original: rtogs pa 'di gzhan du gcig par rtogs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rtogs pa 'di gzhan du gcig par rtogs pa ma yin te /
translated: This apprehension is not conceived as one in another,

original: ma rtogs pa nyid ni rtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ma rtogs pa nyid ni rtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: and non-apprehension is not apprehension.

original: ri bong gi rva ma rtogs pa ni rtogs pa 'ga' zhig dang lhan cig gcig nyid du nges par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ri bong gi rva ma rtogs pa ni rtogs pa 'ga' zhig dang lhan cig gcig nyid du nges par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: The non-apprehension of the rabbit’s horns is not able to be ascertained as the same as some apprehension.

original: de la gcig rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de la gcig rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is because there is no apprehension of the one,

original: 'dir yang ma rtogs pa ni ma rtogs pa nyid du gdon mi za'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang ma rtogs pa ni ma rtogs pa nyid du gdon mi za'o //
translated: then in this case, too, the non-apprehension is certainly non-apprehension.

original: gang zhig gcig nyid du rtogs pa de ni /
analyzed: gang zhig gcig nyid du rtogs pa de ni /
translated: And that which is apprehended as one

original: rtogs pa nyid de zhig pa ma yin zhing skye ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: rtogs pa nyid de zhig pa ma yin zhing skye ba yang ma yin no //
translated: is not destroyed by the apprehension, nor is it produced.

original: 'on te gzhan rtogs pa ma rtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on te gzhan rtogs pa ma rtogs pa yin te /
translated: But if the apprehension of the other is non-apprehension,

original: des na ma rtogs pa ni rtogs pa ma yin no //🔽de las gzhan pa'i rang bzhin rtogs pa nyid de ma rtogs so zhe na /
analyzed: des na ma rtogs pa ni rtogs pa ma yin no // de las gzhan pa'i rang bzhin rtogs pa nyid de ma rtogs so zhe na /
translated: then the non-apprehension is not the apprehension.🔽If you say that the apprehension of the nature of the other is the non-apprehension,

original: de lta na 'o na gzhan gyi rang bzhin gang yin pa de nyid las de med do zhes bya ba thob par 'gyur na /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na gzhan gyi rang bzhin gang yin pa de nyid las de med do zhes bya ba thob par 'gyur na /
translated: then in that case, it follows that the other does not exist.

original: de yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de yang mi rung ngo //
translated: But that is unacceptable.🔽Thus:

original: 'di ltar / gzhan ba nyid du shes pa ni //🔽ji @132b ltar gzhan ma yin par brjod //
analyzed: 'di ltar / gzhan ba nyid du shes pa ni // ji @132b ltar gzhan ma yin par brjod //
translated: How can the cognition of difference🔽be said to be the non-difference?

original: de ni gzhan nyid ma yin na //
analyzed: de ni gzhan nyid ma yin na //
translated: If it is not different,

original: de ltar mi rtag 'grub mi 'gyur //
analyzed: de ltar mi rtag 'grub mi 'gyur //
translated: Thus impermanence would not be established.

original: gzhan nyid na ni mi dmigs 'gyur //
analyzed: gzhan nyid na ni mi dmigs 'gyur //
translated: If they were different, it would not be observed.

original: ma dmigs na ni mi rtag nyid //
analyzed: ma dmigs na ni mi rtag nyid //
translated: If it is not observed, it is not impermanent.

original: gzhan min nyid ni mi 'gyur la //
analyzed: gzhan min nyid ni mi 'gyur la //
translated: If they were not different, it would not change.

original: dmigs pa nyid na rtag pa nyid //
analyzed: dmigs pa nyid na rtag pa nyid //
translated: If it is observed, it is permanent.

original: de ni rang bzhin 'ga' zhig gis //
analyzed: de ni rang bzhin 'ga' zhig gis //
translated: It is not observed by any nature.

original: mi dmigs gzhan gyi gzhan yin na //🔽rang bzhin gang gi rigs min pa //
analyzed: mi dmigs gzhan gyi gzhan yin na // rang bzhin gang gi rigs min pa //
translated: If it is different from another,

original: de ni 'di zhes ji ltar 'dod //🔽snga ma nyid du de nyid ni //
analyzed: de ni 'di zhes ji ltar 'dod // snga ma nyid du de nyid ni //
translated: How can it be said to be this?🔽It is just as before.

original: de lta snga ma nyid 'gyur gyi //
analyzed: de lta snga ma nyid 'gyur gyi //
translated: In that case, it would be just as before.

original: de lta de 'di'i rang bzhin 'di //
analyzed: de lta de 'di'i rang bzhin 'di //
translated: In that case, it is not the nature of this.🔽How can it be the same?

original: min phyir ji ltar gcig nyid yin //
analyzed: min phyir ji ltar gcig nyid yin //
translated: If it is the same because it is not separate

original: snga phyi'i rang bzhin dag dang ni //🔽ma bral phyir na gcig yin na ;
analyzed: snga phyi'i rang bzhin dag dang ni // ma bral phyir na gcig yin na ;
translated: From the natures of the past and future,

original: / bral ba nyid du mthong bzhin du'ang //
analyzed: / bral ba nyid du mthong bzhin du'ang //
translated: Then, even though it is seen to be separate,

original: bral ba min par ji ltar 'dod //
analyzed: bral ba min par ji ltar 'dod //
translated: How can it be said not to be separate?

original: gal te rim gyis 'bral min na //
analyzed: gal te rim gyis 'bral min na //
translated: If it is not gradually separated,

original: de bzhin du ni bral ba yang //🔽bral dang ma bral de nyid kyi //
analyzed: de bzhin du ni bral ba yang // bral dang ma bral de nyid kyi //
translated: In the same way, it is not separated.🔽Because of the nature of separation and non-separation,

original: phyir na gnyi ga'i rang bzhin ni //
analyzed: phyir na gnyi ga'i rang bzhin ni //
translated: The nature of both

original: ji ltar cig car 'di yod pa //
analyzed: ji ltar cig car 'di yod pa //
translated: Just as it exists in one moment,

original: de bzhin nyid du de mthong 'gyur //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid du de mthong 'gyur //
translated: so it is seen in that way.

original: rim min pa yi yod pa ni //
analyzed: rim min pa yi yod pa ni //
translated: Existence that is not sequential

original: rim ldan dngos po la ma yin //
analyzed: rim ldan dngos po la ma yin //
translated: is not in things that are sequential.🔽If the nature of earlier and later

original: snga phyi'i rang bzhin ma rtogs na //
analyzed: snga phyi'i rang bzhin ma rtogs na //
translated: is not understood,

original: khyab pa nyid du 'dod ma yin //
analyzed: khyab pa nyid du 'dod ma yin //
translated: pervasiveness is not accepted.

original: rim gyis khyab pa nyid na ni //
analyzed: rim gyis khyab pa nyid na ni //
translated: If there is pervasion through sequence,

original: de nyid khyab par 'gyur ma yin //
analyzed: de nyid khyab par 'gyur ma yin //
translated: that itself is not pervasion.🔽It is not tenable that that one

original: gcig po de ni mthong ba dang // ma mthong bar ni 'thad ma yin //
analyzed: gcig po de ni mthong ba dang // ma mthong bar ni 'thad ma yin //
translated: is both seen and not seen.🔽Then it is difficult for that itself

original: de tshe nyid de mthong ba dang // ma mthong bar ni 'thad par dka' //
analyzed: de tshe nyid de mthong ba dang // ma mthong bar ni 'thad par dka' //
translated: to be both seen and not seen.

original: dus kyis dbye ba thams cad kyang //
analyzed: dus kyis dbye ba thams cad kyang //
translated: All divisions of time

original: mi 'grigs pa ni med par mthong //
analyzed: mi 'grigs pa ni med par mthong //
translated: are seen to be without contradiction.

original: gcig phyir 'di ni gcig tshe nyid //
analyzed: gcig phyir 'di ni gcig tshe nyid //
translated: Because of being one, it is at that very time;

original: dus tha dad par ji ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: dus tha dad par ji ltar 'gyur //
translated: how could it be a different time?

original: yang nas yang du 'dzin na ni //
analyzed: yang nas yang du 'dzin na ni //
translated: If it is apprehended again and again,

original: gzung zin pa nyid 'dzin par 'gyur //
analyzed: gzung zin pa nyid 'dzin par 'gyur //
translated: that which is already apprehended would be apprehended.

original: gzung ngo zhes byar 'dzin pa gang //
analyzed: gzung ngo zhes byar 'dzin pa gang //
translated: That which is apprehended as “apprehended”

original: de ni dran par 'gyur ba yin //
analyzed: de ni dran par 'gyur ba yin //
translated: would be memory.

original: dran pa tshad ma ma yin phyir //
analyzed: dran pa tshad ma ma yin phyir //
translated: Because memory is not valid cognition,

original: rim 'dzin pa ni srid ma yin //
analyzed: rim 'dzin pa ni srid ma yin //
translated: It is impossible to apprehend them sequentially.

original: gang gis mngon sum nyid 'gyur ba //
analyzed: gang gis mngon sum nyid 'gyur ba //
translated: If they are not apprehended by a prior cognition,

original: ma rtogs pa ni de dngos min //
analyzed: ma rtogs pa ni de dngos min //
translated: Then they are not its objects.

original: gal te de tshe yod pa nyid //
analyzed: gal te de tshe yod pa nyid //
translated: If they exist at that time,

original: sngar gyi blo yis ma rtogs par //
analyzed: sngar gyi blo yis ma rtogs par //
translated: Then they are not apprehended by the prior cognition.

original: tha dad med phyir ci ltar de'i //
analyzed: tha dad med phyir ci ltar de'i //
translated: If they are not different, how can

original: rnam dbye 'di ni tshad ldan yin //🔽gal te de la mthong zin nyid //
analyzed: rnam dbye 'di ni tshad ldan yin // gal te de la mthong zin nyid //
translated: This distinction be valid?🔽If it is the same one that was seen before,

original: med phyir kun tshe da ltar ni //🔽de yi snga ma phyi ma yi //
analyzed: med phyir kun tshe da ltar ni // de yi snga ma phyi ma yi //
translated: Then at all times it would be seen.🔽By what means is the prior or subsequent

original: dngos po gang gis rtogs pa yin //
analyzed: dngos po gang gis rtogs pa yin //
translated: Entity of that one known?

original: snga phyi'i shes pa las she na //
analyzed: snga phyi'i shes pa las she na //
translated: If it is known by prior and subsequent cognitions,

original: de dag tha dad ga las rtogs //
analyzed: de dag tha dad ga las rtogs //
translated: How is their difference known?

original: gal te rang rig dngos las na //
analyzed: gal te rang rig dngos las na //
translated: If it is known by itself,

original: de la gnyis nyid rtogs mi 'gyur //🔽snga ma phyi ma med par ni //
analyzed: de la gnyis nyid rtogs mi 'gyur // snga ma phyi ma med par ni //
translated: Then its duality would not be known.
If it is not known by the prior or subsequent🔽Cognitions,

original: yis rtogs par 'gyur ba min //
analyzed: yis rtogs par 'gyur ba min //
translated: Then it is not known by anything.

original: gal te snga dang phyi ma yi //
analyzed: gal te snga dang phyi ma yi //
translated: If the prior and subsequent

original: myong ba de dag gcig yin na //
analyzed: myong ba de dag gcig yin na //
translated: Experiences are the same,

original: gcig na mngon du byas pas na //
analyzed: gcig na mngon du byas pas na //
translated: Then, since it is manifest,

original: ji ltar snga dang phyi mar 'gyur //
analyzed: ji ltar snga dang phyi mar 'gyur //
translated: How can it be prior or subsequent?

original: mngon du byas bzhin pa nyid ni //
analyzed: mngon du byas bzhin pa nyid ni //
translated: And that which is being actualized

original: sngon dang phyi mar 'gyur ma yin //
analyzed: sngon dang phyi mar 'gyur ma yin //
translated: Is not the prior or the subsequent.

original: gal te snga ma nyid min na //
analyzed: gal te snga ma nyid min na //
translated: If it is not the prior,

original: ji ltar snga ma nyid du rtogs //
analyzed: ji ltar snga ma nyid du rtogs //
translated: How is it known as the prior?

original: 'di rtogs med nyid rtogs de ni //
analyzed: 'di rtogs med nyid rtogs de ni //
translated: The realization of that which is not realized

original: mngon du byed pa nyid ma yin //
analyzed: mngon du byed pa nyid ma yin //
translated: Is not the actualization of it.

original: 'di de'i dran pa yin zhe na //🔽gang gi tshe de med par ni //
analyzed: 'di de'i dran pa yin zhe na // gang gi tshe de med par ni //
translated: If you say that this is its memory,🔽When it is seen that memory itself

original: dran pa nyid ni mthong 'gyur na //
analyzed: dran pa nyid ni mthong 'gyur na //
translated: Is absent at that time,

original: de yi zhes ni ji ltar brjod //🔽rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos las ni //
analyzed: de yi zhes ni ji ltar brjod // rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos las ni //
translated: How can it be said “its”?🔽The apprehension of the object

original: de tsam gyis ni 'dzin pa min //
analyzed: de tsam gyis ni 'dzin pa min //
translated: Is not by the mere cause and effect.

original: don ni mngon du byed pa nyid //
analyzed: don ni mngon du byed pa nyid //
translated: The actualization of the object

original: gzung yin bzlog pa las ma yin //🔽myong bas bar du chod pa'i phyir //
analyzed: gzung yin bzlog pa las ma yin // myong bas bar du chod pa'i phyir //
translated: Is the apprehension, not the opposite.

original: don las dran pa dngos su min //
analyzed: don las dran pa dngos su min //
translated: Memory is not directly of the object

original: myong ba snga ma de yis ni //
analyzed: myong ba snga ma de yis ni //
translated: Because it is interrupted by experience.🔽The prior experience does not apprehend

original: snga nyid 'dzin min phyi mas min //🔽des na dran pa nyid las ni //
analyzed: snga nyid 'dzin min phyi mas min // des na dran pa nyid las ni //
translated: The prior object, nor does the latter.🔽Therefore, the prior object

original: snga ma nyid du grub ma yin //🔽'das pa sngon du byas pa ni //
analyzed: snga ma nyid du grub ma yin // 'das pa sngon du byas pa ni //
translated: Is not established by memory itself.🔽The prior object that has passed

original: snga ma zhes ni bya bar brjod //
analyzed: snga ma zhes ni bya bar brjod //
translated: Is called the prior.

original: 'byung 'gyur dngos po mngon du ni //
analyzed: 'byung 'gyur dngos po mngon du ni //
translated: If it is the future that is produced,

original: byas na 'byung 'gyur shes byed gnas //🔽'on te skye 'jig bstan ldan pa //
analyzed: byas na 'byung 'gyur shes byed gnas // 'on te skye 'jig bstan ldan pa //
translated: then the cause of the future would be established.🔽But if it is maintained that

original: gang de yod ces 'dod na ni //🔽de rnams nyid ni yod mi 'gyur //
analyzed: gang de yod ces 'dod na ni // de rnams nyid ni yod mi 'gyur //
translated: what is taught as arising and ceasing exists,🔽then those things themselves would not exist,

original: de ye dngos dang mi ldan phyir //🔽gang tshe zhig pa de tshe de //
analyzed: de ye dngos dang mi ldan phyir // gang tshe zhig pa de tshe de //
translated: because they would not possess an entity.🔽When it ceases, how could it be

original: yod pa nyid du ji ltar rtogs //
analyzed: yod pa nyid du ji ltar rtogs //
translated: known as existent?

original: de sngar yod pa rtogs na ni //
analyzed: de sngar yod pa rtogs na ni //
translated: If it is known as existent prior to that,🔽how could it cease at that time?

original: de tshe de ni ji ltar zhig / brtan la gal te 'di blo 'di //
analyzed: de tshe de ni ji ltar zhig / brtan la gal te 'di blo 'di //
translated: If this cognition of permanence

original: med na ji ltar yod par rtogs //
analyzed: med na ji ltar yod par rtogs //
translated: does not exist, how could it be known as existent?

original: thams cad rtogs pa las yin te //
analyzed: thams cad rtogs pa las yin te //
translated: It is from the cognition of all things

original: des na gzhan du ji ltar yod //
analyzed: des na gzhan du ji ltar yod //
translated: that it exists in another way.

original: de phyir rtag dang mi rtag pa'i //
analyzed: de phyir rtag dang mi rtag pa'i //
translated: Therefore, permanent and impermanent

original: dngos po gar yang srid ma yin //
analyzed: dngos po gar yang srid ma yin //
translated: entities are not possible anywhere.

original: dngos rtag pa 'am dngos mi rtag //
analyzed: dngos rtag pa 'am dngos mi rtag //
translated: An entity that is permanent or impermanent

original: mtha' gcig nyid du srid pa yin //🔽da ni lam gyi zhar la /
analyzed: mtha' gcig nyid du srid pa yin // da ni lam gyi zhar la /
translated: is not possible in any way.

original: 'gog pa'i rnam pa bzhi pa nyid bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i rnam pa bzhi pa nyid bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: Now, in order to teach the fourth aspect of cessation, which is incidental to the path, it is said:

original: bshad zin lam de goms pa las //
analyzed: bshad zin lam de goms pa las //
translated: Through cultivating that path that has been explained,

original: gnas 'gyur gal te bdag 'gyur kyang //
analyzed: gnas 'gyur gal te bdag 'gyur kyang //
translated: If you say that the self is transformed,

original: lam bzhin skyon ni 'byung zhe na ;
analyzed: lam bzhin skyon ni 'byung zhe na ;
translated: like the path, the faults will arise.

original: / ma yin nus pa med phyir ro //🔽sngar bshad pa nyid kyis lam de goms pa las gnas sems kyi rgyun nam /
analyzed: / ma yin nus pa med phyir ro // sngar bshad pa nyid kyis lam de goms pa las gnas sems kyi rgyun nam /
translated: No, because of the absence of ability.

original: kun gzhi yongs su dag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: kun gzhi yongs su dag par 'gyur te /
translated: By the very explanation above, the path is cultivated, and the continuum of mind is transformed, or the foundation consciousness is completely purified.

original: bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa dang mi mthun pa bdag med pa de'i bdag tu gyur pa na nyes pa mtha' dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa dang mi mthun pa bdag med pa de'i bdag tu gyur pa na nyes pa mtha' dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When it becomes the self of the selflessness that is incompatible with the apprehension of the self and being mine, it becomes free from the extreme of faults.

original: gal @133b te ji ltar nyes pa dang ldan pa la /
analyzed: gal @133b te ji ltar nyes pa dang ldan pa la /
translated: If you say that just as the possessor of faults

original: yon tan ldan par 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: yon tan ldan par 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
translated: becomes the possessor of good qualities,

original: yon tan dang ldan pa yang nyes pa dang ldan par 'gyur ba'i phyir 'khor ba las nges par 'byung ba med do zhe na /
analyzed: yon tan dang ldan pa yang nyes pa dang ldan par 'gyur ba'i phyir 'khor ba las nges par 'byung ba med do zhe na /
translated: in the same way, the possessor of good qualities becomes the possessor of faults, and therefore there is no definite emergence from cyclic existence,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: nyes pa rnams yon tan yod pas bcom pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyes pa rnams yon tan yod pas bcom pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the faults are destroyed by the existence of good qualities.

original: bzlog pa ji ltar mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: bzlog pa ji ltar mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: How is it not the opposite?

original: yon tan rnams ni dngos po'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir dang / nyes pa rnams ni de las bzlog pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yon tan rnams ni dngos po'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir dang / nyes pa rnams ni de las bzlog pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the qualities are the nature of the thing, and the faults are the opposite of that.

original: de ci ltar zhe na bshad pa /
analyzed: de ci ltar zhe na bshad pa /
translated: How is that? It is explained:

original: rnam shes yul 'dzin pa yi chos //
analyzed: rnam shes yul 'dzin pa yi chos //
translated: The nature of consciousness is to apprehend objects.

original: ji ltar yod de 'dzin pa dang // yod pa yi ni bdag nyid de //
analyzed: ji ltar yod de 'dzin pa dang // yod pa yi ni bdag nyid de //
translated: It apprehends as it exists, and it is the nature of what exists.

original: 'di yi skyed par byed pa'ang yin //
analyzed: 'di yi skyed par byed pa'ang yin //
translated: It is also the producer of that.

original: rnam par shes pa ni skye ba rnams kyi lam 'jug par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni skye ba rnams kyi lam 'jug par byed pa yin no //
translated: Consciousness is the one that causes the entry of beings into the path.

original: gang gis rnam par shes par 'gyur ba de'i rang bzhin gyi chos ni yul 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gis rnam par shes par 'gyur ba de'i rang bzhin gyi chos ni yul 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: The nature of that which becomes consciousness is to apprehend objects.

original: rnam par shes pa ni rig pa ma yin par 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni rig pa ma yin par 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: Consciousness does not become non-awareness,

original: rig pa ma yin pa rnams la ni de lta bu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rig pa ma yin pa rnams la ni de lta bu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that does not exist for those who are non-aware.

original: ji ltar yod pa de ltar de //
analyzed: ji ltar yod pa de ltar de //
translated: As it exists, it is

original: gzung bar bya ba dang skyed par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gzung bar bya ba dang skyed par byed pa yin no //
translated: the object to be apprehended and the producer.

original: rnam par rtog par nus pa'i rgyu ni rnam par shes pa'i yul yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog par nus pa'i rgyu ni rnam par shes pa'i yul yin no //
translated: The object of consciousness is the cause of the ability to conceptualize.

original: des rnam par shes pa'i chos ni rang bzhin rtogs par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: des rnam par shes pa'i chos ni rang bzhin rtogs par byed pa yin la /
translated: The nature of consciousness is to understand,

original: yul gyi chos ni de kho na ltar rtogs par bya ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: yul gyi chos ni de kho na ltar rtogs par bya ba nyid yin no //
translated: and the nature of the object is to be understood as it is.

original: des ni yul ni mi rtag pa nyid dang bdag med pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin yin la /
analyzed: des ni yul ni mi rtag pa nyid dang bdag med pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin yin la /
translated: The object has the nature of impermanence, selflessness, and so on,🔽and the nature of consciousness is to apprehend it as it is.

original: de lta bu 'dzin pa nyid ni rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin yin gyi gzhan ni de'i rang bzhin ma yin no zhes bshad pa ni /
analyzed: de lta bu 'dzin pa nyid ni rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin yin gyi gzhan ni de'i rang bzhin ma yin no zhes bshad pa ni /
translated: This is its nature, not anything else.

original: rang bzhin 'di yin 'di las de //🔽rkyen gzhan gyis ni gol 'gyur zhing ;
analyzed: rang bzhin 'di yin 'di las de // rkyen gzhan gyis ni gol 'gyur zhing ;
translated: This is its nature, and it deviates🔽from that through other conditions.

original: / ldog pa la ni rkyen la ltos //
analyzed: / ldog pa la ni rkyen la ltos //
translated: Its reversal depends on conditions,

original: mi brten sprul gyi blo bzhin no //
analyzed: mi brten sprul gyi blo bzhin no //
translated: like the mind of a magical creation.

original: gang gi chos bdag med pa nyid la sogs pa 'dzin pa'i ngo bo gang yin pa de ni rang bzhin yin no //
analyzed: gang gi chos bdag med pa nyid la sogs pa 'dzin pa'i ngo bo gang yin pa de ni rang bzhin yin no //
translated: The nature of consciousness is to apprehend the selflessness of phenomena and so on.

original: de las gol ba ni glo bur ba'i rkyen rtsa ba med pa'i dbang gis yin zhing /
analyzed: de las gol ba ni glo bur ba'i rkyen rtsa ba med pa'i dbang gis yin zhing /
translated: It deviates from that through adventitious conditions, which are without root.

original: gol ba nyid kyang gol ba de las bzlog pa la rkyen la ltos pa yin no //
analyzed: gol ba nyid kyang gol ba de las bzlog pa la rkyen la ltos pa yin no //
translated: And the error itself is dependent on conditions that are the opposite of that error.

original: des na rtsa ba med pa can yin pa'i phyir mi brten te sbrul gyi blo bzhin no //
analyzed: des na rtsa ba med pa can yin pa'i phyir mi brten te sbrul gyi blo bzhin no //
translated: Therefore, because it is rootless, it is not firm, like the idea of a snake.

original: gal te thag pa la sbrul gyi blor 'gyur ba'i rgyu ni 'dra ba dang yul thag ring ba la sogs pa yin la /
analyzed: gal te thag pa la sbrul gyi blor 'gyur ba'i rgyu ni 'dra ba dang yul thag ring ba la sogs pa yin la /
translated: The cause of the idea of a snake in a rope is similarity, distance, etc.

original: rtag pa'i blo la rgyu ci zhig yod //
analyzed: rtag pa'i blo la rgyu ci zhig yod //
translated: What is the cause of the idea of permanence?

original: mngon sum ni rtag pa nyid la 'jug pa ma @134a * //🔽yin la / rjes su dpag pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum ni rtag pa nyid la 'jug pa ma @134a * // yin la / rjes su dpag pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Direct perception does not engage permanence,🔽and neither does inference.

original: tshad ma med par ni dogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: tshad ma med par ni dogs pa ma yin no //
translated: But it is not the case that there is no valid cognition.

original: mngon sum gyis ni skad cig ma nyid rtogs so zhes kyang bsgrub par nus te /
analyzed: mngon sum gyis ni skad cig ma nyid rtogs so zhes kyang bsgrub par nus te /
translated: It is also possible to prove that direct perception understands momentariness.

original: des na gang las rtag pa nyid 'dzin zhe na /
analyzed: des na gang las rtag pa nyid 'dzin zhe na /
translated: Therefore, from what is it that permanence is apprehended?

original: 'di la bshad pa /🔽mi rtag pa nyid de ni mthong bzhin du'ang /
analyzed: 'di la bshad pa / mi rtag pa nyid de ni mthong bzhin du'ang /
translated: The response to that is as follows.🔽While momentariness is seen,

original: blo zhe na yod pa dmigs pas rtag tu de ltar yod par dogs pas bslus pa'am /
analyzed: blo zhe na yod pa dmigs pas rtag tu de ltar yod par dogs pas bslus pa'am /
translated: the mind is deceived by the apprehension of the existence of what is not there, and it doubts that it exists in that way permanently.

original: 'dra ba gzhan 'byung bas bslus pas mi rtogs te /
analyzed: 'dra ba gzhan 'byung bas bslus pas mi rtogs te /
translated: One does not understand that the object is deceptive because of the appearance of another similar object.

original: skad cig ma tha ma mthong ba rnams la nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig ma tha ma mthong ba rnams la nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But one does understand it when one sees the final moment of the object.

original: 'di skad brjod par 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod par 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: One should say the following:

original: gang gi tshe ji srid du don gyi bdag nyid dmigs pas phyis ma dmigs pa de'i tshe mi rtag pa nyid mthong ba nyid de /
analyzed: gang gi tshe ji srid du don gyi bdag nyid dmigs pas phyis ma dmigs pa de'i tshe mi rtag pa nyid mthong ba nyid de /
translated: When one does not perceive the object’s own nature at a later time because one perceived it at an earlier time, then one sees impermanence.

original: de'i gnas skabs ma yin pa nyid ni mi rtag pa nyid du brjod do //
analyzed: de'i gnas skabs ma yin pa nyid ni mi rtag pa nyid du brjod do //
translated: The state of the object that is not that state is called impermanence.

original: 'on kyang ma dmigs su zin kyang blo zhan pa dogs pa dang mi bral te /
analyzed: 'on kyang ma dmigs su zin kyang blo zhan pa dogs pa dang mi bral te /
translated: But even though one does not perceive the object, the weak-minded are not free from doubt.

original: des na de ltar yod par dogs pa yin pas na de ltar yod par dogs pa ste /
analyzed: des na de ltar yod par dogs pa yin pas na de ltar yod par dogs pa ste /
translated: Therefore, one doubts that it exists in that way.

original: ci snga ma de nyid da ltar yang yod dam ma yin zhes dogs pa'o //🔽des na phyis mthong ba las don bya ba thob pa'i phyir ma bslus pas na mi rtogs so //
analyzed: ci snga ma de nyid da ltar yang yod dam ma yin zhes dogs pa'o // des na phyis mthong ba las don bya ba thob pa'i phyir ma bslus pas na mi rtogs so //
translated: One doubts that it exists in that way, thinking, “Is it the same as before or not?”🔽Therefore, one does not understand that the object is deceptive because one obtains the object’s function later from seeing it.

original: de ma thob pa'i phyir bslus pa ni rtogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ma thob pa'i phyir bslus pa ni rtogs par 'gyur te /
translated: One does understand that the object is deceptive because one does not obtain the object’s function.

original: chags pa'i bum pa bzhin no //
analyzed: chags pa'i bum pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like a pot that is broken.

original: don byed pa'i mtshan nyid yod pa dmigs na tha snyad par bzlog par sems pa'i skabs ci yod /
analyzed: don byed pa'i mtshan nyid yod pa dmigs na tha snyad par bzlog par sems pa'i skabs ci yod /
translated: If the characteristic of a functional thing exists and is perceived, what occasion is there for the conventionalist to think that he is refuted?

original: de kho na sems par byed pa dag ni snang ba tha dad pas nges par byed pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de kho na sems par byed pa dag ni snang ba tha dad pas nges par byed pa kho na'o //
translated: Those who think about reality are certain that the appearances are different.

original: tha snyad pa don byed pa don du gnyer ba ni /
analyzed: tha snyad pa don byed pa don du gnyer ba ni /
translated: The conventionalist who seeks a functional thing

original: de thob pas yongs su tshim pa'i phyir gzhan rnam par dpyod pa mi byed do //
analyzed: de thob pas yongs su tshim pa'i phyir gzhan rnam par dpyod pa mi byed do //
translated: is satisfied with obtaining it, and does not analyze further.

original: don byas zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don byas zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the function has been performed.

original: yang na 'dra ba gzhan 'byung bas bslus pa de /
analyzed: yang na 'dra ba gzhan 'byung bas bslus pa de /
translated: Or else, he is deceived by the appearance of another similar thing,

original: 'dra ba la ni de nyid 'di yin no snyam pa'i blor 'gyur ba yin te mtshe ma dang sgro pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'dra ba la ni de nyid 'di yin no snyam pa'i blor 'gyur ba yin te mtshe ma dang sgro pa bzhin no //
translated: and thinks that it is the same thing as before, just as one thinks that a twin or a ventriloquist is the other person.🔽In the former case, the object is the fire that arises as the object of the conception of a single fire that is born from this or that other fuel, such as grass.

original: snga mar ni gang las rtsva la sogs pa gzhan dang gzhan las skyes pa'i me gcig nyid du lhag par zhen pa'i yul du 'byung ba de'i don byed pa la ma bslus pa tsam brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: snga mar ni gang las rtsva la sogs pa gzhan dang gzhan las skyes pa'i me gcig nyid du lhag par zhen pa'i yul du 'byung ba de'i don byed pa la ma bslus pa tsam brjod pa yin no //
translated: The meaning is that it is not deceptive with regard to the performance of its function.

original: de la nye bar len pa ni bud shing nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: de la nye bar len pa ni bud shing nyid yin gyi /
translated: The fuel is the fire’s appropriation.

original: me ni ma yin no //
analyzed: me ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not fire.

original: me las ma skyes pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: me las ma skyes pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it produced from something that is not fire.

original: dang po me mi skye bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /🔽me rdo dang brdabs pa'i sngon rol na ma @134b * //
analyzed: dang po me mi skye bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te / me rdo dang brdabs pa'i sngon rol na ma @134b * //
translated: For then it would follow, absurdly, that fire could be produced without a cause,

original: med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because prior to the striking together of the two pieces of wood there is no fire.

original: yang na med de nyid las skye'o //
analyzed: yang na med de nyid las skye'o //
translated: Or else it would be produced from that which is not fire.

original: de bzhin du don thams cad rigs mthun pa snga ma las skye ba 'am /
analyzed: de bzhin du don thams cad rigs mthun pa snga ma las skye ba 'am /
translated: In the same way, all objects are produced either from that which is of a homogeneous kind or from that which is not.

original: rigs mi mthun pa las skye ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rigs mi mthun pa las skye ba ni ma yin te /
translated: But they are not produced from that which is of a homogeneous kind,

original: las bdag po gyur pa las skye ba yin no //
analyzed: las bdag po gyur pa las skye ba yin no //
translated: but rather from that which is the dominant condition of the action.

original: de nyid kyi phyir don 'di la ltos te 'am zhes phyogs gzhan brtag pa mdzad do ;
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir don 'di la ltos te 'am zhes phyogs gzhan brtag pa mdzad do ;
translated: Therefore, in this context, the word “or” should be taken to mean “if.

original: / de yang las smra ba'i 'don pas ni snga ma bshad pa yin la /
analyzed: / de yang las smra ba'i 'don pas ni snga ma bshad pa yin la /
translated: ” Moreover, the first alternative is explained by the Vaibhāṣika,

original: gzhan gyi 'dod pa ni phyi ma bzhin no zhes gor ma chag go //
analyzed: gzhan gyi 'dod pa ni phyi ma bzhin no zhes gor ma chag go //
translated: and the second by the opponent.

original: yang na de ltar yod pa la dogs pa med pas bslus zhes bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: yang na de ltar yod pa la dogs pa med pas bslus zhes bshad par bya ste /
translated: Or else, since there is no doubt that it exists in this way, it should be explained that it is deceived.

original: de ltar yod pa la ni dogs pa 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: de ltar yod pa la ni dogs pa 'ga' yang med do //
translated: For there is no doubt that it exists in this way.

original: rtag tu yod pa dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag tu yod pa dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is always perceived as existent.

original: mi dmigs na ni de ltar yod pa la dogs par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: mi dmigs na ni de ltar yod pa la dogs par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: If it were not perceived, then it would be doubted that it exists in that way.

original: gang gi tshe rab tu ma dmigs pa de'i tshe tshul ji ltar gnas she na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rab tu ma dmigs pa de'i tshe tshul ji ltar gnas she na /
translated: When it is not perceived, how can it exist in that way?

original: der yang 'dra ba gzhan dang gzhan 'byung ba las bslus pas te /
analyzed: der yang 'dra ba gzhan dang gzhan 'byung ba las bslus pas te /
translated: Because it is deceived by the arising of other similar moments.

original: bregs pa las yang skyes pa'i skra dang sen mo la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: bregs pa las yang skyes pa'i skra dang sen mo la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like the hair and nails that grow again after they have been cut.

original: zhig pa ngo shes pa'i phyir gcig nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: zhig pa ngo shes pa'i phyir gcig nyid do zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is the same because of the recognition of the destroyed,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: no, it is not so.

original: ngo shes pa tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ngo shes pa tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because recognition is not valid knowledge,

original: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa nyid mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa nyid mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because direct perception and inference are not valid.

original: de ltar yang 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar yang 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: This will be explained.

original: de'i phyir nang gi ma rig pa'i bslad pa las dri ma rnams ni glo bur ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir nang gi ma rig pa'i bslad pa las dri ma rnams ni glo bur ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, the defilements are adventitious because of the internal defilement of ignorance.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bshad pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: sems 'di'i rang bzhin 'od gsal te /
analyzed: sems 'di'i rang bzhin 'od gsal te /
translated: The nature of this mind is clear light,

original: rtag pa nyid dang bral ba nyid des 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa nyid dang bral ba nyid des 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is always free from the nature of permanence.

original: dri ma rnams ni glo bur ba //
analyzed: dri ma rnams ni glo bur ba //
translated: The defilements are adventitious.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa sgro 'dogs pa ni /
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa sgro 'dogs pa ni /
translated: The false superimposition is

original: rtsa ba med pa can nyid kyis glen pa tsam du zad pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtsa ba med pa can nyid kyis glen pa tsam du zad pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: just a kind of foolishness, since it is rootless.

original: 'don dam pa ni rtag pa nyid 'gar yang snang ba med de /
analyzed: 'don dam pa ni rtag pa nyid 'gar yang snang ba med de /
translated: The highest truth is never seen anywhere as permanent.

original: des na rnam pa dpyad pas stong pa'i phyir dri ma rnams ni glo bur ba yin no //
analyzed: des na rnam pa dpyad pas stong pa'i phyir dri ma rnams ni glo bur ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, since the aspects are examined and found to be empty, the defilements are adventitious.

original: de yi phyir yang nus med na //
analyzed: de yi phyir yang nus med na //
translated: Therefore, since they are powerless,

original: de bdag 'gyur la phyis nus min //
analyzed: de bdag 'gyur la phyis nus min //
translated: they cannot be the self of the person.

original: sngar thos bsam gyi dus na yang nus pa med pa nyid do //
analyzed: sngar thos bsam gyi dus na yang nus pa med pa nyid do //
translated: They are powerless even at the time of hearing and reflection.

original: 'di ltar / nus pa yod na yang gnod pa can //
analyzed: 'di ltar / nus pa yod na yang gnod pa can //
translated: Thus, if they were powerful,

original: skyes nus snying po can dngos la //
analyzed: skyes nus snying po can dngos la //
translated: they would be born with an essence that is powerful.

original: yun du gnas nus yod min te //
analyzed: yun du gnas nus yod min te //
translated: But they cannot endure for a long time,

original: sa rlon la ni me bzhin no //
analyzed: sa rlon la ni me bzhin no //
translated: like a fire on wet fuel.

original: gal te dad pa la sogs pa zhen pa'i dgra bcom pa yang /
analyzed: gal te dad pa la sogs pa zhen pa'i dgra bcom pa yang /
translated: If the arhats who are attached to faith and so on

original: dgra bcom pa nyid las nyams par 'gyur ba ni ma yin nam /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid las nyams par 'gyur ba ni ma yin nam /
translated: do not fall from their state of arhatship,

original: des na ji ltar skyon rnams mi skye @135a * //🔽ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: des na ji ltar skyon rnams mi skye @135a * //🔽ba yin zhe na /
translated: then how can they not give rise to faults?

original: gal te skyon rnams skye ba yin pa de lta na yang /
analyzed: gal te skyon rnams skye ba yin pa de lta na yang /
translated: Even if faults are produced,

original: gnod par byed pa bskyed par nus pa de nang du chud pa la /
analyzed: gnod par byed pa bskyed par nus pa de nang du chud pa la /
translated: when one is occupied with the ability to produce the harm,

original: skyed par nus su zin yang nyes pa gtan chags par byed nus pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: skyed par nus su zin yang nyes pa gtan chags par byed nus pa ni ma yin te /
translated: even if one is able to produce it, one is not able to establish the fault.

original: dper na chu 'dzag pa'i sa las me skyes su zin kyang yun du mi gnas pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na chu 'dzag pa'i sa las me skyes su zin kyang yun du mi gnas pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, even if fire is produced from earth that is wet with water, it does not last long.

original: de'i bdag nyid du gnas pa la ni nyes pa skye ba yang ma yin te 'di ltar /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid du gnas pa la ni nyes pa skye ba yang ma yin te 'di ltar /
translated: Nor is the fault produced in one who abides in the nature of that, because:

original: 'tshe ba med dang yang dag don //
analyzed: 'tshe ba med dang yang dag don //
translated: Nonviolence and the true meaning🔽are not averted by error

original: rang bzhin la ni phyin log gis //
analyzed: rang bzhin la ni phyin log gis //
translated: with regard to the nature,

original: 'bad du zin kyang mi bzlog ste //
analyzed: 'bad du zin kyang mi bzlog ste //
translated: even if one tries,

original: blo ni de phyogs 'dzin phyir ro //
analyzed: blo ni de phyogs 'dzin phyir ro //
translated: because the mind grasps that side.

original: rang bzhin ni 'bad pa med par bzlog nus pa ma yin no //🔽'bad pa yang yon tan dag la skyon mthong ba'am /
analyzed: rang bzhin ni 'bad pa med par bzlog nus pa ma yin no // 'bad pa yang yon tan dag la skyon mthong ba'am /
translated: The nature cannot be averted without effort.🔽And effort is engaged in seeing faults in virtues

original: skyon la yon tan mthong ba la 'jug pa yin na /
analyzed: skyon la yon tan mthong ba la 'jug pa yin na /
translated: or seeing virtues in faults.

original: bdag med pa de'i bdag nyid du 'gyur ba mthong ba ni yon tan dag la skyon du mthong ba dang / skyon la yon tan mthong ba las ma yin la /
analyzed: bdag med pa de'i bdag nyid du 'gyur ba mthong ba ni yon tan dag la skyon du mthong ba dang / skyon la yon tan mthong ba las ma yin la /
translated: It is not that one sees the selflessness of the person as a fault in the virtues, or that one sees a virtue in a fault.

original: yon tan dag la yon tan ma mthong ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: yon tan dag la yon tan ma mthong ba yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it that one does not see the virtues as virtues.

original: bdag med par mthong ba ni 'tshe ba med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag med par mthong ba ni 'tshe ba med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For the vision of selflessness is nonviolence.

original: de yi rang bzhin yang dag gi / bdag nyid 'tshe ba med par ni //
analyzed: de yi rang bzhin yang dag gi / bdag nyid 'tshe ba med par ni //
translated: The nature of that is the selflessness🔽of the person, which is the absence of violence.

original: sems dang ldan pas ji ltar na //
analyzed: sems dang ldan pas ji ltar na //
translated: How can one who has this

original: yongs su 'dor bar nus ma yin //🔽sems ni phyogs su ltung bas na //
analyzed: yongs su 'dor bar nus ma yin // sems ni phyogs su ltung bas na //
translated: ever abandon it?🔽The mind does not engage in faults

original: nyes pa rnams la 'jug ma yin //🔽des na de ni nyes pa la//
analyzed: nyes pa rnams la 'jug ma yin // des na de ni nyes pa la//
translated: because it has fallen into a position.🔽Therefore, it does not engage in any

original: 'bad pa 'ga' yang 'jug pa min //
analyzed: 'bad pa 'ga' yang 'jug pa min //
translated: effort with regard to faults.

original: dngos pos ma lus pa'i rang bzhin rtogs par nus pa la ni gal te nyes pa 'byung du zin yang /
analyzed: dngos pos ma lus pa'i rang bzhin rtogs par nus pa la ni gal te nyes pa 'byung du zin yang /
translated: One who is able to realize the nature of all things, even if faults should arise,

original: de lta na yang 'di 'gron po las grogs bzang po dang bral ba bzhin du /
analyzed: de lta na yang 'di 'gron po las grogs bzang po dang bral ba bzhin du /
translated: is like a traveler who has lost a good companion.

original: bar ma do'i gnas skabs na gnas pa 'di shugs dang ldan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bar ma do'i gnas skabs na gnas pa 'di shugs dang ldan pa'i phyir /
translated: Because this being in the intermediate state is powerful,

original: lam nyid dang 'bad pa rtsom ste /🔽yon tan phyogs 'dzin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: lam nyid dang 'bad pa rtsom ste / yon tan phyogs 'dzin pa'i phyir /
translated: he strives to create the path.

original: nyes pa la dga' ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nyes pa la dga' ba ni ma yin no //
translated: He is not attracted to faults,🔽because he is attracted to the side of virtue.

original: gal te 'dod chags dang zhe sdang gi rnam pa mi mthun pa yin yang /
analyzed: gal te 'dod chags dang zhe sdang gi rnam pa mi mthun pa yin yang /
translated: Even though the forms of attachment and aversion are not the same,

original: gcig nyid gnod par byed pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gcig nyid gnod par byed pa ni ma yin te /
translated: one does not harm the other.

original: zhe sdang gis gnod par byas pa'i 'dod chags phyis kyang gnod byed nyid du mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhe sdang gis gnod par byas pa'i 'dod chags phyis kyang gnod byed nyid du mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because attachment, harmed by aversion, is later seen to be harmful.

original: de bzhin du zhe sdang yang yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhe sdang yang yin no //
translated: The same is true of aversion.

original: bdag med pa dang bdag tu lta ba yang /
analyzed: bdag med pa dang bdag tu lta ba yang /
translated: The view of self and selflessness

original: de bzhin du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: would be the same.

original: da ni ma yin te /
analyzed: da ni ma yin te /
translated: But that is not so,🔽because the view of self and selflessness

original: 'di ltar / bdag 'dzin rgyu gcig can nyid dang // rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po'i phyir //
analyzed: 'di ltar / bdag 'dzin rgyu gcig can nyid dang // rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po'i phyir //
translated: have the same cause and are mutually exclusive.🔽Attachment and aversion, even though different,

original: 'dod chags khong khro phan tshun dag / tha dad na @135b yang gnod ma yin //
analyzed: 'dod chags khong khro phan tshun dag / tha dad na @135b yang gnod ma yin //
translated: do not harm each other.

original: gnyi ga yang bdag tu 'dzin pa'i rgyu can yin pa'i phyir phan tshun mi mthun pa yin yang bdag tu 'dzin pa yod na gcig kyang gtan chad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gnyi ga yang bdag tu 'dzin pa'i rgyu can yin pa'i phyir phan tshun mi mthun pa yin yang bdag tu 'dzin pa yod na gcig kyang gtan chad pa ma yin te /
translated: Because both are caused by the grasping of self, they are mutually incompatible. But when the grasping of self exists, neither is completely eliminated.

original: cig car mi skye bar ni 'gyur ro //
analyzed: cig car mi skye bar ni 'gyur ro //
translated: They do not arise simultaneously.

original: gzhan yang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, they are the cause and effect of each other.

original: gang zhig sdug bsngal gyi rgyu gang la dbugs 'byung bas de gdungs par 'gyur ba de /
analyzed: gang zhig sdug bsngal gyi rgyu gang la dbugs 'byung bas de gdungs par 'gyur ba de /
translated: One who is tormented by the cause of suffering, through the exhalation of breath,

original: de'ang gzhan dag la bde ba'i rgyu 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: de'ang gzhan dag la bde ba'i rgyu 'dod pa yin no //
translated: wishes for the cause of happiness in others.

original: des na 'di dag ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yin no //
analyzed: des na 'di dag ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yin no //
translated: Therefore, they are the cause and effect of each other.

original: dpe pa'i rgyur phan pa nyams su myong ba yang nges par de la gnod par byed pa la khong khro ba dang ldan par 'gyur te ;
analyzed: dpe pa'i rgyur phan pa nyams su myong ba yang nges par de la gnod par byed pa la khong khro ba dang ldan par 'gyur te ;
translated: One who has experienced benefit as a cause, certainly becomes angry at harm to that person.

original: des na 'dod chags dang khong khro dag ni tha dad pa yin yang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yin pa'i phyir gnod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na 'dod chags dang khong khro dag ni tha dad pa yin yang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yin pa'i phyir gnod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, although attachment and anger are different, they are not incompatible because they are the cause and effect of each other.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For this very reason,

original: byams sogs rmongs dang 'gal med phyir //
analyzed: byams sogs rmongs dang 'gal med phyir //
translated: Because love and so on are not incompatible with delusion,

original: shin tu nyes pa tshar gcod min //
analyzed: shin tu nyes pa tshar gcod min //
translated: they do not completely eliminate faults.

original: nyes kun de yi rtsa ba can //
analyzed: nyes kun de yi rtsa ba can //
translated: All faults have delusion as their root,

original: de yang 'jig tshogs lta ba yin //
analyzed: de yang 'jig tshogs lta ba yin //
translated: and delusion is the view of the transitory collection.

original: gal te zhe sdang gi gnyen po byams pa /
analyzed: gal te zhe sdang gi gnyen po byams pa /
translated: If love is the antidote to hatred,

original: 'dod chags kyi gnyen po mi sdug pa /
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi gnyen po mi sdug pa /
translated: the unattractive to desire,

original: rnam par 'tshe ba'i gnyen po snying rje /
analyzed: rnam par 'tshe ba'i gnyen po snying rje /
translated: compassion to violence,

original: phrag dog gi gnyen po dga' ba /
analyzed: phrag dog gi gnyen po dga' ba /
translated: joy to jealousy,

original: thams cad kyi gnyen po btang snyoms yin pa de lta na yang /
analyzed: thams cad kyi gnyen po btang snyoms yin pa de lta na yang /
translated: and equanimity to all,

original: shin tu nyes pa tshar gcod par byed pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: shin tu nyes pa tshar gcod par byed pa ni ma yin te /
translated: then they do not completely eliminate faults,

original: gti mug dang mi 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gti mug dang mi 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are not incompatible with delusion.

original: gal te gti mug yod kyang /
analyzed: gal te gti mug yod kyang /
translated: If delusion exists,

original: bdag tu 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir nyes pa thams cad spong ba nyid ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: bdag tu 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir nyes pa thams cad spong ba nyid ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: then how can all faults be eliminated because the view of the transitory collection does not exist?

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so,

original: gti mug de nyid 'jig tshogs su lta ba kho na yin te /
analyzed: gti mug de nyid 'jig tshogs su lta ba kho na yin te /
translated: because that delusion itself is the view of the transitory collection.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi gti mug ni /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi gti mug ni /
translated: Afflicted delusion

original: 'jig tshogs su lta ba kho na yin no //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs su lta ba kho na yin no //
translated: is the view of the transitory collection.

original: dgra bcom rnams kyi shes pa gang //
analyzed: dgra bcom rnams kyi shes pa gang //
translated: The consciousness of the arhats

original: de ni nyon mongs can min te //
analyzed: de ni nyon mongs can min te //
translated: Is not afflicted.

original: des na 'jig tshogs lta ba ni //
analyzed: des na 'jig tshogs lta ba ni //
translated: Therefore, the view of the transitory collection

original: spangs pa de ltar rgyud grol lo //
analyzed: spangs pa de ltar rgyud grol lo //
translated: Is abandoned, and the continuum is liberated.

original: rig pa'i mi mthun phyogs nyid phyir //
analyzed: rig pa'i mi mthun phyogs nyid phyir //
translated: Because it is the opposite of knowledge,

original: sems byung nyid kyi dmigs pa'i phyir //
analyzed: sems byung nyid kyi dmigs pa'i phyir //
translated: Because it is the object of mental factors,

original: gsungs phyir log par dmigs pa nyid//
analyzed: gsungs phyir log par dmigs pa nyid//
translated: And because it is said to be a wrong view,

original: ma rig gzhan ni rigs ma yin //
analyzed: ma rig gzhan ni rigs ma yin //
translated: Other ignorance is not tenable.

original: gal te ma rig pa ni so sor rtog pa med pa'i rang bzhin yin la /
analyzed: gal te ma rig pa ni so sor rtog pa med pa'i rang bzhin yin la /
translated: If ignorance is by nature non-discernment,

original: 'jig tshogs su lta ba ni rtogs pa'i rang bzhin ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs su lta ba ni rtogs pa'i rang bzhin ma yin nam /
translated: And the view of the transitory collection is by nature discernment,

original: de ni ji ltar ma rig pa 'jig tshogs su lta ba nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ni ji ltar ma rig pa 'jig tshogs su lta ba nyid yin zhe na /
translated: How can ignorance be the view of the transitory collection?

original: skyon 'di med de gang gi phyir //
analyzed: skyon 'di med de gang gi phyir //
translated: This fault does not exist, because

original: so sor rtog med rang @136a * //🔽bzhin ni // ma rig yin na mya ngan las //
analyzed: so sor rtog med rang @136a * // bzhin ni // ma rig yin na mya ngan las //
translated: If the nature of non-discernment🔽Were ignorance, even nirvana would be that.

original: 'das pa'ang der 'gyur phung po rnams //
analyzed: 'das pa'ang der 'gyur phung po rnams //
translated: If the aggregates were exhausted,

original: zad na lus pa ci zhig yod //
analyzed: zad na lus pa ci zhig yod //
translated: What remainder would there be?

original: phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bdag nyid ni so sor rtog pa med pa gtso bor 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bdag nyid ni so sor rtog pa med pa gtso bor 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: The state of nirvana without remainder of the aggregates and the meditative attainment of cessation are characterized by the absence of discernment.

original: 'on te de ni nyon mongs pa'i gzhi nyid ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te de ni nyon mongs pa'i gzhi nyid ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the aggregates are not the basis of ignorance,

original: 'o na ni de ma rig pa'i mtshan nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: 'o na ni de ma rig pa'i mtshan nyid ma yin no //
translated: then ignorance is not the characteristic of the aggregates.

original: 'jig tshogs su lta ba nyid de'i gzhi yin pa'i phyir ma rig pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs su lta ba nyid de'i gzhi yin pa'i phyir ma rig pa yin gyi /
translated: The aggregates are ignorance because they are the basis of the afflicted view of the self,

original: gzhan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan pa ma yin no //
translated: but they are not ignorance itself.

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: Why is this?

original: rigs dang 'gal ba'i chos gzhan ni //
analyzed: rigs dang 'gal ba'i chos gzhan ni //
translated: Other dharmas that are incompatible with the family

original: ma rig chos min brdzun sogs bzhin //
analyzed: ma rig chos min brdzun sogs bzhin //
translated: are like the four: non-knowledge, non-dharma, falsehood, etc.

original: rig pa bdag med mthong ba ste //
analyzed: rig pa bdag med mthong ba ste //
translated: Knowledge is the vision of selflessness,

original: de dang 'gal ba bdag lta yin //
analyzed: de dang 'gal ba bdag lta yin //
translated: and its opposite is the view of self.

original: re zhig rig pa med pa ni ma rig pa ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig rig pa med pa ni ma rig pa ma yin te /
translated: First, the absence of knowledge is not ignorance,

original: de med pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa la yang yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa la yang yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because its absence exists in nirvana, and

original: med pa ni rgyu yang ma yin no //
analyzed: med pa ni rgyu yang ma yin no //
translated: what is absent cannot be a cause.

original: de las gzhan pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not something other than that,🔽because

original: gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: and form, etc. would also be ignorance.

original: de'i phyir ma rig pa ni rig pa dang 'gal ba yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir ma rig pa ni rig pa dang 'gal ba yin te /
translated: Therefore, ignorance is the opposite of knowledge,

original: chos ma yin pa dang mi bden pa bzhin no //
analyzed: chos ma yin pa dang mi bden pa bzhin no //
translated: like non-Dharma and untruth.

original: de yang 'jig tshogs su lta ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: de yang 'jig tshogs su lta ba nyid yin no //
translated: And that is the view of the perishable collection.

original: 'di ltar chos ni pha rol tu phyin pa rjes su 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid yin no ;
