analyzed: 'di ltar chos ni pha rol tu phyin pa rjes su 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid yin no ;
translated: Thus, Dharma has the characteristic of supporting the perfections.

original: / chos ma yin na ni de med pa tsam ma yin la de las gzhan tsam yang ma yin gyi /
analyzed: / chos ma yin na ni de med pa tsam ma yin la de las gzhan tsam yang ma yin gyi /
translated: Non-Dharma is not merely the absence of that, nor is it merely other than that.

original: 'on kyang rjes su 'dzin pa las bzlog pa gnod par byed pa'i chos ma yin pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang rjes su 'dzin pa las bzlog pa gnod par byed pa'i chos ma yin pa yin no //
translated: Rather, it is the opposite of support, the non-Dharma of harm.

original: de bzhin du yang dag pa'i don ston pa med pa tsam ni brdzun pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de bzhin du yang dag pa'i don ston pa med pa tsam ni brdzun pa yin gyi /
translated: Similarly, a lie is not merely the absence of the teaching of the true meaning.

original: 'on kyang yang dag pa ma yin pa ston pa /
analyzed: 'on kyang yang dag pa ma yin pa ston pa /
translated: Rather, it is the teaching of what is not true,

original: mi bden pa brjod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mi bden pa brjod pa ma yin no //
translated: the expression of what is not so.

original: de lta yin na gang gi tshe bden pa'i don la 'khrul pas med par sems pa na yod do zhes /
analyzed: de lta yin na gang gi tshe bden pa'i don la 'khrul pas med par sems pa na yod do zhes /
translated: Thus, when one mistakes the meaning of truth and thinks that what is not is,

original: ston par byed pa de'i tshe mi bden pa nyid du mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: ston par byed pa de'i tshe mi bden pa nyid du mi 'gyur la /
translated: When it is taught, it is not false.

original: med pa la yod par sems pa'i de'i yang brdzun yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: med pa la yod par sems pa'i de'i yang brdzun yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: And the thought that what does not exist does exist is also false.

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: This is not so.

original: sgra rnams rnam rtog yul can te //🔽dngos gang ji ltar rnam nges pa //
analyzed: sgra rnams rnam rtog yul can te // dngos gang ji ltar rnam nges pa //
translated: Words are the domain of conceptual thought.🔽Whatever is ascertained in that way

original: de bzhin nyid brjod bden pa ste //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid brjod bden pa ste //
translated: is the truth of reality.

original: gzhan du brjod pa brdzun pa yin //
analyzed: gzhan du brjod pa brdzun pa yin //
translated: Otherwise, it is said to be false.

original: sgra rnams ni lhag par nges pa'i yul can yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sgra rnams ni lhag par nges pa'i yul can yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Words are the domain of conceptual thought.

original: lhag par zhen pa rjes su mthun par ston pa nyid bden pa yin la /
analyzed: lhag par zhen pa rjes su mthun par ston pa nyid bden pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, it is reasonable that the teaching in accordance with the conceptual thought that is the domain of conceptual thought is the truth.

original: gzhan @136b du ni mi bden pa yin no zhes rigs so //
analyzed: gzhan @136b du ni mi bden pa yin no zhes rigs so //
translated: Otherwise, it is not the truth.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams la ni 'khrul nas sems can du bslus pa yang mchog tu kha na ma tho ba yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams la ni 'khrul nas sems can du bslus pa yang mchog tu kha na ma tho ba yin te /
translated: For bodhisattvas, the error of deceiving sentient beings is a grave offense.

original: des na de dag rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la mngon par brtson pa yin no //
analyzed: des na de dag rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la mngon par brtson pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, they strive for omniscience.

original: des na 'jig tshogs la lta ba nyid ma rig pa yin te /
analyzed: des na 'jig tshogs la lta ba nyid ma rig pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, the view of the transitory collection is ignorance.

original: rig pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rig pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no other factor that is incompatible with knowledge.

original: sems las byung ba nyid yin pa'i rgyus na /
analyzed: sems las byung ba nyid yin pa'i rgyus na /
translated: Because they are mental factors,

original: dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir log par dmigs pa nyid ma rig pa yin no //
analyzed: dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir log par dmigs pa nyid ma rig pa yin no //
translated: they are mistaken because they are the objects of ignorance.

original: rten dang dmigs pa dang / rnam pa dang dus dang / rdzas mtshungs pas mtshungs par ldan pa yin pa'i phyir mtshungs par ldan pa dag yin no //
analyzed: rten dang dmigs pa dang / rnam pa dang dus dang / rdzas mtshungs pas mtshungs par ldan pa yin pa'i phyir mtshungs par ldan pa dag yin no //
translated: They are associated because they are associated with the same basis, the same object, the same aspect, the same time, and the same substance.

original: gsungs pa'i yang phyir te shes rab kyi rnam pa las bzlog pa rtogs pa'i rang bzhin nyid ma rig pa yin par mdo de dang de las gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsungs pa'i yang phyir te shes rab kyi rnam pa las bzlog pa rtogs pa'i rang bzhin nyid ma rig pa yin par mdo de dang de las gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are also called ignorance because it is said that ignorance has the nature of non-understanding, which is the opposite of understanding, in this and that sutra.

original: de la ma rig pa dang bral ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la ma rig pa dang bral ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the absence of ignorance?

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin gyi chos rnams la lhag par sgro 'dogs pa dang bral ba gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du 'jig rten gyi nye bar spyod pa skye ba dang gang ji snyed pa de thams cad ni bdag tu lta ba mngon par zhen pa las byung ba yin te /
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin gyi chos rnams la lhag par sgro 'dogs pa dang bral ba gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du 'jig rten gyi nye bar spyod pa skye ba dang gang ji snyed pa de thams cad ni bdag tu lta ba mngon par zhen pa las byung ba yin te /
translated: And similarly, all mundane enjoyments and whatever is born arise from the manifest clinging to the view of the self.

original: bdag tu mngon par zhen pa bral na ni mi 'byung ngo zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag tu mngon par zhen pa bral na ni mi 'byung ngo zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: If one is free from manifest clinging to the self, they do not arise.

original: gal te bdag tu mngon par zhen pa ni lta ba yin la /
analyzed: gal te bdag tu mngon par zhen pa ni lta ba yin la /
translated: If manifest clinging to the self is view,

original: de yang ma rig pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang ma rig pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin no //
translated: it is concomitant with ignorance.

original: des na med na mi 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir lta ba'i sgo nas ma rig pa nyid gsungs par shes par bya'i /🔽'jig tshogs su lta ba nyid ni /
analyzed: des na med na mi 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir lta ba'i sgo nas ma rig pa nyid gsungs par shes par bya'i / 'jig tshogs su lta ba nyid ni /
translated: Therefore, since it is a necessary condition, ignorance should be understood to be taught from the perspective of view.

original: ma rig pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ma rig pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: The view of the transitory collection is not ignorance.

original: 'di yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: 'di yang mi rung ste /
translated: This is also untenable.

original: ma rig pa'i yan lag tu bstan na de'i rang bzhin bstan pa ni /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i yan lag tu bstan na de'i rang bzhin bstan pa ni /
translated: If it were taught as a link of ignorance, its nature would be taught.

original: bzhag nas de la gzhan ston pa //
analyzed: bzhag nas de la gzhan ston pa //
translated: and then to teach something else in place of that.

original: sgra la bzo ba ma yin no //
analyzed: sgra la bzo ba ma yin no //
translated: It is not a fabrication of words.

original: de ltar ma rig bstan 'di la //
analyzed: de ltar ma rig bstan 'di la //
translated: Thus, in this teaching of non-knowledge,

original: tshad ma cung zad yod ma yin //
analyzed: tshad ma cung zad yod ma yin //
translated: there is not the slightest bit of valid knowledge.🔽But in the opposite case, valid knowledge

original: bzlog pa la ni tshad ma dag / ji bzhin du ni bstan pa yin //
analyzed: bzlog pa la ni tshad ma dag / ji bzhin du ni bstan pa yin //
translated: is taught just as it is.

original: lta ba'i sgo nas ma rig pa nyid bstan pa zhes bya ba 'di la tshad ma ni cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: lta ba'i sgo nas ma rig pa nyid bstan pa zhes bya ba 'di la tshad ma ni cung zad kyang med do //
translated: In this section on the view, there is not the slightest bit of valid knowledge in the teaching of non-knowledge.

original: 'jig tshogs su lta ba nyid nges pa thams cad kyi gzhi yin no zhes bya ba 'di la ni tshad ma bstan zin to //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs su lta ba nyid nges pa thams cad kyi gzhi yin no zhes bya ba 'di la ni tshad ma bstan zin to //
translated: But in the case of the view of the transitory collection, it has been taught that it is the basis of all determinations.

original: gal te 'jig tshogs su ni so sor rtog pa med pa'i rang bzhin nam ni so sor rtog pa med pa'i rang bzhin nam @137a * //
analyzed: gal te 'jig tshogs su ni so sor rtog pa med pa'i rang bzhin nam ni so sor rtog pa med pa'i rang bzhin nam @137a * //
translated: Whether the view of the transitory collection is by nature non-analytical or not,

original: gzhan du yin yang rung ba ste /
analyzed: gzhan du yin yang rung ba ste /
translated: or whether it is something else,

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi rjes su song ba yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi rjes su song ba yin no //
translated: it is still the basis of all afflictions.

original: des na de ltar 'jig tshogs la lta bar brjod do //
analyzed: des na de ltar 'jig tshogs la lta bar brjod do //
translated: Therefore, it is called the view of the transitory collection.

original: khyad par gyi sgra ni spyi'i don can ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par gyi sgra ni spyi'i don can ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the word “only” does not have a general meaning.

original: de bzhin du gal te /
analyzed: de bzhin du gal te /
translated: Likewise,

original: ma rig pa lta ba nyid yin na /
analyzed: ma rig pa lta ba nyid yin na /
translated: if ignorance were a view,

original: de'i tshe lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i ma rig pa zhes mtshungs par ldan pa'i don yang med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i ma rig pa zhes mtshungs par ldan pa'i don yang med par 'gyur te /
translated: then there would be no such thing as ignorance that is concomitant with a view, because

original: de de nyid dang mtshungs par ldan pa ni ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: de de nyid dang mtshungs par ldan pa ni ma yin zhe na /
translated: it is not concomitant with itself.

original: 'di la brtsad pa'i lan /
analyzed: 'di la brtsad pa'i lan /
translated: The response to this objection is

original: 'gal ba gang yin 'dir bshad bya //
analyzed: 'gal ba gang yin 'dir bshad bya //
translated: The contradiction is explained here.

original: stong nyid lta ba de 'gal phyir //
analyzed: stong nyid lta ba de 'gal phyir //
translated: Because the view of emptiness contradicts that,

original: de yi rang bzhin nyes kun dang // 'gal bar rab tu grub pa yin //
analyzed: de yi rang bzhin nyes kun dang // 'gal bar rab tu grub pa yin //
translated: it is well established that it contradicts all faults.

original: spyi dang khyad par gyi dngos pos tha dad par brtags pas na mtshungs par ldan pa'i don du 'gyur te /
analyzed: spyi dang khyad par gyi dngos pos tha dad par brtags pas na mtshungs par ldan pa'i don du 'gyur te /
translated: Since it is imagined to be different by way of general and specific properties, it becomes the meaning of “concomitant,”

original: dper na pa la sha dang ldan pa'i nags zhes bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na pa la sha dang ldan pa'i nags zhes bya ba bzhin no //
translated: just as, for example, it is said that a forest possesses palasha trees.

original: don dam par ni pa la sha'i rang bzhin nyid du brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: don dam par ni pa la sha'i rang bzhin nyid du brjod pa yin no //
translated: In the ultimate, it is said that the nature of the palasha trees is the forest.

original: de bzhin du khyad par brjod pas de'i rang bzhin gyi ma rig pa gzhir gyur pas gtso bor bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du khyad par brjod pas de'i rang bzhin gyi ma rig pa gzhir gyur pas gtso bor bstan pa yin te /
translated: Likewise, since it is expressed as a specific property, ignorance, which is its nature, is taught as the basis and as primary.

original: 'di ltar ma rig pa ni bdag tu lta ba yin pa de'i phyir de'i rtsa ba can gyi skyon thams cad ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar ma rig pa ni bdag tu lta ba yin pa de'i phyir de'i rtsa ba can gyi skyon thams cad ni /
translated: Thus, since ignorance is the view of self, all faults that have ignorance as their root

original: rtsa ba gcod par byed pa'i bdag med par lta bas rtsa ba gcad pa'i phyir gcad par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: rtsa ba gcod par byed pa'i bdag med par lta bas rtsa ba gcad pa'i phyir gcad par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: will be cut off by the view of selflessness, which severs their root.🔽Since the view of selflessness stops all faults and since the yogi does not abandon it,

original: gang gi phyir nyes pa thams cad 'gog par byed pa ni bdag med par lta ba yin la de yang rnal 'byor pas ma btang ba yin pa de'i phyir 'ga' slar yang 'byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir nyes pa thams cad 'gog par byed pa ni bdag med par lta ba yin la de yang rnal 'byor pas ma btang ba yin pa de'i phyir 'ga' slar yang 'byung ba ma yin no //
translated: no fault will arise again.

original: des na 'gog pa'i rnam par nges pa 'byung ba nyid bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: des na 'gog pa'i rnam par nges pa 'byung ba nyid bshad pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the arising of the ascertainment of cessation is explained.

original: zad min srog chags chos nyid phyir//
analyzed: zad min srog chags chos nyid phyir//
translated: It is not exhausted because of the nature of living beings,

original: gzugs sogs bzhin min ma grub phyir //
analyzed: gzugs sogs bzhin min ma grub phyir //
translated: like form, etc., because it is not established.

original: gnyen po'i phyogs dang 'brel pa na //
analyzed: gnyen po'i phyogs dang 'brel pa na //
translated: When it is related to the antidote,

original: ldog pa dag kyang mthong phyir ro //
analyzed: ldog pa dag kyang mthong phyir ro //
translated: cessation is seen.

original: nyes pa thams cad 'gags pas ni //
analyzed: nyes pa thams cad 'gags pas ni //
translated: Since all faults are stopped,

original: sra shing slar yang skye med de //
analyzed: sra shing slar yang skye med de //
translated: it is solid and does not arise again.

original: de bdag nyid kyis 'brel med dang // thal ba bzhin du ma nges phyir //
analyzed: de bdag nyid kyis 'brel med dang // thal ba bzhin du ma nges phyir //
translated: and because of the fallacy of over-extension, like ashes.

original: zhes bya ba ni bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa dag go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa dag go //
translated: These are the verses in the middle.

original: gal te bdag bsgoms pas kyang thal bar 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te bdag bsgoms pas kyang thal bar 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
translated: If the self is seen, is there not the fallacy of over-extension?

original: des na bdag med par lta bas ci bya /
analyzed: des na bdag med par lta bas ci bya /
translated: Then what is the use of the view of selflessness?

original: 'dir lung ni bdag bsam par bya zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir lung ni bdag bsam par bya zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no zhe na /
translated: Here, the scriptural authority is the statement, “The self is to be contemplated.”

original: de yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang ma yin te /
translated: This is not so, because:

original: 'di ltar / gang zhig bdag mthong @137b de la ni //
analyzed: 'di ltar / gang zhig bdag mthong @137b de la ni //
translated: One who sees the self

original: nga zhes rtag tu zhen par 'gyur //
analyzed: nga zhes rtag tu zhen par 'gyur //
translated: always clings to it as “mine.”

original: zhen pas bde la sred 'gyur te //
analyzed: zhen pas bde la sred 'gyur te //
translated: Through clinging, there is craving for pleasure,

original: sred pas skyon rnams sgrib par byed //
analyzed: sred pas skyon rnams sgrib par byed //
translated: and through craving, faults are obscured.

original: bdag tu mthong ba ni nges par bdag la bdag tu zhen pa dang 'brel par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag tu mthong ba ni nges par bdag la bdag tu zhen pa dang 'brel par 'gyur ro //
translated: One who sees the self definitely clings to it as “mine.”

original: zhen pas kyang de'i bde ba la sred pa dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhen pas kyang de'i bde ba la sred pa dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Through clinging, one has craving for its pleasure.

original: gang zhig gang la zhen pa de ni de'i bde ba la sred par 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig gang la zhen pa de ni de'i bde ba la sred par 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: One who clings to something has craving for its pleasure.

original: dper na bu la sogs pa'i bde ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na bu la sogs pa'i bde ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the pleasure of a son and so on.

original: gal te bdag tu mthong ba la bdag la zhen par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba mi rigs pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te bdag tu mthong ba la bdag la zhen par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba mi rigs pa ma yin nam /
translated: If it is said, “It is not reasonable that attachment to self arises from seeing self,”

original: ci shing mthong ba tsam gyis shing la zhen par 'gyur ba'am /🔽bud med mthong ba tsam gyis /
analyzed: ci shing mthong ba tsam gyis shing la zhen par 'gyur ba'am / bud med mthong ba tsam gyis /
translated: is it that attachment to a tree arises merely from seeing a tree?🔽Or is it that attachment to a woman arises merely from seeing a woman?

original: bud med la zhen par 'gyur ba'am de bzhin du /
analyzed: bud med la zhen par 'gyur ba'am de bzhin du /
translated: Or is it that attachment to a man arises merely from seeing a man?🔽Or is it that attachment to a self arises merely from seeing a self?🔽It is said:

original: gang zhig bdag mthong de la ni //
analyzed: gang zhig bdag mthong de la ni //
translated: One who sees self

original: nga zhes rtag tu zhen par 'gyur //
analyzed: nga zhes rtag tu zhen par 'gyur //
translated: always becomes attached to it.

original: zhes bya ba mi rigs pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba mi rigs pa yin no zhe na /
translated: This is not reasonable.

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: This is not so.

original: gang zhig gzhan la chags pa de //
analyzed: gang zhig gzhan la chags pa de //
translated: If one who is attached to another

original: bdag la mi 'gyur gal srid //
analyzed: bdag la mi 'gyur gal srid //
translated: does not become attached to self,

original: bdag mthong nyid la zhen 'gyur te //
analyzed: bdag mthong nyid la zhen 'gyur te //
translated: one who sees self would become attached to self.

original: 'di la rtsod pa med pa nyid //🔽bdag chags med par gzhan la ni //
analyzed: 'di la rtsod pa med pa nyid // bdag chags med par gzhan la ni //
translated: This is not disputed.🔽It is difficult to accept that

original: chags zhes bya ba 'thad par dka' //
analyzed: chags zhes bya ba 'thad par dka' //
translated: one who is not attached to self is attached to another.

original: gal te bdag mthong ba tsam gyis chags pa ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te bdag mthong ba tsam gyis chags pa ma yin na /
translated: If attachment does not arise merely from seeing self,

original: 'ga' la yang chags par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'ga' la yang chags par mi 'gyur te /
translated: then attachment would not arise to anything.

original: rgyu gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no other cause.

original: shing ni bdag la nye bar mkho ba ma mthong ba des na /
analyzed: shing ni bdag la nye bar mkho ba ma mthong ba des na /
translated: The tree is not seen to be useful to itself,

original: zhen pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: zhen pa med pa yin no //
translated: so it is not attached to itself.

original: gang zhig bdag la nye bar mkho ba la chags pa med de /
analyzed: gang zhig bdag la nye bar mkho ba la chags pa med de /
translated: But how can it be that there is no attachment to what is useful to oneself?

original: ji ltar bdag la chags par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar bdag la chags par mi 'gyur /
translated: How can there be no attachment to oneself?

original: 'on te sems can gyi khyad par nyid kyi bdag nyid la ni zhen pa med la gzhan la ni bdag nyid chen po nyid kyis snying rje las zhen pa dang ldan pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te sems can gyi khyad par nyid kyi bdag nyid la ni zhen pa med la gzhan la ni bdag nyid chen po nyid kyis snying rje las zhen pa dang ldan pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But if there is no attachment to oneself, because of the distinction of sentient beings, then because of great compassion, there is attachment to others.

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: gal te bdag nyid chen po zhes //
analyzed: gal te bdag nyid chen po zhes //
translated: If it is called “great”

original: bya ba gzhan don byed na ni //
analyzed: bya ba gzhan don byed na ni //
translated: because it acts for the benefit of others,

original: rtogs pa sngon byed mi 'gyur te //
analyzed: rtogs pa sngon byed mi 'gyur te //
translated: then it would not have preceded the realization,

original: de lta yin na gtan med nyid //
analyzed: de lta yin na gtan med nyid //
translated: and in that case it would be absolutely nonexistent.

original: bdag nyid yal bar dor nas /
analyzed: bdag nyid yal bar dor nas /
translated: If, having abandoned itself,

original: rang gi ngo bo don gzhan la phan par byed pa na ;
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo don gzhan la phan par byed pa na ;
translated: it benefits another,

original: bdag gis rtog pa sngon du byed pa ma yin pa nyid chen por gsal bar byas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag gis rtog pa sngon du byed pa ma yin pa nyid chen por gsal bar byas par 'gyur ro //
translated: it would be clear that it does not precede the realization, and it would be great.

original: 'on te gzhan gyi don byed pa nyid kyis bde ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te gzhan gyi don byed pa nyid kyis bde ba yin no zhe na /
translated: But if it is the very activity for the benefit of others that is happiness,

original: de lta yin na rang gi bde ba la chags pas rmongs pa ji ltar thar pa yin /
analyzed: de lta yin na rang gi bde ba la chags pas rmongs pa ji ltar thar pa yin /
translated: then how can one who is confused by attachment to his own happiness be liberated?

original: de lta na yang /🔽de 'dra ba dag tshogs can ma'i //
analyzed: de lta na yang / de 'dra ba dag tshogs can ma'i //
translated: Even so,🔽the body of the one who is like that

original: @138a * // lus nyed par yang byed par 'gyur //
analyzed: @138a * // lus nyed par yang byed par 'gyur //
translated: is also made to suffer by the assembly.

original: gal te 'di ni ngan spyod na //
analyzed: gal te 'di ni ngan spyod na //
translated: If this is bad conduct,

original: ngan spyod 'di ni med pa nyid //🔽ji ltar rang gi don la gnas pa bsam gtan gyi bde ba 'dod pa de bzhin du tshogs pa can ma yin pa'i yan lag dang 'brel pa'i bde ba yang yin no //
analyzed: ngan spyod 'di ni med pa nyid // ji ltar rang gi don la gnas pa bsam gtan gyi bde ba 'dod pa de bzhin du tshogs pa can ma yin pa'i yan lag dang 'brel pa'i bde ba yang yin no //
translated: this bad conduct is nonexistence.

original: de'am gzhan la bde bar ni //
analyzed: de'am gzhan la bde bar ni //
translated: Just as one who is intent on his own purpose desires the happiness of meditative concentration, so too does one who is not intent on the assembly desire the happiness that is connected with the limbs.

original: khyad par yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: khyad par yod pa ma yin no //
translated: There is no difference🔽between the happiness of that one and the other.

original: de lta yin na tshogs par 'byung ba ma yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de lta yin na tshogs par 'byung ba ma yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then it does not occur in the assembly.

original: tshogs par ni mi 'byung ba nyid ni med pa nyid de de khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshogs par ni mi 'byung ba nyid ni med pa nyid de de khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not that it does not occur in the assembly, for it is nonexistence, and there is no difference between it and that.

original: dmyal ba la sogs par 'gro ba'i phyir mi rung ngo zhe na /
analyzed: dmyal ba la sogs par 'gro ba'i phyir mi rung ngo zhe na /
translated: It is not proper, because one goes to the hells and so on.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: This is not so.🔽

original: bdag nyid chen po'i khyad par nyid kyis so //
analyzed: bdag nyid chen po'i khyad par nyid kyis so //
translated: because of the difference in the greatness of the self.

original: gzhan gyi don du dmyal bar 'gro bar khas blangs pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don du dmyal bar 'gro bar khas blangs pa ni /
translated: The acceptance of going to hell for the sake of others

original: cher bdag nyid chen po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: cher bdag nyid chen po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: is the greatness of the self.

original: 'on te tshogs par dbyung ba ma yin pa'i tha snyad dang gzhan pa dag ni goms pa las bde ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: 'on te tshogs par dbyung ba ma yin pa'i tha snyad dang gzhan pa dag ni goms pa las bde ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: But if the conventional expressions of the non-separateness of the collection are the cause of happiness through habituation,

original: des na tshogs par dbyung ba'i tha snyad khas blangs pa nyid du sla'o zhe na /
analyzed: des na tshogs par dbyung ba'i tha snyad khas blangs pa nyid du sla'o zhe na /
translated: then it is easy to accept the conventional expression of the separateness of the collection.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: This is not so.🔽

original: khyad par du med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par du med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no difference.

original: de lta na yang bdag la sred pa dang bcas pa'i dbang gis nyes pa dang nyes pa med pa mnyam por byed do //
analyzed: de lta na yang bdag la sred pa dang bcas pa'i dbang gis nyes pa dang nyes pa med pa mnyam por byed do //
translated: Even so, through the power of craving for the self, one makes good and bad equal.

original: des na nyes pas bsgribs pas na //
analyzed: des na nyes pas bsgribs pas na //
translated: Therefore, because of being obscured by faults,

original: yon tan mthong ba yongs sred pa //
analyzed: yon tan mthong ba yongs sred pa //
translated: one is completely attached to seeing good qualities.

original: nga yi zhes de'i sgrub byed len //
analyzed: nga yi zhes de'i sgrub byed len //
translated: “ Mine” is the means of establishing that.

original: des na bdag mngon chags pa na //
analyzed: des na bdag mngon chags pa na //
translated: Therefore, because of attachment to the self,

original: de srid de ni 'khor bar 'gyur //
analyzed: de srid de ni 'khor bar 'gyur //
translated: for so long one will wander in cyclic existence.

original: bdag don dam par yod na /
analyzed: bdag don dam par yod na /
translated: If the self existed ultimately,

original: gang zhig de la 'khor ba de yang don dam pa nyid do //
analyzed: gang zhig de la 'khor ba de yang don dam pa nyid do //
translated: And that which is cyclic existence is also ultimate reality.

original: des na don dam par nye bar mkho ba gang yin pa /
analyzed: des na don dam par nye bar mkho ba gang yin pa /
translated: Therefore, whatever is ultimately necessary
